loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Clorinda es una madre de familia de 50 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Granja Sasape del distrito de Túcume, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Lambayeque conocido a nivel regional por sus vestigios arqueológicos que se han convertido en un atractivo turístico. La zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la venta de comida. Ella tiene un puesto que actualmente funciona frente al local de una institución bastante frecuentada por los pobladores del caserío y de zonas aledañas. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos platos de comida y algunas bebidas. El negocio goza de mucha acogida ya que ella brinda siempre un trato amable y prepara sus alimentos con muy buena sazón.

Su negocio ha experimentado un crecimiento durante los ultimos meses y ella está pensando en comprar mesas y sillas para atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Clorinda es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, en la zona donde vive es bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores del lugar. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y tener un local propio donde pueda instalar un restaurante.
texts.en:
Clorinda is a 50 year old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the village of Granja Sasape in Túcame, a farming district in Lambayeque Province, which is known regionally for its archaeological sites that have become tourist attractions. This area is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Clorinda has been selling food for six years. She operates a vending stand that has become a local institution since she is frequented by residents of the village and from the surrounding areas. Clorinda offers her customers a variety of dishes and drinks. Her business has earned much publicity because she always provides friendly service and prepares food with great flavor.

Since her business has experienced growth in the past few months, she wants to buy tables and chairs so that her customers will be more comfortable. To meet this objective, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

Clorinda is a hardworking and responsible woman. In the area where she lives, she is recognized and respected by the local residents. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and have her own location where she can open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs to improve the infrastructure of her food business

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA  sont  tous des femmes mariées  avec  en moyenne  41 ans,  2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles monogames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments alimentaires, des parures (tels les colliers pour la ceinture appelé “BAYA” utilisé par les femmes, avec  WANA C.),  de céréales, du bois de chauffe etc.
WANA C. compte acheter avec son  prêt  15 colis de parures auprès des fabricants  et grossistes au grand marché de Sikasso
Les parures sont vendus au  marché de Hamdallaye et en famille à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes au comptant et rarement à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 29 500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Sabougnouma group are all married women with a median age of 41 and two children. The majority of them live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the quarters in the village of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They are on their fifth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet their clients' needs. Their past loans have been repaid in full. This group of women sells food condiments, jeweled items (belts called "Baya" used by the women, primarily Wana C.), grains, firewood, etc. With her loan, Wana C. counts on purchasing 15 sets of jewels from the manufacturers and the wholesale distributors at the grand market of Sikasso. The jewelry is sold at the Hamdallaye market and to families, to a clientele composed primarily of women. Sales are done in cash and on credit. She foresees making a monthly profit of 29,500 FCFA, a part of which will be used for her family's needs while the rest will be invested in her business.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelery sets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair her billiard tables and buy accessories for her games.

loans.name: Minna Esi

texts.en: Minna Esi A. operates a provisions shop at Elmina.  Minna Esi has a senior high educational background.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a security man. Minna Esi has been operating a provisions shop for three years. She helps her husband take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy extra provisions to fill her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to establish another shop in a different location and if the business should expand, to build a house for her children.

loans.use: To buy extra provisions to fill her shop

loans.name: Neyler

texts.es:
Neyler vive en la provincia de Urubamba junto con su esposa y fruto de este matrimonio tiene dos hermosos hijos. Neyler es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor pues siempre está trabajando y así es la única forma de darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Neyler abrió una pequeña tienda que estaba ubicado en la ciudad de Urubamba,  donde vendía muebles y colchones. Hace 10 años se puso mal de la columna y tuvo que dejar de trabajar, Su esposa Gladys  tuvo que asumir los gastos de la familia, ella se dedica  a la venta zapatos, zapatillas y ropa de segundo uso llamada comúnmente por la gente “Ropa Americana”.
 
Actualmente Neyler se encuentra recuperado y mejor. Utilizo sus ahorros para abrir otro negocio en el mismo lugar donde vendía muebles y ahora vende zapatillas de marca.  Neyler  se dedica a este negocio porque hay demanda y porque la gente gasta dinero al viajar a la ciudad de Cusco a comprar zapatillas de marca. Le pueden encontrar en su tienda, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Neyler desprende una imagen de amabilidad y alegría. Un flujo regular de clientes visita su tienda porque vende productos de calidad y a costos razonables.     
     
Con su próximo préstamo, Neyler espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Por el momento, su tienda  esta modestamente equipado con mercadería necesaria.  El va emplear el dinero del préstamo para pagar los impuestos en la frontera de Chile y Perú de las zapatillas que compro de ese país.  

Neyler pertenece al banco comunal  “Señor de Torrechayoc” y es socio nuevo y es la primera vez que participa en el banco comunal pues su esposa Gladys le invito.
texts.en:
Neyler lives in the province of Urubamba together with his wife and with their two beauitiful children. Neyler is a hard working man and he worked all the time so that he could provide his children with a better quality of life. Neyler opened a small store in Urubamba where he sold furniture and matresses. But 10 years ago he started to have back problems and he was forced to stop working. His wife Gladys took over having to provide for the family's expenses. She sells mens and ladies' shoes and second-hand clothing, popularly named by the public "American Clothes". Neyler is recovering and is doing better. He used his savings to open another business in the same locale where he used to sell furniture but now he sells name-brand ladies' shoes. Neyler started this business given the great demand. Visitors to Cusco spend their money to purchase name-brand ladies' shoes. He can be found in his store all 7 days of the week, from 9 in the morning until 8 at night. Neyler always portrays an image of kindness and happiness. A regular flow of clients visits his store because he sells quality products at reasonable prices. He wishes to receive a loan of S/.1500 nuevos soles. Currently his store is modestly stocked with merchandise. He will use the funds to pay the import taxes from Chile and Peru, countries where he purchases the shoes. Neyler is a new member of the Community Bank "Senor de Torrehchayoc". It is the first time that he takes part in the Community Bank, following an invitation from his wife, Gladys.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the import taxes from Chile and Peru

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita J. is from the village of Libertad, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Teresita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste , biscuits, candies, milo (a malted chocolate beverage powder) and bread in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Marcela

texts.es:
María es una mujer trabajadora, dedicada al trabajo, pequeña comerciante que atreves de los años ha logrado captar sus clientes.
Se dedica a la venta de comida en frente de su casa, fritanga variada, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos, frescos, frutas, ahora tiene más producto que ante ya que solo vendía comida anteriormente,  los financiamiento han venido hacer una puerta de alternativa para mejorar sus ingresos que atreves de los cuales logra cubrir sus necesidades personales como pagos básicos, pagos del financiamiento.
Con este préstamo invertirá en productos de alimentos como: carne, pollo, quintal de maíz, bidón de aceite, manteca, frutas, verduras, golosinas entre otros para comenzar hacer mas comida esperando vender más,  para una mejor economía familiar.
texts.en:
María is a hard working woman who is devoted to work. She’s a small merchant who has secured a good customer base over the years. She sells prepared meals, various fried foods, sweets, soft drinks, juices, smoothies, fruits in front of her house. She now stocks more items; she used to just sell prepared food. The loans have been an alternative pathway to improve income in that they allow her to meet her personal expenses like utility payments and loan repayments. This loan will be used to buy food items like: meat, chicken, a quintal (equal to 46 kilos) of corn, a large container of cooking oil, lard, fruit, vegetables, sweets among others to start making more food and selling more to improve her family’s economy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy: chicken, a quintal (equivalent to 46 kilos) of corn, fruits and vegetables, sweets and others to increase sales.

loans.name: La Misiones Group

texts.es:
Banco de emprendimiento que se encuentra en su 2do ciclo integrado por 10 integrantes los cuales todos viven en la zona de San José 
Actividad  es variado como ser  venta de joyas, frutas, abarrote, comida, servicio, cosméticos, etc.   La  Presidenta: la Sra. Rosmery de 31 años y vive en la comunidad San José.Su Negocio es la venta de  joyas  y cosméticos   hace 8 año en la misma zona don de vive, Estado civil: concubina con el Señor Rider su actividad es la de albañil hace 10 años  y cuenta con 2 hijos  que se encuentran en edad escolar, con el dinero del crédito desea comprar cosméticos y joyas de catalogo que se encuentran en promoción.  
                                                                                                  La Secretaria es la Sra. Ana María vive en la zona de San José y cuenta con el negocio de venta de abarrote en san José en su mismo domicilio, su Estado civil: concubina  con el señor David que trabaja en la comunidad San Pablo en una empresa, su cargo es operador de oruga, los señores tienen un  hijo a su poder, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite, refrescos, etc. Al por mayor.
                                                                                 
La Tesorera es la Sra. Cristina  cuenta con el negocio de venta de fruta en la zona de la ramada estado civil: concubina con el señor Benedicto, albañil trabaja en la zona de san José  los señores cuentan con 4 hijos que se  encuentran en edad escolar, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de fruta al por mayor.                                                                                                        Los clientes se sienten muy agradecidos con la entidad financiera por depositarles la confianza a sus personas.
texts.en:
This enterprising bank, which is in its second loan cycle, consists of 10 members. All of them live in the San José zone. They have various business activities, such as the sale of jewelry, fruit, groceries, food, services, cosmetics, etc. The president is Sra. Rosmery, who is 31 years old and lives in the community of San José. Her business is the sale of jewelry and cosmetics. She has been in business for 8 years in the same zone where she lives. She lives with her partner, Señor Rider, who has been a bricklayer for 10 years. They have 2 children, who are of school age. With the money from the loan, she wants to buy cosmetics and jewelry which are on sale in a catalog. The secretary is Sra. Ana María, who lives in the San José zone and has a grocery business in her home. She lives with Señor David, who works in a business in the community of San Pablo, where he operates heavy machinery. They have one son in their care. She will use the money from the loan to buy sugar, rice, oil, sodas, etc., wholesale. The treasurer is Sra, Cristina. Her business is the sale of fruit in the La Ramada zone. Her partner is Señor Benedicto , a bricklayer who works in the San José zone. They have four children of school age. She will use the money from the loan to purchase fruit wholesale. These bank members are very grateful to this financial institution for the confidence shown in them.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and increase working capital

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 37 years old and married to Pauline Wanjiku, who runs a business that brings in an income of about $125 per month. They have two children in primary school. George has a quarry where he gets an income of approximately $113 a month. He has been in the business for a period of about eight years now.

He wants to use the loan to add more quarry space in order to increase his income. George hopes to buy more quarry land to be able to extract more stones for construction supplies, which will increase his profits and will help in paying school fees for his children. He also wants to use the extra profit to increase his investments.

loans.use: Add quarry space

loans.name: Anisie

texts.en:
Anisie is 33 years old and married with three children, who are 3, 5 and 8 years old.  Anisie is well known for her business selling a variety of goods such as cosmetics, drinking water and some other beverages.  Anisie has been in her business for about 5 years.  The business hours are from 6 am to 10 pm every day.

Although Anisie has been in business for about 5 years, her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully.  To address this, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, Irish potatoes, beans, etc.  If successful, Anisie will hopefully increase her sales as well as profits. This, in turn, will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and will improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, Irish potatoes, beans, etc.

loans.name: Shallot

texts.en: A. Shallot is 38 years old and she has three kids. She has been operating her food sales business in Rukungiri food market for the last eight years. 100,000 shillings is what she makes in a week  principally out of selling bananas. She joined this business after much reflection on how this business would be of benefit to her in the long run. After all the second thoughts, she set forth. With this loan she says she wants to buy more manure for her banana plantations so that she can get better yields.

loans.use: The purchase of  more manure for her banana plantations

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es socia del bancomunal Ccatun Saccha, tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija de 6 años.
Martha se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir importadas para damas caballeros y niños, vende a los colegas de su esposo por pedidos y le pagan en partes.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá para la compra de panteones, juguetes porcampaña navideña.
A Martha le gustan las reuniones de su bancomunal porque puede ahorrar y acceder al crédito, le gustan la capacitaciones porque le hablan de los valores, familia, matrimonio, hijos y del negocio.
Su sueño es comprarse un carro y tener su casa propia, porque por el momento vive en casa alquilada.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the community bank Ccatun Saccha. She is 29 years old, married and has a 6 year old daughter. Martha sells imported clothing for women, men and children. She sells to her husband's colleagues and they pay for their orders in parts. 

The loan that she is requesting will be invested to buy panettones and toys because the Christmas season is approaching. Martha enjoys the community bank gatherings because she is able to save and have access to credit. She likes the members because they talk about their values, family, marriage, children, and businesses. Her dream is to buy a car and have her own home because as of now she lives in a rented house.

loans.use: Purchase of panettones and toys.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao V. is a 60-year-old widow who earns her daily income by cultivating crops on her farmland, which she has owned a long time. She received the land from her grandmother in 1979. She can earn an income from her farming business of approximately $2 a day. She has four children who are already married. A couple of her children live with her and assist her in farming as well. Mao V. is looking for assistance to help her with building a bathroom and a toilet for her family, but it is not ready because she is lacking some funds. So Mrs. Mao V. has decided to borrow some funds from Kiva in order to pay for the building of the bathroom.

loans.use: To pay for building.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok K. is a hard working woman who has currently been living in Phnom Penh City. She was married, but she divorced her husband years ago. Sok K. lives with two married children and earns a living by planting various crops on their own farmland. Sok K. can earn an income of approximately $4 per day for managing the family’s expenses. Sok K. said that the main profit in her family comes from her son-in-law who works as a motor taxi driver. Currently, her son-in-law wants to purchase a trailer to connect with his existing motorbike, but he lack some fund. To see that, Sok K. wants to encourage her son-in-law and she will use her loan for him to purchase a trailer for connecting with an existing motorbike for providing service.

loans.use: Tto purchase a trailer for connecting with an existing motorbike for providing service.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ÑAUPASUNCHIS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladis; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pasteles, ella vende en forma independiente llevando a los diferentes colegios, ella prepara diferentes pasteles rellenos de mermeladas y manjares, la socia quiere tener una teinda donde pueda vender los pasteles. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar los pasteles.              
                                            
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gladis is a member of the ÑAUPASUNCHIS community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Gladis is 28 years old and lives with her partner and child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling cakes.  She makes her sales independently, delivering her products to different schools.  She makes different types of cakes filled with jam and caramel spread.  She would like to own a store where she could sell her cakes.

Gladis is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making her cakes.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making her cakes

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa D. C. lives in the village of Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old, married, has three school-aged children and makes a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells items people need daily such as shampoo, canned goods, snacks, soap and toothpaste. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns about 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2009, Ma. Teresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid three previous loans from HSPFI and is applying for a new one for 5,000 PHP to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional food items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mercedes De Gesus

texts.es: Esta señora es el primer financiamiento que obtiene con la empresa, es comerciante su negocio y para lo que solicito es para la venta de tortillas y leña, ella habita en el reparto el porvenir calle central jurisdiccion de quezalguaque, es ajuntada con un señor de aproximadamente 65 años es jubilado ella tiene 2 hijas mujeres una de ella estudia en el colegio de la comarca,  es una señora joven tiene su propia casa dicho negocio lo ejerce desde hace nueve años del cual ha logrado hacer una clientela fiel por su trato amable, varios de sus familiares incluyendo mama y hermanos viven en el mismo reparto,
texts.en: This woman is asking for her first loan for this business.  She is a businesswoman.  This business she wants the loan for is selling tortillas and firewood.  She lives at the entrance of El Provenir, Central Street, in the jurisdiction of Quezalguaque.  Her partner is a gentleman who is approximately 65 years old.  He is retired.  She has two girls, one of whom studies in the local high school.  She is a young woman who has her own home.  She has done this work for the past 9 years, and she has successfully gotten a loyal clientele due to her kind treatment.  Several of her family members including her mother and brothers live in the same area.

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith T. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 47 years old. Judith is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Judith has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Judith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Judith from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alejandro Cesar

texts.es:
ALEJANDRO CESAR B., ES DE MANAGUA, EL TRABAJA DIARIO COMO SEGURIDAD INTERNA, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE UN NIÑO, Y ESTE  ACTUALMENTE DEPENDE DE EL Y SE ENCUENTRA EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DON ALEJANDRO ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ARENA, CEMENTO, HIERRO PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR  UNAS PAREDES DE SU CASA DE HABITACION.
TODO ESTO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA Y BRINDARLES MEJORAS CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Alejandro Cesar B. is from Managua. He works every day as a private security guard. He is the father of a family with one school-age son who depends on him.

Alejandro went to CEPRODEL's office to request a new loan for making improvements to his home. He'd like to invest in the purchase of construction materials like sand, cement, and iron bars, which he will use to finish building some walls in his house. This will improve his home and offer better living conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Llurlith Lluiza

texts.es:
La señorita Llurlith es socia del banco comunal Las Luchadoras, del Distrito de Campo Verde, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 26 años de edad y es soltera.
Lleva 2 ciclos trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, tiene un multiservicio donde vende utiles escolares y artículos de bazar, entre otros.
Con su nuevo prestamos de S/.1,000.00 nuevos soles comprara; ½ millar de cuadernos,  5 cajas de lapiceros, 1 caja de lápiz, 1 caja de borrador, 3 doc. de colores, 2 doc. de juego de reglas, 3 doc. de cuaderno de dibujo, 3 doc. de caligrafía.
Con esto implementará un poco más el negocio ya que se encuentrean en campaña escolar, aprovechando que es soltera trabaja hasta los días domingos, porque son los días que sale la gente de la chacra para hacer sus compras.
Ella agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, gracias a los préstamos su negocio está creciendo poco a poco.
texts.en:
Llurlith is a member of the communal bank named "The Fighters" which is located in the district of Campo Verde in the Department of Ucayali. She is 26 years old and she is single. 

She has been with Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) through two loan cycles. She has a general store from where she sells school supplies, house-hold articles, and others.

With her new loan of S/1000 nuevos soles she will purchase 500 notebooks, 5 boxes of pens, 1  box of pencils, 1 box of erasers, 3 dozen colored pencils, 2 dozen sets of rulers, 3 dozen  drawing books, and 3 dozen calligraphy sets. 

With these items she will supplement her business inventory to get ready for the new school year. Taking advantage of the fact that she is single she is able to work even on Sundays. This is the day of the week that people leave their rural homes to make their purchases. 

She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos movement. It is thanks to these loans that her business has been growing steadily.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, pens, and colored pencils

loans.name: Francely

texts.es:
Francely G. A. aprendió el arte de vender al lado de su hermano quien tenía un almacén y en el que ella trabajó durante algún tiempo y descubrió sus habilidades para vender. Fue entonces cuando motivada por generar sus propios ingresos y contribuir con el pago de los gastos de la familia como se decidió a darle vida a su propi negocio, un local en el que vende mercancía. 

Después de quedar embarazada y asumir su rol como madre soltera, esta emprendedora mujer se empeñó aún más en su negocio, por ello actualmente necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones locativas y comprar mercancía con el fin de ofrecer mayor variedad y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Francely G. A. learned what it takes to run a business from her brother.  He used to own a store and she learned that she had a knack for selling when she worked for him there.  She decided to start her own business because she wanted to earn her own income and contribute to paying household expenses.  She found a space and started selling.

Francely is a single mother and she doubled her efforts to make a success of the business when she became pregnant.  She will use this loan to make improvements to her store and buy merchandise to stock it.  She wants to offer a wider range of products so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for retail business

loans.name: Sabra's Group

texts.en:
Sabra is a talented lady who operates a kite-making and selling business. She operates this business to financially support her family. Kite-making is a popular business in every city of Pakistan because people love to fly kites.  She makes good sales, particularly during the kite flying festival. In Urdu, the kite flying festival is known as "Basant". 

Sabra resides with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area of Shakr Gunj which is a small residential area in the city of Pakpattan. Pakpattan is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture. Her husband’s name is N. A. and he operates a fruit-selling business. His shop is located in the market and he offers good quality fresh seasonal fruit to his customers to earn income. 

Sabra has two sons and a daughter. All of them work to financially contribute to the family. Her elder son has a construction supplies business while the younger one works in a bicycle repair workshop. Her daughter sews clothes for her neighboring clients. 

Sabra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will utilize the loan to buy fresh seasonal fruit that will help him sell more and increase their earnings. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and Sabra is hopeful that an investment will be a profitable one for him and will bring more profits in result.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit for fruit-sales business.

loans.name: Marik Ole

texts.en:
Marik Ole O., 35 years old, is married with three children. He has been in animal trading for the last three years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client in his area of residence. This is his first loan with which he has planned to purchase some goats and sheep to sell later at a profit. He intends to use the return from the loan to expand the business and part to repay the loan.

He will use the anticipated income to educate his children to a higher level of education. His dreams are to be the best and best-known businessman in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase some goats and sheep for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 40 years old and married with three children. He sells scrap metals which are later used to make cooking pans, cooking pots and energy-saving cookers. He has been running the business for five years. In the future, he hopes to have a stable business. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy scrap metals.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

El socio Rosalio,  tiene 43 años de edad y El socio es conviviente; El socio  tiene 2 hijos, de 18, 11 años de edad;  El socio se dedica  a prestar el servicio de taxi, el socio es chofer de su propia unidad vehicular; en esta ocasión el socio desea invertir en el préstamo en la compra de llantas para su auto, el socio también hará el mantenimiento respectivo de su auto para que siga operativo y pueda seguir trabajando este mes, el socio con lo que gana del servicio de taxi puede invertir en casa dando la alimentación y haciéndose cargo de los gasto familiares. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de llantas para su auto y el mantenimiento de rutina.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Rosalio belongs to the community bank 'Caminemos juntas' (Let's walk together). He lives in the district of Huanchac in the Cusco province, located in the department of Cusco.

Rosalio is 43 years old and lives with his partner and two children who are 18 and 11 years of age. Rosalio operates a taxi service and drives his own vehicle. He would like to buy tyres for his car and take his car in for a service so he can keep his business running this month. With the income he earns from his taxi service Rosalio provides food for his family and takes care of their living costs. 

Rosalio is infinitely grateful for the valuable loan he will be granted which will allow him to improve his quality of life. He is committed to paying his loan installments on time.

loans.use: to purchase car tyres and service his car

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 48 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells both food and daily use products such as soap, shampoo and basic kitchen ingredients to the people in her community. Helen has had this business for five years.
Helen is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional retail items such as canned goods and soft drinks to increase her income. Each month, Helen earns about 4,000 PHP doing this type of work. In the future, Helen hopes to attract more customers to her business and earn more profit to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional retail items such as canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sewing thread and 50 cords for looms for embroidery business.

loans.name: Jasto

texts.en:
Jasto is 50 years old. He is from the Boyani area in Vihiga, and is married to Dinah Mdambo. They have three children who are in high school.

Jasto has a livestock business that he has been running for the past two years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy more goats to add to his current stock. 

He will use the anticipated profits he makes to cater to his family's needs and pay school fees for his children.

His future desire is to diversify into the poultry business.

loans.use: To buy more goats to add to his stock.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedroras Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Mujeres Emprendedoras, se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora Eligia, gracias que oyó hablar del proyecto e investigo sobre el tema, y como le gustó mucho organizó a sus amigas y vecinas de la zona. Actualmente se encuentran  en el segundo ciclo, con diez integrantes. 
Culminaron el primer ciclo sin inconvenientes, han demostrado unión y solidaridad entre las compañera. Se definen como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.
La Sra. Zunilda es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de artículos. Gracias a este trabajo ella puede tener un poco mas de ingresos y de esa forma solventar los gastos de la casa. Ella comenta que tiene muchos clientes, puesto que posee todo tipo de productos. Le gustaría algún día poder ampliar su negocio para tener mas capacidad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, cubiertos, ropas, y demás artículos para la posterior venta.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Entrepreneurial Women) committee was formed thanks to the initiative of Eligia who had heard about the project and decided to find out more.  As she really liked what she heard, she organized a group of friends and neighbors from her area.  The group is currently in its second loan cycle with ten members.  They completed their first loan cycle without any problems.  They have demonstrated mutual unity and solidarity.  The women describe themselves as very hard working and tenacious.

Zunilda is a saleswoman who sells all kinds of items.  Thanks to her work, she is able to make a little extra income and cover her household expenses.  She tells us that she has a lot of customers as she stocks all kinds of products.  She would like to be able to expand her business some day so that she has more capacity.

Zunilda is requesting this loan to buy sheets, covers, clothes and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy sheets, covers, clothes and other items

loans.name: Nancy Violeta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy; la socia tiene 55 años de edad, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 36, 31, 28 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene una tienda la cual antes solía ser panadería y luego fue refaccionada para una tienda de abarrotes, ahora ella desea arreglar el piso que es de cemento y ponerle piso de mayólica para poder alquilar su tienda a terceros y de este modo cobrar alquileres mensuales de su tienda. La socia dice que cuando ella tenia la tienda era muy tedioso ya que todo el día dedicaba todo el tiempo a la atención de su tienda sin poderse mover ahora ella decidió alquilarla y le rentara mensual y de mejor manera si ella no se quedara todo el tiempo y el día en casa con la tienda. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales como mayólicas y del obrero para arreglar el piso de la tienda antes de ofrecer en alquiler.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Nancy, 55, is a member of the “María Elena Moyano” communal bank located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.  She has three children who are 36, 31 and 28 years of age.  She’s married.  She has a store that used to be a bakery but was later remodeled into a grocery store. Now, she wants to fix the floor, which is cement, and tile it so that she can rent it out to others and collect rent every month.

She says that when she used to have the store it was very tedious because she spent all her time all day tending to the store without being able to move away from it so she decided to rent it out and collect monthly rent payments and not have to stay home all the time watching over the store.

She is asking for the loan to buy materials like tile and to pay the laborer who will fix the store’s floor prior to her putting it up for rent.  She is grateful for the support she’ll get and pledges to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy tile and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino is married with 2 children. Avelino is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Avelino is a farmer and grows fruit-bearing trees to earn a living. He has been doing this for 18 years. He has requested a loan for 40,000 to purchase fertilizers for his farmland. 
Avelino has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Flavia Francisca

texts.es:
Flavia, originaria de la isla de Ometepe situada en el departamento de Granada, tiene 57 años de edad, es viuda, madre de 4 hijos, ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de zapato. Flavia inicio vendiendo zapatos de  manera ambulante en los mercado de Granada , Masaya lo hacia con ayuda de su esposo ,luego solicitaron un préstamo con el fueron comprando mercadería para vender luego con el segundo crédito pudieron comprar un pequeño local en el mercado en el cual siguen trabajando hace 2 años que su esposo murió y ella dejo de vender en el mercado y solo siguió con la venta de zapatos la que en la actualidad sigue siendo su medio de trabajo el local en el mercado lo alquila de esta manera también obtiene otras ingresos. 
Requiere préstamo para comprar nuevo inventario de zapatos. Ella logro captar clientes que le ha estado solicitando mercadería de zapatos para abastecer su demanda, ella necesita mas inventario y esta inversión le permitirá cumplir con los pedidos que tiene, mejorar sus ingresos. Su próxima meta es establecer un local en la calle principal del comercio en Granada
texts.en:
Flavia is from the Island of Ometepe located in Granada Department.  She’s 57 years old and a widow.  She’s the mother of four children.  She’s a shoe merchant.  Flavia started out selling shoes as a street vendor in the markets in Granada and Masaya.  Her husband helped her.  Later, they took out a loan and bought merchandise to sell.  With the second loan they were able to buy a small stand in the market that they continued to use.  Two years ago when her husband died she stopped selling in the market and only kept the shoe sales which is still her source of work.  She rents out the stand in the market and this is a source of extra income.

She needs the loan to buy a new inventory of shoes.  She managed to obtain a clientele that has been requesting shoes and to meet customer demand she needs more stock inventory.  This investment will allow her to meet the pending orders she has and improve her income.  Her next goal is to set up a stand in Granada’s main commercial street.

loans.use: to buy new shoe inventory.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es: Ermelinda tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en una casa que actualmente cuida. Tiene 8 años de experiencia en la realización de bellos bordados artesanales, su arte para esta clase de trabajo hacen que su desempeño sea impecable y esto siempre lo demuestra en cada trabajo que le encomiendan sus clientes. Tiene mayores pedidos cuando son épocas festivas, sobre todo los meses de julio y agosto, cuando se celebran festividades en la zona, una de ella las fiestas de Santiago. Para Ermelinda esta es una gran oportunidad de trabajo, que además le permite estar cuidando a su pequeño hijo y por ser rentable ha decidió implementarse con más insumos. Esta es la quinta oportunidad en la cual esta solicitando un crédito y manifiesta que ha sido una de las mejores, para mejorar su economía. Ahora, con este dinero estará destinado en la compra de insumos principales que comprará al por mayor como telas e hilos de colores.
texts.en: Ermelinda is 31 years old. She lives with her husband and her son in a house she is taking care of. She has 8 years of experience making beautiful hand-made embroideries. Her artfulness makes her work impeccable and this is always shown in each job that her clients commission from her. She has more requests around holiday times, especially in the months of July and August when festivals are celebrated in the area, one of which is the festival of Santiago. For Ermelinda, this is a great opportunity for work, which also allows her to care for her small son. In order to increase her profits, she has decided to have more materials on hand. This is the fifth time she has requested and loan and she says this has been one of the best opportunities to improve her income. With this money she will buy important materials at whole sale price, such as fabrics and colored threads.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and colored threads

loans.name: Ri's Group

texts.en:
This is a loan group with four members that is located in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Ri was chosen as the team leader. She is 57 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their five children. All of her children are single and she is supporting them. They are attending primary and high school. Siem Reap province is an area with many kinds of businesses such as agriculture, livestock breeding, and fisheries. Currently, Ri is engaged in trading fish and she has been involved in this industry for many years. Ri earns enough income to cover her family’s expenses. She is a very hardworking woM. woM. who does different things to provide for her family. 

Ri is requesting a 100 USD loan to buy fish to sell and improve her family's living conditions. This will be the first cycle of this loan and her second cycle with the Kiva partner HKL. Ri and her family hope that her loan will help her family find happiness and prosperity and earn more profit. Ri is very grateful to all the kind donors who help her family. Her dreams are to have a larger house and educate all of her children at least through high school.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario tiene 31 años, es un hombre sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Feliciana de 30 años y fruto de ese amor tienen dos hijos Nelida y Marilyn, por quienes anhela dar una mejor calidad de vida. Hace 20 años, Mario, lleva dedicándose a la agricultura  quien se hizo conocedor de los cultivos que produce como: cacao y yuca; desde entonces se levanta muy temprano para poder ver sus tierras y las necesidades que puedan tener sus cultivos y obtener productos de calidad. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que gracias a las buenas cosechas que produce y el negocio que tiene puede solventar con los gastos de su familia. Por otro lado cuenta con un negocio de venta de abarrotes y siendo muy compicado tener capital para abastecer su tienda. Pero aún así Mario no pierde las esperanzas de seguir adelante y poder dar lo mejor a su familia. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual al pagar, para que pueda acceder a otro préstamo. En su banco comunal es participe en todas las reuniones que se realiza. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para su negocio como: arroz, azúcar, conservas, detergentes, entre otros.
texts.en:
Mario is 31, and is a modest hard-working man.  He lives in his own house with his wife Feliciana, who is 30. They have two children, Nelida and Marilyn, to whom they long to give a better quality of life. Mario has farmed for 20 years, and has become an expert on the crops that he produces, such as cacao and yucca.

During all that time he has gotten up very early to look over his land and the needs that his crops may have, in order to obtain quality produce. What he likes about his work, is that thanks to the good harvests that he produces and the business that he has, he can cover his family's expenses. 

Furthermore, he has a business selling groceries, and it has been very difficult to get working capita to stock his store. But even so, Mario isn't losing hope of moving forward, and being able to give the best to his family.

This is his 12th loan with MFP. He knows that he has to make his payments on time, in order to access another loan.  He participates in all the meetings of his communal bank.  With the 3,000 nuevos soles he is applying for, he will buy more products for his business, such as rice, sugar, preserves, detergents, and other things.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, preserves, and detergents to stock his store.

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion has been engaged in mixed farming for 10 years, selling his produce of milk and tea at the local market. He and his wife live in Litein Soth Rift, Kenya, with their four children, whose ages range between five and 15. Simion also runs a retail shop for additional income.

Simion has made a loan request of 90,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase two dairy cows. This is his second loan after his first one of 50,000 KES, which he promptly repaid. He is confident that the loan will boost his farming income and enable him to meet his family's needs.

He cites the high cost of dairy feeds as his primary challenge. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine, sells clothes. She is married to a businessman. They have four children aged between three and 14. They all go to school. She requested the loan to increase her business of clothes. She expects to use the profits from this business to build her house. She expects to have a large merchandise in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.en: Reymundo is 40 years old. He is married and has four children, three of whom are still studying. They live in Villa Concepcion, Isabela, where he manages their corn field. He has been on his farm for eight years. He only earned 5,000 PHP with his last crop because of an unexpected typhoon. His wife also operates a sari-sari store (variety store) based in their home where she sells groceries and daily goods. They are both thankful because the income they generate from their businesses helps them provide for their daily needs and enables them to continue sending their children to school. Now, Reymundo is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase corn seedlings and fertilizers for his corn farm business. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested and he promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase corn seedlings and fertilizers for his corn farm business.

loans.name: Maria Petrona

texts.es: Maria Petrona se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y frutas y verduras. Tiene más de 9 años de tener este negocio en el que diariamente tiene que levantarse temprano y atender a sus clientes. Tiene 5 hijos pero ninguno está bajo su cargo, siempre con el esfuerzo que realiza constante por medio de su trabajo fue que pudo brindarles lo necesario. Ella solicita este crédito con el fin de invertir en la compra de verduras, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, huevo, concentrado, maíz entre otros. Sueña con ampliar su local pues esto le beneficiaria al tener la facilidad de ampliar su inventario.
texts.en: Maria Petrona sells basic grains, fruits, and vegetables. She has been doing this work for over 9 years, and every day she has to get up early and tend to clients. She has 5 children but none of them are under her care. With constant effort, through this work she could always provide the necessities. She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables, rice, beans, sugar, oil, eggs, feed, corn, and other products. She dreams of expanding her business, and it will benefit her to be able to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, rice, beans, sugar, oil, eggs, feed, corn, and other products.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 21 years old, single, and has one child who attends school.  She lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. For the past three years, Edith has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Edith is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, which she will use to buy more clothes to sell. This loan will help Edith generate greater profits and pay school fees for her son. Edith hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Edith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Edith's future prospects by helping her to lending her money that has increased the capital of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is a woman of forty-six years, married and a mother of three children. She has a salon and a beauty shop in one of the markets in Nairobi and she has been in this business for eleven years now with a good monthly income which caters for her family's needs.

This will be Petronila's second loan with KADET LTD after she successfully repaid the previous one. She plans to use the entire loan to buy salon equipment and embroidery materials which she ventured into when she made profits in her previous loan. 

In future she would like to build a permanent house for her family at her rural home.

loans.use: To buy hair products for her salon/ beauty shop.

loans.name: Jesús Pan De Vida Group

texts.es: Carmen es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Jesús Pan de Vida” grupo conformado por 10 socios responsables y trabajadores. Carmen tiene 41 años de edad es casada y tiene 02 hijos actualmente sigue apoyando al menor de ellos ya que se encuentra en etapa escolar. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, también  a la compra y venta de productos como turrones, alfajores, queques entre otros, gracias a  su trabajo a mejorado la calidad de vida de ella y la de su familia, también nos cuenta que hace 06 meses inicio un nuevo negocio la cual instalo en su domicilio una pequeña bodega donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad, es de esta manera como Carmen a apoyado con los gastos del hogar. A futuro a Carmen le gustaría terminar de construir el tercer piso de su vivienda ya que tiene previsto alquilarlo. En esta oportunidad solicito el préstamo para la compra de leche, azúcar, arroz, y juguetes  para venderlos por fiestas navideñas. La Alcancía Comunal “Jesús Pan de Vida” están muy agradecidos y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien con el Programa-Prosperidad. Melina y Janet no pudieron estar presente en el desembolso por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the "Jesús Pan de Vida" communal bank, which is made up of ten responsible and hard-working members. Carmen is 41, married, and has two children. Currently she continues to support the youngest of these, as the child is of school-age. 

She sells beauty products, and also buys and sells products such as nougats, cookies, cakes, and other items. Thanks to her work she has improved the quality of life for her and her family. 

She also says that six months ago, she started a new business that she set up in her home. It is a small general store, where she sells basic household necessities. This is the way Carmen has helped with the household expenses. 

In the future, Carmen would like to finish building the third floor of her house, as she has plans to rent it. On this occasion, she applied for he loan in order to buy milk, sugar, rice, and toys to sell during the Christmas holidays. 

The members of the "Jesús Pan de Vida" communal bank are grateful, and promise to continue working well with Programa Prosperidad. 

Melina and Janet could not be present at the disbursement meeting due to work reasons.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, rice, and toys.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 27 years old and single.  He does mixed farming; he grows crops and also does dairy farming to earn a living.  He has been in the business for three years.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money.  His desire over the coming five years is to add cows to his farm.

Titus has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Le Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “La Esperanza 2” en homenaje a la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya; ya que las mismas señoras tendrán nuevas oportunidades  para emprender un mejor trabajo, colaborando con los ingreso de su hogar y así brindarle a sus hijos un mejor bienestar. El grupo está en el quinto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación Paraguaya.
Nilda vende ropas desde hace ya un tiempo, cuenta que tiene muy buena venta ya que siempre tiene buena variedad de prendas y es ello lo que atrae a los clientes. Gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y también ayudar a su familia con los gastos diarios. Su meta es tener una gran tienda de ropas donde poder ofrecer más.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, pues estamos en el verano y necesita abastecerse con mejores productos.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “La Esperanza 2" (Hope 2) in tribute to the opportunities that are provided by the Fundación Paraguaya, since these women will have new opportunities to start up a better business, contribute more income to their households, and in this way provide for the well-being of their children.  This group is in its 5th loan cycle in the Enterprising Women program of the Fundación Paraguaya.

Nilda has been selling clothing for a while.  She tells us that she has very good sales, because she always has a good variety of garments, and this is what allows her to attract customers.  Thanks to her work, she has been able to get ahead and also help her family with the household expenses.  Her goal is to have a big clothing store where she could offer more clothing for sale.

She is requesting a loan to buy summer clothing, as it is now summer and she needs to stock up with better products.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing to sell

loans.name: Armin

texts.en:
Armin is 37 years old and married with four children. For the past fifteen years, she has been a rice farmer and she also earns additional income from running a general store.

Armin is requesting 40,000 PHP loan through GDMPC to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Mary is a woman who is very dedicated to her family. She has 4 children who all go to school except for one who is 21 years old and works. Maria\'s children are the most important thing to her, and she wants to offer them a good education and a better quality of life. She began her own business a few years ago in order to help her husband cover household expenses. He works for a travel agency but his income is not enough to cover the family\'s expenses. Maria makes Mexican food. Each day her business grows. She needs a $200.00 USD loan to buy basic material in order to increase food production. Maria says that her customer base has increased but that she doesn\'t have enough economically to meet the demand. She needs your help and generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria es una mujer muy entregada a su familia, tiene 4 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando, sin embargo uno de ellos tiene 21 años y ya se encuentra trabajando. Para Maria sus hijos son lo más importante de su vida y quiere ofrecerles una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Por tal motivo ella inició su propio negocio hace algunos, años ante la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar debido a que su esposo trabaja para una compañía de viajes pero sus ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir con los gastos de la familia. Maria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas mexicanas y cada día su negocio va creciendo.

Ella necesita un préstamo de $200 USD para comprar materia prima que le permita aumentar la producción de sus comidas, Mari comenta que sus clientes han aumentado, pero no cuenta con la capacidad económica para cubrir toda la demanda, por lo que necesita de tu ayuda y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Peris Wanjiru Mwangi intends to set-up a milk selling business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok R., 49 years old, is a mother of 8 children (two of whom are pictured here) and lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband who is 62 years old operate a mat-making business and sell mats to retail stores and a nearby market. In order to expand their business, the couple is asking for US$1200 to purchase more raw materials to make additional mats in response to the growing demand.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her mat-making business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 30 years old. She has 2 young children. Her economic activity is farming. With the revival of the Kenya Cooperative creameries, the market for the dairy products has greatly improved. The Government efforts to sell dairy products to the neighbouring countries have been very encouraging. Eunice has a plan to improve her dairy farming through the use of high quality dairy feeds and supplements. She also plans to use the Artificial Insemination for her dairy cow for better calves. Eunice has applied for a loan of USD 150 through her group. She will repay the loan instalments on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy Dairy feeds – The dairy meal and bran

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar is 49 years old, married, with 7 children, 4 of whom are independent and 3 are high school students. Edgar repairs and maintains automotive turbo engines in his own shop for 4 years. He has been in the profession for 24 years, working with a friend, then dedicating himself to opening his own shop. Today he maintains a solid client base satisfied with his good work. He employs 2 people. Edgar dreams of having in his shop a lathe (a machine that makes pieces for the turbo engines) and an inventory of parts for all kinds of vehicles to better serve his clients, who currently have to purchase the parts elsewhere and return to Edgar's shop for the vehicle repair. The loan he seeks is to purchase various turbo engine parts.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Edgar tiene 49 tiene 49 años, está casado, tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales 4 son independientes y los otros 3 son estudiantes de la educación secundaria. Don Edgar se dedica a dar servicio de reparación y mantenimiento de turbo a automóviles exclusivos, tiene su taller propio hace 4 años. Adquirió la profesión hace 24 años en donde trabajaba en sociedad con un amigo, luego se decidió a dar apertura a su propio taller en forma independiente, y hasta la fecha mantiene una clientela formada y satisfecha por sus buenos trabajos. Actualmente da fuente de trabajos a 2 personas. El Sr. Edgar sueña con tener en su taller un torno (maquina que se encarga de fabricar las piezas de los turbos) y un inventario de repuestos para todo tipo de vehículos y así brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes que en este momento deben recurrir a una casa de repuestos para la compra del mismo y luego visitar el taller de Don Edgar para la reparación de sus vehículos. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de repuestos de varios para turbos de vehículos.

loans.use: Purchase various parts for turbo engine vehicles.

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo S. is a married mother with 2 children; she is 31 years of age and hails from Ibiye, a semi rural area in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells clothes. She has been in business since the year 2004. She hopes to get the loan of $800 to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Fredevinda

texts.es:
Fredevinda belongs to the Communal Bank of Virtuous Women. She lives in the district Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 50 years old and is the mother of one son who is already independent, but who is always by her side. Her husband works in the manufacturing of footwear, but the income that he brings in is not enough for their household expenses. So, Fredevinda, with the first loan received from Manuela Ramos of $ 100.00USD, decided to invest in the sale of food.

They have now reached a position of selling meals in the number 2 market of the city. She sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. The typical foods she sells are "juanes, rice chaufa, anticuchos", etc. (food of the region). She rises at dawn to prepare breakfast for their customers, and then prepares lunches and dinners that sell in the afternoon and evening. With this recent loan requested from Manuela Ramos of S /. 1,500, (approx. $ 502.00 USD), which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy two sacks of rice, 10 kilos of potatoes, four chickens, some fish, 1 sack of sugar, onions, tomatoes, bananas, etc.

Fredevinda is very happy to see that her business prospers, and says that it feels very good to work with Manuela Ramos. She tells us that these loans which are offered to women are a great support.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Fredevinda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Virtuosas, vive en el Jr.Luis Antunez de Manolo S/N, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años de edad y es madre 1 hijo que ya es independiente pero que siempre esta a su lado, su esposo trabaja en la confección de calzados, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para sus gastos familiares, es así que Fredevinda, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en la venta de comida. En la actualidad cuenta con una puesto de venta de comidas en el mercado Nro. 2 de la ciudad, en las mañanas vende desayunos, almuerzos, y por las noches vende afuera del mercado cenas, juanes, arroz chaufa, anticuchos, etc. (comida de la zona). Se levanta en la madrugada para preparar el desayuno de sus comensales (clientes) y después prepara los almuerzos y las cenas que venderá por la tarde y la noche. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1.500, (US$ 502.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 2 sacos de arroz, 10 kl. de papas, 4 pollos, S/. 30 en pescado, 1 saco de azúcar, cebolla, tomate, plátano, etc. Fredevinda está muy contenta al ver que su negocio prospera, se siente muy bien trabajando con Manuela Ramos, nos dijo que es un gran apoyo el préstamo que les brinda a las mujeres.

loans.use: Purchase of food products to supplement her business (two sacks of rice, 10 kilos of potatoes, four chickens, some fish, 1 sack of sugar, onions, tomatoes, bananas, etc.)

loans.name: Sri

texts.en: Sri D., 22, has no children yet. She sells cosmetics on credit, door-to-door in the villages to earn income for her family. Her husband Andri has been unemployed for a long time. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $125 to buy additional cosmetics. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy various cosmetics

loans.name: Bogdana

texts.en: Bogdana A. is 22 years old, but already has four kids. She lives with her boyfriend who is a constructor and works in the capital city of Sofia. Bogdana breeds 7 goats on a farm in her native village. The loan she is applying for will be spent on buying fodder.

loans.use: To buy fodder

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mrs.Vann S. has lived in her rural village since she was born. She is 32 years old and is married with five children, two of whom are students, while the other children are too young. Her husband, Vann Sang, is a fisherman, and can make around $7.50 per day. She would like to request a loan in order to buy fishing equipment, fertilizer , and a plow for her field.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment, fertilizer , and a plow.

loans.name: Lupita

texts.es:
“It has been several months since I received my residence and now I would like to enlarge it a bit since the space that I have is very small. I know I will have to do a little at a time since my financial situation is very difficult. However, I will work so that I can have my house with more comforts and more space” I am requesting USD $500 to enlarge my residence.
Translated from Sapnish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.
“Hace algunos meses que me entregaron mi vivienda, ahora me gustaría ampliarla un poco ya que el espacio que tengo es muy pequeño, se que tendré que hacerlo poco a poco ya que la situación económica esta muy difícil, pero voy a trabajar para poder tener mi casa con más comodidades y más espacio” Solicito  $ 500.00 dlls para ampliar en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Construction of a room.

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokchea O., 49, and her husband, Mr. Phan Tem, 57, were married in 1979 and have four sons. One of their sons is married and lives outside the family home. Of their other three sons, one works in a garment factory, one helps his parents in raising pigs and producing rice wine at home, and one is in school. The family lives across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sokchea and her husband have been in the business of raising pigs and producing rice wine for over two years. They buy piglets from farmers in the same village and nearby villages and sell the raised pigs to the middle man who will take it to sell in another place.

Nowadays, pig has a good price so Mrs. Sokchea wants to expand her farm and buy more piglets for raising. She is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase piglets for raising.

loans.use: To purchase to purchase piglets for raising.

loans.name: Net

texts.en: Mrs. Net K. lives in Khnong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a basket maker in the local village. Aside of this business activity, Mrs. Net K. is a fish seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Theng Pen, is a fisherman. They have one child who is studying in a state school. The family members now are in poor conditions and they live in an old house. Additionally, Mrs. Net K. now is building a new house; unfortunately, she has insufficient money to build it. Thus, Mrs. Net K. decided to ask for a loan to add with her profit in order to build a new house to replace the old one. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To build a new house to replace the old one.

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en: Pelenatete L., 38, is married with 5 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the village and public people 5 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  This will be her first.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (approximately $125 USD).  SPBD loans are Pelenatete’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This loan will be used for the business.  Her husband also helps out with the business.

loans.use: To buy flour and also for home improvements

loans.name: Amina's Subira Huleta Kheri Group

texts.en:
Amina is a 36-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 3 and 16. She has been a charcoal seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 6:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $33 from her sales.

In the past, Amina has had two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She will use this loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatuma.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Kheav

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheav P. is 38 years old, and she is the mother of seven children. Three of her children attend the local school, while the remaining four children are too young to work or study. She owns a small grocery store in the local market, which is located in Taing Tbeng Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Meanwhile, her husband, Mr. Huon Haor, breeds pigs and cows.

Because her husband's cow-breeding business has been doing very well, he wants to expand the business. Accordingly, Mrs. Kheav P. decided to ask for a loan to buy cows for breeding purposes. This is the second loan Mrs. Kheav P. has sought; previously, she obtained a loan to start a pig-breeding business, and she fully and promptly repaid that loan.

loans.use: To expand her husband's cow-breeding business by purchasing additional cows

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en:
Greetings from Gaudance on the shores of Lake Kivu in Rwanda! Gaudance is 32 years old and married with two children. 

She sells fish because her family lives near Lake Kivu, the biggest lake in Rwanda. She buys fish direct from the fishermen and sells them in the market places in Gisenyi town markets and restaurants. She earns about $90 a month from her business activities.

Gaudence is requesting a loan worth 301,895 Frws to buy more fish to sell to a growing number of clients in town. The loan period is eight months.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lino

texts.es: Lino tiene 23 años, vive solo en un cuarto que alquila cerca de su trabajo. El es un joven muy trabajador y empeñoso, se ha venido dedicando, desde hace ya 3 años, al negocio que con mucho esfuerzo inicio, su taller de carpintería. Este taller está creciendo, Lino ya cuenta con un ayudante que lo apoya, trabajando juntos duro y parejo, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de noche elaborando diversidad de muebles. A Lino le grada su trabajo, ya que le gusta crear, muchas veces inventa los modelos de las camas, sillas, mesas, etc. Lo único difícil es la adquisición del material para la elaboración de estos muebles, los cuales van subiendo de precio. Lino quiere ser un joven empresario con un futuro prometedor. Es así que con el dinero del préstamo adquirirá material para elaborar muchos más muebles, para consolidar su negocio y que sea mucho más amplio.
texts.en:
Lino is 23 years old. He lives alone in a room that he rents near his work. He is a hardworking young man. He has been working, since 3 years ago already, in his carpentry business, which he started up with much effort. This workshop is growing. Lino already has an assistant who helps him, working hard and equally together from 8 in the mornting until 7 a night making a variety of furniture. Lino appreciates his work, as he likes to create. He often invents the models for the beds, chairs, tables, etc. The only difficult thing is to acquire the materials for making this furniture, as their prices are rising. Lino wants to be a young businessman with a promising future. Accordingly, with the money from the loan he will purchase material to make a lot more furniture in order to strengthen his business and make it much bigger.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the materials necessary for making furniture

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Mrs. Ellen D. S. is  37 years old, married with 1 child.  Her husband used to be an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) but he decided to come home and stay with his family. It was then that they started a mini grocery store located on the national high way of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

For more than two years now, the store has been doing great. Ellen's husband cultivates land for additional income.
 
Ellen joined Paglaum MPC as she admired the programs and services that the cooperative offered.

Paglaum MPC is her new partner in business. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $1025 as additional capital for  her business. The loan will be used to purchase additional grocery stock for her mini grocery store.

Ellen's dream is to build a one stop shop grocery store and to use the proceeds from the business to send her son to school for a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stock

loans.name: Zauyara

texts.en:
Zauyara is thirty-five years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Two of her children are in elementary school; the last-born is still breastfeeding. With the help of the government's free compulsory basic education, many mothers have sent their children to school to learn about their future careers. 

She lives in Ejura, a farming community in the Ashanti region, with her family. Ejura has a mix of all tribes of people, such as the Ashanties, northerners, and the rest. 

She sells "gume," which is a type of brown rice that is used most often to prepare what we called "waakye" (a mixture of rice, beans, tomatoes, and spices). Waakye is enjoyed with stew or shito by many Ghanaians, because of the aroma and the taste. Gume is just an ordinary rice, but it has a different taste and color. Zauyara buys her rice directly from the farmers to avoid middlemen. 

Zauyara has been in this business for the past twenty years, and has lots of marketing experience. She inherited this business from her mother, whom she worked with during her childhood. 

Zauyara wants a loan to buy more gume to supply her customers, who travel from very far places to purchase it. She believes the loan would help her to support to her children's education better and to revive her business. 

She is member of the “Trust in God” trust group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days. and her picture was taken during her group meeting. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy gume (brown rice) in bulk

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
