La Señora María Magdalena Santamaría Ríos tiene la edad de 39 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña María tiene 2 hijos de las siguientes edades su hijo mayor de 14 años cursa el 2 año de secundaria y su hijo de 5 años cursa el 3 nivel de preescolar, su compañero de vida labora por cuenta propia, sus propósitos son seguir manteniendo la atención de sus clientes y así mismo el nivel de calidad del pan que ella elabora ya que tiene que ofrecer a sus clientes lo mejor los sueños de Doña María como el de toda madre es dar lo mejor de ella para sus hijos, apoyándoles y brindándoles su ayuda en cualquier circunstancias para que puedan llegar a ser profesionales de éxito servidores de la sociedad, del país y de su propio hogar, el deseo de Doña María Magdalena  es que Dios le siga concediendo las fuerzas y la salud para seguir trabajando duro y ver algún día pero no muy lejano, su negocio mas surtido para poder mejorar su vivienda y disfrutar de mejores condiciones junto a su familia.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica la Señora María Magdalena es la elaboración de pan, ella ofrece variedades como pan dulce, pan simple, cachos, picos, bonetes, pudín, entre otros, el negocio esta ubicado del Colegio José de la Cruz Mena ½ cuadra al oeste, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio son 5 años, Doña María empieza su negocio como un proyecto, ya que para el año 2001 quedo desempleada dado a un recorte de personal en la empresa que ella trabajaba y solamente su marido quedo trabajando, por lo que ella necesitaba proporcionar ingresos  a su familia , es entonces que decide establecer una panadería en su casa de habitación aunque al principio no fue fácil realizar este tipo de trabajo, sin embargo Doña María aprovecho la oportunidad ya que esa seria la única panadería ubicada en ese sector y fue así como surge su nuevo negocio por lo que necesita este financiamiento para la compra de mas materia prima y así suplir las demandas de sus clientes como lo es harina, huevo, mantequilla y sartenes de moldes y agradece a Fundación León 2000 y organizaciones amigas que contribuyen a esta causa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Magdalena S. R. is 39 years old, she is married and has two children. Her oldest son is 14 years old and is in his sophomore year, and her 5 year old son is in kindergarten. Her husband works by himself, and her objective is to keep the quality of the bread that she makes, and to maintain her customer's satisfaction. Maria wants to provide the best for her children so that they can become professionals and give back to society. Maria wishes that God gives her strength and health in order to continue her hard work and be able to improve her home and living conditions and enjoy them with her family. Maria has a breadmaking business. She makes different types of bread such as sweet bread, simple bread, and pudding (among others). She has had her business for the past 5 years. Maria started her business after she was laid off from the company where she worked in 2001, and since her husband was the only one working she needed to start working in order to help support her family. At that moment she decided to open a bakery in her home. Although at the beginning it was not easy, Maria has used the opportunity that her bakery is the only one in the neighborhood. Maria needs financing in order to buy raw materials such as flour, butter, eggs, and baking pans. She is grateful to the Leon 2000 Foundation and all other foundations that have helped her.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cereceda, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her bakery.

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Choeurn S. is a farmer in Kouk Penh village in Kampong Chhnang province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Lout Try, is a firewood seller. Even though they try to do work hard, they still earn less income to provide a better house for their family living. Thus, Mrs. Choeurn S. has decided to ask for a loan to add her saving to build a new house for her family. She is 45 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a farmer who helps the mother work and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To help buy a new house for her family

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход 27 летний мужчина , женатый , отец двоих детей. Жена работает телефонисткой.Сам Фарход продаёт на рынке лотереи лото спорта.Кроме этого у него есть свой оборотный капитал в бизнесе животноводства.Он покупает худой скот подешевле и откормив его продаёт через 4-5 месяцев.Фарход хочет в кредит отремонтировать хлев, где он держит скот.Для чего он и обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Farhod is 27 years old, married, and the father of two children. His wife works as a telephone operator. Farhod himself sells tickets for lottery games. In addition he has his own working capital in the livestock business. He buys underweight livestock cheaply and after fattening them for 4-5 months, sells. Farhod would like a loan in order to repair the shed where the livestock are kept. For that reason he came to Microinvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feed and sale

loans.name: Angela Dominga

texts.es: La señora Ángela Dominga B. tiene la edad de 43 años habita en Las pilas Oriental ubicado en la ciudad de Masaya, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como administrador de un pozo de agua potable para poder ayudarle con los gastos del hogar; ellos tiene a su cargo cuatro hijos uno de ellos trabaja y estudia los otros tres solo estudian y le apoyan con el trabajo agrícola en sus tiempos libres, dona Ángela desde hace 25 años trabaja como agricultora el rubro que ella trabaja es el plátano , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , inicio estas labores con ayuda de su papá , los planes hacia su familia y su producción es mejorar para poder tener mejores ingreso . Ella con el financiamiento  va a comprar material vegetativo e insumos para lograr una buena producción.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ángela Dominga B. is 43 years old and lives in Las Pilas Oriental, located in the city of Masaya. She lives with her husband who runs a well of drinkable water to be able to help with the expenses of the home. They have four children under their care; one of whom studies and works, and the other three just study. They all help with the agricultural work in their free time. Mrs. Ángela has worked for 25 years farming plantains. The hardest part of her job is the lack of money. She began working with her dad's help. Her plan for her family and for her work is to be able to have higher earnings. With the loan she will buy plant materials and supplies to improve production.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and fertilizer to improve crops

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es: Dionisio tiene 44 años, vive con su madre anciana en su propia casa. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la compra y venta de animales en la feria ganadera más cercana a su localidad. Sus padres le enseñaron este negocio, que hoy es el sostén económico de su casa, cada día Dionisio selecciona cuidadosamente a los animales que ha de comprar para obtener buenas ganancias y recuperar su capital. En sus inicios fue víctima de engaños cuando  le vendían animales enfermos que le generaban pérdidas, aun así, con su constancia y perseverancia logró en la actualidad las ganancias de su trabajo, y la suficiente experiencia para evitar se engañado. Su deseo a futuro es tener mayor cantidad de animales para incrementar sus ventas y ganancias. Es la segunda vez que Dionisio tiene un préstamo con MFP, él desea seguir trabajando solidariamente con su banco comunal para mejorar como persona y en su negocio. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más animales; como ovejas y cerdos jóvenes, de esta manera el acrecentará su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Dionisio is 44 years old and lives with his elderly mother in a home that he owns. For 20 years, he has bought and sold animals at a livestock market in his neighbourhood. His parents taught him this trade and it has provided for his household's needs. Every day Dionisio carefully chooses which animals to purchase in order to make a decent profit and get a good return on his investment. When he first started, he was sometimes tricked into buying sick animals that he could not resell and so lost money, but with consistency and perseverance he gained the necessary experience to become the successful trader he is today - making a profit and avoiding people's schemes. His goal for the future is to own a larger number of animals so that he can increase his sales and thus, his income. This is the second loan Dionisio will be receiving from MFP and he would like to keep working in solidarity with the communal bank so that he can continue to grow as a person and to improve his business. The loan will be used to buy more animals, such as lambs and piglets, so that he can increase his working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y su hija de 5 años en casa de sus suegros. Desde hace más de 3 años se dedica al bordado de fustanes artesanales que son usados en las  danzas típicas de su ciudad, de esta manera aporta en la economía de su hogar y para la atención de su pequeña hija que está en edad escolar. Es por ello que Lilia realiza este trabajo en su misma casa, en los horarios que dispone de tiempo; y aprovechando la época festiva de su localidad quier incrementar su producción para aumentar sus ganancias. Es la primera vez que Lilia viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y está contenta por pertenecer a su banco comunal, el cual le permitirá crecer ella y los demás integrantes. Ahora Lilia planea comprar telas e hilos a seguir bordando e incrementando su producción.
texts.en:
Lilia, 26, lives with her husband and her 5 year old daughter in her in-laws’ house. For over 3 years she has been embroidering skirts that are used in the typical dances of her city. This way she contributes to the economy of her home and her little school aged daughter’s needs. Lilia works in her home in her free time. Taking advantage of the season for festivities in her area, she wants to increase her production to raise her income. This is the first time that Lilia has asked for a loan from MFP. She is happy to belong to her community bank, which has allowed her and the other members to grow. Lilia plans to buy fabric and thread to continue embroidering and increasing her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her embroidery

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 30 years old and is married to Freddie M., who has been encouraging her to further develop her business. The couple resides in the village of Minallo, Naguillan, Isabela. They have three children. Freddie Mar, 11 years old, and Jesus, 7 years old, are both studying in the primary school. The youngest is Princess who just turned 2 years old. Marivic hopes that her children remain healthy and become successful in their chosen careers.

Marivic operates a “sari-sari” store, a common term for a typical village store business. She is requesting to borrow PHP 20,000 for the development of her store that she has been running for three years. According to her, she will double her patience and diligence to be able to achieve her goals in life. She wants to provide a good future to her three children by sending them to school until they finish their studies. This way, they will have a better chance to improve their own lives someday.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Ola-Oladia

texts.en: T. is 47 years old and married with 3 children.  T. sells provisions to make a living. She is requesting a loan of N 60,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Feliciana Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Feliciana P. se dedica a vender productos derivados del maíz como lo es la chicha la cual la vende en bolsa lista para elaborar el refresco. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 9 años y gracias a sus esfuerzos ha salido adelante en su negocio.

Hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en el negocio por medio de la compra del maíz, las bolsas y la leña y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para estas compras y así ofrecerlas a sus clientes en el negocio.
texts.en:
Feliciana P. sells products derived from corn like “chicha” (a cold beverage made from corn). She sells her product in a bag ready to make the soft drink. She has had this business for nine years. Thanks to her efforts, she has gotten ahead in her business. She now needs to invest in her business and buy corn, bags, and wood. She has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan for these purchases so that she can sell her products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, bags, and wood

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is 61years old. She is a divorced and mother to four children, all of whom are working. Akua is a resourceful mother who works very hard to provide food and support for her business. She is a petty trader and sells her goods at the community market square. She enjoys selling, the business through which she makes a living. She sells items like cooking oil, pepper, spices etc. on a tabletop in the market. Recently she has added the sale of rice with stew to her inventory. She purchases her stock of goods from the central market in Kumasi, a nearby city. She is requesting for the loan to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, spices, pepper, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El comité  de Mujeres Las Mercedes del barrio Las Mercedes de la ciudad de Aregua, se formó mediante que una de las integrantes quien se acerco a la Fundación se informó del programa y decidió formar un grupo en su barrio, actualmente el comité se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y esta conformado por 18 integrantes las cuales invierten en distintas actividades.

La señora Graciela S. tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor para el incremento de su negocio. 

La señora Amalia B. se dedica alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de sus productos de alfarería. 

La señora María Mercedes R. se dedica alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de sus productos de alfarería. 

La señora María Nieves S. tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor para el incremento de su negocio. 

La señora Cristina R. se dedica a la venta de dulces e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de sus productos. 

La señora Juana B. se dedica alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de sus productos de alfarería. 

La señora Irma F. se dedica alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de sus productos de alfarería. 

La señora María Ester M. se dedica alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de sus productos de alfarería. 

La señora Petrona H. tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor para el incremento de su negocio. 

La señora Gladys B. se dedica alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de sus productos de alfarería. 

La señora Myrian I. se dedica alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de sus productos de alfarería. 

La señora Rosalia A. se dedica a la venta de dulces e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de sus productos. 

La señora Asunción F. se dedica alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de sus productos de alfarería. 

La señora Florentina G. se dedica alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de sus productos de alfarería. 

La señora Eustacia B. se dedica a la venta de menudencias e invirtió el dinero en la compra al por mayor de menudencias. 

La señora Ignacia P. se dedica alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de sus productos de alfarería. 

La señora Josefina B. se dedica alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de sus productos de alfarería. 

La señora Cirila Chavezse dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.
texts.en:
The committee named Women of Las Mercedes from the neighborhood of Las Mercedes in the city of Aregua was formed as one of the members turned to the Foundation, learned of the program and decided to form a group in her neighborhood. Currently the group is in the third cycle of the program Committee of Enterprising Women of the Paraguay Foundation and it is made up of 18 members who invest in various activities. Mrs. Graciela S. has a general store and invested the money in the purchase of merchandise at wholesale in order to grow her business. Mrs. Amalia B. works in pottery and invested the money in the purchase of materials for the making and selling of her pottery products. Mrs. Maria Mercedes R. also works in pottery and invested the money in the purchase of materials for the making and selling of her pottery products. Mrs. Maria Nieves S. has a general store and invested the money in the purchase of merchandise at wholesale in order to grow her business. Mrs. Cristina R. sells sweets and invested the money in the purchase of materials for the making and selling of her products. Mrs. Juana B. works in pottery and invested the money in the purchase of materials for the making and selling of her pottery products. Mrs. Irma F. works in pottery and invested the money in the purchase of materials for the making and selling of her pottery products. Mrs. Maria Ester M. works in pottery and invested the money in the purchase of materials for the making and selling of her pottery products. Mrs. Petrona H. has a general store and invested the money in the purchase of merchandise at wholesale in order to grow her business. Mrs. Gladys B. works in pottery and invested the money in the purchase of materials for the making and selling of her pottery products. Mrs. Myrian I. works in pottery and invested the money in the purchase of materials for the making and selling of her pottery products. Mrs. Rosalia A. sells sweets and invested the money in the purchase of materials for the making and selling of her products. Mrs. Asuncion F. works in pottery and invested the money in the purchase of materials for the making and selling of her pottery products. Mrs. Florentina G. works in pottery and invested the money in the purchase of materials for the making and selling of her pottery products. Mrs. Eustacia B. sells edible organ meats and invested the money in the purchase of them at wholesale. Mrs. Ignacia P. works in pottery and invested the money in the purchase of materials for the making and selling of her pottery products. Mrs. Josefina B. works in pottery and invested the money in the purchase of materials for the making and selling of her pottery products. Mrs. Cirila Chavezse sells food and invested the money in the purchase of materials for the making and selling of foodstuff.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables, dough for turnovers, meats, condiments, breads, napkins, clay, paints, sweets, organ meats and others.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua H. is a single parent and has two children. She has received education through the primary school level. Akua sells food supplies such as beans and groundnut at Takoradi, which she has done since 1978. Akua uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses for her family. Akua will add the loan to her capital to buy more food supplies for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Akua plans to save.

loans.use: To buy more food supplies for resale.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 46 years old and is a married mother of six children. Three of the children are in school while the rest are learning a trade. She is a petty trader who trades in used clothes. Her husband and kids are very proud of her because of the enormous contribution she makes in the home. Used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economic poor. Therefore, the selling of used clothing has created a market for many women like Felicia. She wants to use the loan to buy more used clothing to increase her inventory, which she takes in from Accra and Kumasi. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s education and also to rent a store. She is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing

loans.name: Odilie

texts.es:
Odilie H. B. es una señora de 38 años de edad el cual vive con su esposo y sus 2  hijos en una comunidad llamada las Nubes localizada en los chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Doña Odilie se dedica a la producción de leche y queso como una forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Dice estar muy contenta porque gracias a este proyecto ha podido salir adelante y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de sus hijos. 

Doña Odilie desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar dos vacas lecheras más y así aumentar la producción de leche. Ella sabe que contar con más vacas es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser una microempresaria exitosa y  sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, la motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero y dedicación.

Doña Odilie es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Las Nubes, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Odilie H. B. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the community of Las Nubes, which is located in Los Chiles in Alajuela Province. This area is in a mountainous region near the northern border of the country. The main economic activities are livestock breeding and agriculture, specifically the planting and harvesting of basic grains, sugar cane, and oranges.

Doña Odilie is a dairy farmer who produces milk and cheese in order to generate income for her family. She is very happy that her business has enabled her to move forward and help her husband with the household expenses and her children’s welfare.

Doña Odilie is seeking to obtain a microloan of 500,000 colones to buy two more dairy cows in order to increase her milk production. She knows that having more cows requires great sacrifice and demands more work. However, her desire to be a successful micro-entrepreneur and improve her family’s living conditions motivates her to continue working with great care and dedication.

Doña Odilie is a member of Las Nubes Community Credit Enterprise, one of the 100 partner organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her third loan and she hopes to continue growing personally and economically. She is grateful for these types of organizations and providers of credit who dedicate their time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Cristiline

texts.en:
“Sacrifice and patience is necessary in order to achieve success in life,” said Cristiline. She is thankful because she has been blessed with four children: Virgiline - 19 years old, a college student; Cristine - 18 years old, also a college student; Princess - 15 years old, a high school student; and the youngest is Crichelle - 3 years old.

Cristiline is hoping that her children will all finish their studies. Her income from her business is carefully budgeted to meet the educational needs of her three children. Her husband is working abroad as an Overseas Filipino Workers or OFW.

Cristiline is engaged in a weaving business. However, her income is not enough to meet all their needs so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders to further improve her business and enable her to purchase materials needed for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for weaving

loans.name: Abdul Moaner

texts.en: Abdul Moaner is the son of R. B.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives in a family of seven members. He wants to take a loan for his family problems. He works in the government.  He requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghani. He would like to say that the loan process is the best because it can support those who really need money and want to have a good future.

loans.use: For completing his requirements

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
To earn an income to provide for her family's needs, Evelyn H. started selling fish in her village. She buys her products at the Solano Public Market. Being an industrious businesswoman, she is able to earn 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month which she uses for their daily needs as well as to finance the education of her children. Evelyn shared that, being a widow, she needs to be even stronger and more determined to overcome all the challenges that she may encounter.

Evelyn wants to sell more products but she has inadequate capital; therefore, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders for business progress. She knows that there are people who are kindhearted and willing to help the needy.

loans.use: Additional capital for buying and selling fish

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 47-year-old single man. He has owned a vegetable business since 2008 with fifteen years of experience in the agriculture sector.

To attract more clients, Kamal needs a loan of $1,200 to add a glass stand where he will present the vegetables in order to increase his business income.

loans.use: To add a glass stand

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
In the picture appears Mrs. Leng L., who is 61 years of age and currently lives with other family members in a small home located in Siem Reap province. She is married with two children who are already married and have started new homes. Her husband is a car keeper for a small firm.

Leng L. currently earns a living selling a few groceries in a mobile business around the truck station. Recently she sold nearly all her inventory and she hopes to resupply her stock, so she is asking for a loan to accumulate an amount of inventory to continue selling.

loans.use: To accumulate inventory to continue selling

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn L. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, is married, and has five adult children.

Merlyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee  tiene 26 años, es madre de un miño de 7 años y juntos viven en su  propia casa. Desde hace un año que se dedica a la agricultura,  sembrando papa, maíz y alfalfa, actividad que le ha resultado más rentable que cuando tenía su tienda, que por motivos de mala ubicación tuvo que cerrar su negocio. Ahora su tiempo lo dedica en su terrenos que sus padres le dejaron como herencia, además se dedica también a la venta de animales menores como ovejas, que son alimentados con la alfalfa que cosecha, ya que así procura una buena alimentación de estos animales y pueda venderlos a buen precio en la feria ganadera. Lo que más anhela Aydee es mejorar su actividad agrícola, extender sus terrenos de cultivo e intensificar la crianza de animales menores. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, además manifiesta estar muy contenta con sus compañeros de su grupo comunal y continuar participando dentro de su grupo y de las tareas que se le encomienden. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono, así como también ovejas para mas adelante comercializarlas.
texts.en:
Aydee, 26, and her 7-year-old son live together in their own house. For the last year she has farmed potato, corn and alfalfa. This activity has produced more profits than when she ran her grocery store which, due to its poor location, had to close down. Now, she spends her time farming the lands her parents left her. Also, she raises small farm animals, like sheep, which she feeds with her alfalfa crop. This provides good nutrition to her animals and she can then sell them for a good price at the livestock fairs. What Aydee most wants is to improve her farming activity, to extend her planted fields, and to increase the number of small farm animals she raises. This is her third loan with MFP and she tells us that she is very happy with her fellow communal bank members and looking forward to continuing to work with her group in whatever tasks are assigned to her. The funds requested will be used to buy sacks of natural fertilizer as well as some sheep to raise and later sell.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and natural fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Vorn B., 35, is a married man and a father of two young children. He helps feed his children by working as a construction worker. His wife, Phally, is 27 years old, and she sells a few fresh fish around the community. Vorn B. desires to earn extra income by investing in the animal trade, buying and selling animal.  But this is not possible because he doesn’t have money to start the business process. Therefore, he is pursuing a loan of $700 from Kiva’s partner, HKL. He will buy animals such as oxen and horses from rural farmers. He will fatten them for a while before selling them out to people who need them to allow their labor in transportation base. This will provide him with additional money.

loans.use: To buy a cow and a horse.

loans.name: Diana Veronica

texts.es:
La señora  DIANA VERONICA C. A. tiene 37 años, vive en el distrito DE TRUJILLO, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal JESUS EN TI CONFIO. La socia  presenta estudios superiores hasta 5to de Secundaria, es soltera. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos como: colonias, desodorantes, labiales, bloqueador solar, shampoo, etc., paralelamente se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, cervezas, golosinas, etc. 
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró cosméticos como: labiales, rubores, colonias, perfumes, etc. para aumentar su stock.
Este crédito de 1,500.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para la compra de mas cosméticos como: labiales, cremas, gel, shampoo, rubores, delineadores, etc., también comprará cajas de cervezas y gaseosas al por mayor.  Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y tener una tienda de comestibles en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Diana Veronica C. A. is 37-years-old and lives in the districts and provinces of Trujillo in the Libertad region of Perú. She belongs to the Jesus En Ti Confio (Jesus, I Trust In You) Communal Bank. She completed her studies up to the fifth year of secondary school and is single. She sells cosmetics such as cologne, deodorant, lipstick, sunblock, shampoo, etc. She also sells soft drinks, beer, candy, and more.

With her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles she bought lipstick, rouge, cologne, and perfume to increase her stock. This current loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles ($525) will be used to buy more cosmetics such as lipstick, creams, gel, shampoo, rouge, eyebrow shapers, etc. She will also buy wholesale boxes of beer and soft drinks. Diana dreams of increasing her sales and having a grocery store in her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy lipstick, perfume, cologne, powders, shapers, creams, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is 29 years old, married with two children.  Peace and her family live in the Gasabo district where she operates a business selling clothes.  This is her seventh successful year in this business, which she starts from early in the morning until 6 PM every day.
	
Peace is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing some other attractive clothing styles for sale as well as additional sizes and colors.  With this loan, Peace hopes to attract more customers to her shop and hopefully earn more profits in the process.  This, in turn will allow her and her devoted husband to create other sources of income through reinvesting in the same business in various areas.  With this reinvestment, they will help the people from their community by employing them.

loans.use: Additional styles of clothing for sale

loans.name: Los Siervos De Jesus Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “LOS SIERVOS D. JESUS”

Alejandra es miembro D. la alcancía comunal “LOS SIERVOS D. JESUS”, los cuales trabajan con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD por más D. 3 años.

Alejandra se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos desD. hace más D. 10 años, se lo agradece a una amiga que la introdujo a este negocio, no solo porque le da un ingreso D. dinero, sino también porque le dio solución a las necesidades económicas que su familia padecía en ese entonces, también ha conocido buenas amistades y más desenvolvimiento ante las personas.

Con el actual préstamo ella planea invertirlo en la compra D. más productos D. belleza para su venta.

También sueña con viajar y conocer el Perú, tener un local propio, donD. colocaría un bazar muy variado, lleno D. lencería, zapatos, y sus productos cosméticos, etc.
texts.en:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “LOS SIERVOS D. JESUS” Alejandra is a member of the Los Siervos D. Jesus community bank, a group that has worked with EDAPOSPO-PROSPERIDAD for more than 3 years. Alejandra has maD. a living selling cosmetics for more than 10 years. She thanks a friend who introduced her to the business, not only because it´s given her an income but because it provided a way to solve some pressing financial problems the family faced at the time. She has also maD. good friends and learned how to better manage herself with other people. She will invest this loan in buying beauty products that she will resell. In the future, she would like to take a trip to Peru and have a shop of her own where she can sell products like lingerie and shoes, as well as cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine K. is a 55 year old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a food vending business. She lives in Boyco, Bayawan, Negros Oriental with her husband and their 2 children who are adults.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 15,000.

Now Josephine is borrowing Php 25,000 for additional working capital for her food vending business. This will be her 15th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 25,000, which she paid off within its term, was another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Josephine aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being.
-------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Addtional working capital.

loans.name: Rodrigo Salomon

texts.es:
El Sr. U. García vive en el municipio de Tonalá-Morazán.
El va a utilizar el crédito en la compra de materiales para la reparación de su vivienda ya que se aproxima el invierno y necesita reparar el techo de su casa así como la reparación de la misma.

El ha tenido 4 créditos con la Institución los cuales todos los ha pagado muy bien en tiempo y forma y a la vez dice estar muy agradecido con la institución por toda la ayuda que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Mr. U. García lives in Tonalá-Morazán. He will use the funds to buy building materials and supplies because winter is approaching and he needs to repair his roof and do some other home repairs. He has had 4 loans with the institution which have all been repaid in a timely fashion. He states that he is very grateful to the institution for all the help it has given him.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Nymph

texts.en:
Nymph C. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nymph owns and operates a clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of clothes both for kids and adults to local community members. Nymph has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Nymph joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Nymph is requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her seventh from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a wife of A. S. and she lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She has been living in this city for over 30 years. She is a mother of three sons. All of her sons are very hardworking. Her first two sons are involved in her husband’s timber selling business. The younger son is very intelligent and spends most of his time studying. He reads in 6th standard and has an ambition to become a doctor. 
Razia is a caring lady. She stays at home to manage the household chores and to cook food for her family. She also prepares the animal food. She receives orders from her neighbors and generates an income. She manages her house and work simultaneously and never receives any complaint from her neighbors or from her family. 

She has successfully repaid her three loans to Asasah and now is applying for the fourth time to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase timber in bulk and sell it in the community. 

Note: "In this picture she is showing the cutter which helps her to prepare the animal food".

loans.use: To purchase timber in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Mr. Sao S. is married and has four children,. Two of his children are bread sellers, while the others are studying in a local public school. This family is living in Popeal Khae village in Kandal province. His wife, Mrs. Savey Roeurn, is housewife who looks after her children and cooks delicious food for her family. Mr. Sao S. is a bread seller, earning enough money to support his family. But his problem is that he does not have a motorbike for transporting his breads for resale. He wants to expand his business. To improve this business, Mr. Sao S. is seeking a loan to buy a new motorbike. His wife is shown in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Ousseynou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ousseynou N. est un travailleur social au niveau du PDEF. Vue que les rémunérations des travailleurs sociaux  ne pouvaient pas satisfaire ses besoins, il s'est investi dans le commerce d'habillements où il trouve son compte. Marié et pére d'un enfant âgé de 3 ans, Monsieur N. trouve ce commerce en plus des bénéfices qu'il tire, lui permet de se faire des amis et est très apprécié pazr les jeunes qui constituent les 60% de ses clients.
Cependant Monsieur N. Ousseynou âgé de 34 ans souhaitait un crédit de 150 000 FCFA pour s'approvisionner en prêt à porter afin de faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mr. Ousseynou N. is a social worker at the PDEF. Unable to make ends meet on a social worker’s salary, he started to sell clothing with positive results. Married and a father to a 3-year old child, Mr. N. has found that in addition to any profits made, his business has allowed him to make friends and has become very popular with the younger crowd who comprise 60% of his customer base. Mr. N., age 34, would like to get a loan in the amount of 150,000 francs CFA to stock up on ready to wear items in order to cope with customer demand.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ready to wear clothing

loans.name: Ludina

texts.en:
Ludina F. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old, married and has 4 adult children. Ludina owns & operates a seafood store where she sells a variety of fish. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ludina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Ludina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; El  socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El  socio es el Sr. Leopoldo; el tiene 33 años de edad y El socio es casado él terminó solo la secundaria y no pudo estudiar algo superior, él socio tienen 2 hijos, él socio es natural de H. y él es de profesión mecánico, el socio trabaja arreglando automóviles, el socio tiene su taller y él está implementando poco a poco comprando máquinas para hacer su trabajo cada ves más práctico.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Kantu de San Jerónimo” communal bank. He lives in the district of Huanchac and in the department of Cusco.

The member is Leopoldo and he is 33 years old and married. He finished only his secondary studies and could not complete any post-secondary studies. He has 2 children and is a native of H.. He is a mechanic and he works fixing cars. He has his workshop and he is setting it up little by little, purchasing machines to be able to do his work more practically.

David values and is infinitely grateful for the loan provided since it allows him to grow with his business and improve his quality of life. Likewise, he promises to make his loan payments according to the stipulated time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install machines for the mechanic shop

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es:
Damiana viaja a la comunidad de Alpachaca que se encuentra a 3 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho de donde compra quesos de los productores para luego venderlos en la ciudad de casa en casa, también lleva al distrito de Pacaycasa y además vende alimento para animales que compra en los molinos, Damiana es viuda y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 1 vive con ella, Damiana es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza hace 1 año y lo que mas le agrada son las capacitaciones de salud, Damiana necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de  quesos.
Sus sueños son ahorrar para la vejez y adquirir propiedades que le den seguridad para el futuro.
texts.en:
Damiana travels to the community Alpachaca, located three hours from Ayacucho, to buy cheese from local producers, which she then sells from door-to-door in her hometown as well as the district of Pacaycasa. Damiana also sells food for animals, which she buys from the mills. Damiana is a widow with six children, one of whom lives with her. She has been a member of the community bank Bonanza for the past year, and what pleases her most is the health training. Damiana needs a loan of 900 soles, money she will invest in the purchase of cheese. Her dreams are saving money for old age and acquiring property that will offer her security in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cheese

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
Kuy T., aged 47, owns and operates a farming business. Her main activity is cultivating crops on her own plot of farmland from which she earns a living. 

Kuy T. has a life partner in her husband who works on the farm field with her. This couple is married with nine children, six of whom have got married. The remaining three are single. Kuy T. planted rice crops two months ago but they are not growing well due to a lack of fertilizer. To solve the problem, Kuy T. asked for a loan to buy sacks of fertilizer to improve her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer to improve her crop yield

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Srta. Verónica; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de  venta de pantalones y cosméticos, ella vende en forma independiente llevando a las casas de diferentes clientes, ella le gustaría estudiar una carrera profesional y para eso tiene que ahorrar, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender ropa para adultos y niños. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  mercadería como pantalones.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the community bank "Virgen del Rosario del Cusco". The bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The partner is Miss Verónica, she is 26 years old and single. The partner works daily in her business selling trousers and cosmetics. She is independent taking her merchandise to the houses of different cudstomers. She would like to study a professional carreer and therefore she needs to save. The partner wants to have a store to sell clothes for adults and children. The partner requests a loan to buy merchandise such as trousers.

The partner is grateful to the people being part of her dream through this means and she is committed to repay punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The partner requests the loan to purchase merchandise such as trousers.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo de 6 años, Mercedes junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, sus productos los comercializan en la misma comunidad.
Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal Proyección y solicita un crédito de 1000 soles para la compra de leña.
Mercedes sueña con tener casa propia pues vive en la casa de su suegra y tener un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Mercedes is in a common law marriage and has a six year old child. She and her husband produce handmade bricks in the community of Compañía. Her products are sold in the same community.

Mercedes belongs to the Communal Bank “Proyección” (Projection) and is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN to buy firewood. She dreams of having a home of her own since she lives at her mother-in-law’s house. In addition, she hopes to have a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Maripe Tole

texts.en:
Maripe Tole P. is 38 years old. He is married to Nataana and he supports a family of six members. He buys sheep and goats from farmers, then sells the livestock to slaughter houses in different areas.

He learned about KADET LTD from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan. He is planning to boost his capital so he can buy more goats and sheep. With the anticipated profit he intends to buy his own car so as to be transporting the sheep and goats to different markets with ease.

His future dream is that he will become a large scale sheep farmer. He is a hard-working man, and very determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: buying sheep for resale

loans.name: Paulin

texts.en:
Paulin is a member of Ikinu Clean Shine group in Faulu, Kenya. 

For a living, Paulin practices poultry farming. She has been in this business for two years and she is glad to have a ready market for her chickens. She also does dairy farming for extra income. 

Paulin says that she is a hardworking lady and she hopes to grow financially. She hopes to be a great farmer with a big business in the future. She has requested 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more chickens.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Kuteesa Women's Group-Mpigi

texts.en:
Animal husbandry has been 35 year old N. Harriet’s business for the last 20 years. Her business is located in Ssazi-Mpigi. Harriet, who describes herself as highly ambitious, says she began this business with savings from her erstwhile farming business. This was after she came to terms with the fact that there was a ready market for cattle, goats and pigs within her operating area.  

Harriet isa single mother with 3 kids. She says her brother has been at her beck and call in the running of her business all this while. She also ekes out profits from a small cash crop selling business. Harriet is also a teacher.  In a week her profits total up to 150,000 shillings. With this loan Harriet, who belongs to Kuteesa women’s group- Mpigi, says she is going to purchase building materials for the school she says she is building in her locality.

loans.use: The purchase of building materials for her up and coming school

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “San Francisco”,  están en el Primer Ciclo con  10 integrantes y sus respectivas actividades productivas, son muy unidas responsables y solidarias entre ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la señora  Lucina quien se dedica a la producción de leche, y mediante esta actividad ella obtiene su ingreso para ayudar a su familia.
Comenta que se encuentra muy contenta con el grupo y desean continuar, e incluir a otras señoras para que pueden recibir tambien las
capacitaciones y los créditos.
Ella quiere continuar con el comité e ir aumentando los montos de los créditos de  manera que los   mismos puedan ayudar mejorar la produccion que cada una tiene.
Actualmente solicita el préstamo para algunos gasto familiares que cuenta.
texts.en:
This is the San Francisco communal bank’s first loan cycle. The group consists of ten members, each with their respective business. They are very close, responsible, and supportive with one another.

One of the group members is Lucina, who works producing milk to earn money to help her family. She comments that she is very happy with the group and that they want to continue and include more women in the group who can receive the training and loans. She wants the group to continue increasing the loan amounts so that each member can help to improve their business.

Lucina is currently requesting a loan for some of the family expenses that she has.

loans.use: Family expenses

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta C. is from Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 42 years old. Vicenta is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Vicenta owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Vicenta has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Vicenta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicenta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Vicenta is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Vicenta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bright Future Primary School-Kampala Group

texts.en: Annet B. is 36 years old and happily married with three children. She belongs to the group “Bright Future Primary School.” For the last nine years, Annet has been working as a teacher. She is drawn to teaching even if her remuneration is minimal and she goes about her work with painstaking dedication, diligence, and buoyancy. If it was not for these virtues, Annet’s close friends say that she would probably have already given up teaching. But she has remained committed to her profession and earns a monthly salary of 250,000 UGX. Annet says that she will buy land with her portion of the loan.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es: Pascual, de 57 años, es un asombroso padre soltero de 2 hijos: Elías, de 27 y Elizabeth, de 22 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de La Merced (selva central peruana). Las manos prodigiosas de este talentoso hombre le enseñaron a depender hace 5 años, de lo que hoy es su mejor pasatiempo y distracción “la sastrería”, ahí confecciona prendas de vestir, además de hacer composturas, teñidos, planchados, y demás servicios que brinda en su propio taller, ubicado en una zona estratégica de la ciudad. Lo que más le gusta a este talentoso hombre, es poder crear sus propias prendas de vestir, pues según afirma, “es una diversión”. Por ello más adelante está pensando, acondicionar su taller con una pequeña tienda de venta de ropa que el mismo confeccionará. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y como socio activo de su banco comunal espera seguir trabajando conjuntamente con sus integrantes, y de esa manera lograr sus objetivos. De obtener el crédito podrá adquirir diversas telas para la confección de diferentes prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Pascual, age 57, is an amazing single father of two children: Elías (age 27) and Elizabeth (age 22). His family lives in his own home located in the city of La Merced in the central Peruvian jungle. The prodigious hands of this talented man have taught him to become self-dependent for the past five years. Today he spends most of his time and energy tailoring, which includes making and mending clothes. In addition, he provides dyeing and ironing services from his own shop located in a strategic area of the city. What this talented man enjoys most is designing his own clothes because he says “it is fun”. Later on he plans to convert his workshop into a small clothing store where he can sell the garments he makes.

This is his second loan with MFP. As a member of his Communal Bank, Pascual hopes to continue working with the other members to achieve their objectives. With the loan he will receive, Pascual will acquire various fabrics to produce different types of clothes.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics in different colors and styles

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura is a thirty-eight-year-old married woman with two children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda, longing to educate her children up to university level. She sells clothes and has been in business for ten years. It is at its boom stage. She still has a challenge of limited finances to meet customer demands. Her desire is to own a boutique. Laura needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: Buying clothes for sale

loans.name: Edis

texts.es: Edis tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa alquilada. Desde hace 5 años  realiza la venta de jugos de frutas de manera ambulante, tiene sus disposición su esencial herramienta de trabajo que es su carrito de ventas donde tiene la facilidad de trasladarse a distintos puntos de ventas cercanos a su barrio. También ofrece por la tarde bebida caliente como café o mate que son del agrado de su público consumidor. Este trabajo  es rentable para Edis y es por esta razón que se ha mantenido durante este tiempo con la mentalidad de mejorar y agrandar su negocio. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar una licuadora, extractora y abastecerse de frutas.
texts.en: Edis is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a rental home. For five years she has been selling fruit juice from a stand. She has the essential tool for her work, which is her little sales stand that she can take to different places around her neighborhood to make sales. In the afternoon she also sells hot beverages such as coffee or mate (tea), which the public loves. This work is profitable for Edis, and that is why she has kept it up all this time with the hope of improving and growing her business. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP; she is very happy to know that she has financial help. Plus, she is grateful to be part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very loyal. Thanks to the people who will be lenders for this loan; it will be very useful for her business's progress. With the loan she is requesting, she will purchase a juicer, extractor, and fruit.

loans.use: Purchase a juicer, extractor, and fruit

loans.name: Mulwa

texts.en:
Mulwa is a married woman with five children, two of whom attend school, while three already graduated from school.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a clothes-selling business for the past three years, selling in a shop to her neighbours especially women's clothes. Mulwa hopes to establish a stall to sell her clothes from in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu because it is simple to join.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale

loans.name: Jessica Argentina

texts.es:
JESSICA ARGENTINA L. R., ES DE MANAGUA, ELLA TRABAJA DIARIO COMO CAJERA, NO TIENE HIJOS.
DOÑA JESSICA ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ZINC, PERLINES, PINTURA PARA EL TECHO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION YA QUE ESTE SE ENCUENTRA EN MAL ESTADO Y EN INIVERNO EL AGUA SE PASABA.
TODO ESTO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU CASA DE HABITACON Y BRINDARLE MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
AGRADECE A CEPRODEL POR EL OTORGAMIENTO DEL PRESTAMO YA QUE ESTE VENDRA A MEJORAR SU CASA.
texts.en:
Jessica Argentina L. R. is from Managua. She is employed as a cashier and she doesn't have children. 

Jessica approached the offices of Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) to request a loan to improve the house. She will invest in the purchase of construction materials such as zinc, steel, and sealant for her house. It is currently in a poor state of repair and in the winter the water seeps through. The improvement of her house is to provide her family with better living conditions. 

She is thankful to Ceprodel for granting her a loan to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité, tuvo la iniciativa la Señora Francisca A. domiciliada en Calixto de la Ciudad de Carapegua.
El comité se llama “Kuña Rory” y actualmente se encuentra en la décima etapa con 16 integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras.
Algunas de las integrantes ya contaban con trabajo antes de formar parte del comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y se integraron para lograr mejorar su emprendimiento, otras sin embargo comienzan con su primer negocio.
Las mujeres agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por la iniciativa ya que mediante ella lograron desarrollar bastante su capacidad de trabajo.
La Sra. Dionicia,  quien se dedica hace varios años a la venta de leche, se levanta muy temprano a ordeñar  su vaca para salir a vender. La venta lo realiza en la ciudad de Carapegua, donde tiene un puesto de venta de verduras también.
La Sra. Dionicia agradece de manera especial a la Fundación porque mediante el apoyo brindado ella pudo adquirir más capital y espera poder seguir contando con ese apoyo financiero para agrandar su negocio porque ahora cuenta con mas mercaderías, así también espera contar con una congeladora.
texts.en:
Mrs Francisca A. set up this committee.  Francisca lives in Calitxo, in the city of Carapegua.  The committee is called “Kuña Rory” and it is currently entering its tenth loan cycle with 16 members.  This is a group of very responsible and hard-working women.

Some of these ladies already had work before they became members of the committee of enterprising women and joined in order to improve their businesses.  Others, however, are starting out in their first business.

These women are grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for this initiative since it has helped them to develop their capacity for work.

Dionicia has been selling milk for several years.  She gets up very early to milk her cow and then goes out to sell the milk.  She makes her sales in the city of Carapegua where she also has a vegetable stall.

Dionicia is especially grateful to Fundación Paraguaya because, through the support they have given her, she has been able to acquire more capital.  She hopes to be able to continue relying on their financial support to expand her business because she now has more merchandise.  She also hopes to be able to acquire a freezer.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and expand her business

loans.name: Santa Catalina De Sillacancha Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Santa Catalina de Sillacancha” tiene 9 ciclos de funcionamiento (cada ciclo son 4 meses),  el banco comunal está conformado por 10 mujeres y 3 varones. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en el salón comunal de la comunidad de Sillacancha (Calca, Cusco, Perú). La mayoría de los socios viven en la comunidad de Sillacancha. (La comunidad de Sillacancha está ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Calca y a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco). Sillacancha se caracteriza por tener paisajes hermosos, montañas y un clima templado. La mayoría de los pobladores de la comunidad de Sillacancha se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.        

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta de verduras, venta de maíz, venta de comestibles y otros brindar servicios varios. 
 
La socia Teolifa nació en el departamento de Huánuco y tiene 48 años de edad. Actualmente, Teolifa vive junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos en la comunidad de Sillacancha. Su actividad económica principal de Teolifa es la venta de verduras y frutas, ella lleva sus productos a vender a diferentes mercados de la ciudades de Cusco, Calca y Urubamba, ella lleva sus verduras y frutas dos veces a la semana. También se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas y chanchos. En esta oportunidad Teolifa requiere el préstamo e igual que sus compañeras del banco comunal para incrementar capital del negocio pero ella desea comprar maíz. (Los socios que faltan en la foto no están porque pidieron permiso para no estar presente en la reunión).
texts.en:
The communal bank "Santa Catalina de Sillacancha” has been in operation for 9 cycles (each cycle is 4 months).  The communal bank is made up of 10 women and 3 men.  The communal bank meetings are held every thirty days in the community of Sillacancha's communal room (Calca, Cusco, Perú). The majority of the members live in the community of Sillacancha. (The community of Sillacancha is located 10 minutes from the city of Calca and 50 minutes from the city of Cusco). Sillacancha is known for its beautiful landscapes and mountains and for its temperate climate.  The majority of those who live in the community of Sillacancha make their livings in agriculture and ranching.        

The members are hard working and enterprising people.  They see every moment as an opportunity to get ahead, and with their daily effort, to give their children a better future.  The economic activities through which some of the members make their livings are: selling vegetables, selling corn or selling dry goods, and others offer various services. 
 
Teolifa is a memeber who was born in Huánuco Department.  She is 48 years old.  Currently, Teolifa lives with her husband and their three children in the community of Sillacancha. Teolifa's main business is selling vegetables and fruits.  She brings her products to different markets in the cities of Cusco, Calca and Urubamba to sell.  She brings her produce twice a week. She also earns a living raising small animals, like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.  At this time Teolifa needs the loan, just like her friends from the communal bank, to increase her business's capital.  But she also wants to purchase corn.  (The members who do not appear in the photo requested permission to miss the meeting).

loans.use: to purchase corn.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 25 years old, married and has a four-year-old child.  For the last three years, she has made a living by running a retail shop. She supplements her income by selling charcoal. Since joining Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her finances and hopes someday to buy a piece of land. She has applied for a loan for 20,000 Kes to buy maize flour, cooking oil and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, cooking oil and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has sold hand bags, shoes, and cloth from her home to her neighbours and friends. Ann faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a big supplier of hand bags, shoes and cloth to other entrepreneurs in the market. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she is requesting she wants to purchase hand bags, shoes, and cloth for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase hand bags, shoes and cloth for resale.

loans.name: Peter Kahara

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 41 years old, married to Hannah Wanjiku and they have four children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia  Nieves, la socia  tiene 37 años de edad y La socia es conviviente; La socia  tiene 3 hijos, de 18, 14, 7 años de edad;  La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la vigilancia, la socia cuida en el barrio en las mañanas todo el barrio llamado Caminito; la socia también comenta que según la temporada ella suele buscar el medio para sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia siempre está buscando trabajar pero no encuentra un trabajo estable motivo por el cual ella va ingeniándose cada mes para tener el pan de cada día, la socia también apoya a su conyugue y el compro una unidad vehicular con todos los ahorros de ambos por años, esto les permite por lo menos tener la confianza de que el carro les dará cada día algo para llevar a la meza, la socia por esta razón desea el crédito para poder hacerle el mantenimiento al carro y poner listo para que siga funcionando y les permita tener el ingreso diario. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su unidad vehicular.
 
La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Nieves is a member of the communal bank "Caminemos Juntas" (let's walk together). She lives in the district of Huanchac, located in the province and department of Cusco.

Nieves is 37 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and is the mother of three children, aged 18, 14 and 7. She alternates her activities between household chores and vigilance service (she patrols every morning in the whole neighborhood of Caminito). Nieves also says that she looks for various ways, depending on the season, to provide for her children. She is constantly looking for more work, but she cannot find a stable job, which is why she must be creative to find means to earn their daily bread.

Nieves also supports her husband, who bought a vehicle with all the money that they both had saved during all these years. This enables them at least to be confident that they will have food on the table every day. For this reason Nieves applies for a loan to service the vehicle and keep it running, allowing them to have a daily income. Nieves will use her loan to pay for the maintenance of the vehicle.

Nieves values the granted loan and is infinitely grateful for it. It will improve her quality of life. She commits herself to repay the loan according to the agreed schedule.

loans.use: to invest in the service of her vehicle.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 53 years old and married with two children aged sixteen and fourteen.

Helen earns a living farming corn and raising ducks. She tills her land and prepares it well for her crops. Helen sells her harvest at her town's market. She also sells duck eggs.

Helen's loan will be used to buy fertilizer, duck feed and vitamins. She hopes this loan will help to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, duck feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 54-year-old married woman from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice crops to sell. Judith does her best to support her family. She also wants to be able to sustain her children's education through the income they earn from the farm.

Judith has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She plans to use it to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She is hopeful that this loan will help their farm immensely.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI I est constitué de femmes mariées du village de MANIKABOUGOU dans la commune rurale de TIELE sous préfecture de BAGUINEDA, région de KOULIKORO (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 45  ans,  6 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide  et du gombo.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont à leur premier prêt de campagne.
ABI, qui est la deuxième assise à gauche,  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide et de gombo, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de TIELE. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de TIELE, BAMAKO et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 30.000 à 50.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 1 group is made up of married women from the village of Manikabougou in the rural community of Tiele in the sub-prefecture of Baguineda, which lies in Koulikoro (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They live in traditional families, average 45 years of age with six children each and grow groundnut and gombo.

With a view to making their farming activities profitable, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their first farming loan.

Abi, who is sitting second from the left, is planning to use her loan to buy a sufficient amount of groundnut and gombo seeds, small materials and farm inputs at the large market in Tiele. After the rainy season the crops that have been harvested are stocked for a certain amount of time for them to gain value before being sold at the large markets in Tiele and Bamako as well as in other surrounding markets, on a retail basis (but often wholesale) for cash, to customers who are mainly from large towns.

The group members expect to make a profit of between 30,000 and 50,000FCFA each once their produce has been sold, and this will be used to repay interest on their loans as well as to cover their families' day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds and small materials

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 46-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two young children who are still attending school. He has owned a mini-market in his village since 2007. He sells all types of food products and drinks. His store is located in a crowded area so there are a good number of clients passing by his shop. Those customers ask for additional products, which don’t exist in Mohamad’s store. So today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his store’s inventory and therefore satisfy his customers' demands.  He has high hopes for the future of his business.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Les Coeur Angelique Group

texts.fr:
Elardain est le coordinateur de son groupe coeur angeliques.  Il est  marié il a 3 enfants.

Elardain habite dans la ville de ouanaminthe d’Haiti. Elardain a dirigé son business pendant les 7 dernières années.
