Elardain voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat des charbon. Elardain espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Des autres membres de coeur angeliques ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du tennis, du riz et du poisson.

Elardain dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant .

Elardain dit que ses buts principaux sont l’augmentation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’un camion pour transporter les charbon.
texts.en:
Elardain is the coordinator of his group “Coeur Angélique” (angelic heart). He is married with three children. He lives in Haiti, in the city of Ouanaminthe. He has been running his coal business for the past seven years.

Elardain wishes to use this loan to invest in the purchase of coal. He hopes that this will help him to expand his business. 

Other group members are seeking a loan for such businesses as selling sneakers, rice or fish.

Elardain believes that his main challenge is the lack of return customers. His main goal is to expand his business, and his ambition is to buy a truck to transport the coal.

loans.use: to buy coal for resale

loans.name: Ramonito

texts.en: Ramonito is 40 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Poblacion, La Libertad, and makes a living as a motorcycle taxi driver. He has had this business for eight years. Each month, he earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). He plans to use this loan of 50,000 PHP to buy a new motorcycle. Ramonito has been a member of Kiva field partner PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Fulgencia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Fulgencia; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, ella tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi, su hijo trabaja con el carro y ella trabaja en una casa como empleada de hogar, por medio de este trabajo ella saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de transporte y mejorar en su trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su carro.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “IMASUMAC 1”.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

This is Fulgencia; she is 49 years old, is cohabitating, and has 5 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her transport business.  She has a car that she uses for taxi service.  Her son works with the car and she works in a house as a maid.  With this work she moves her children forward.  She wants to improve her transport business and get better in her work.  She requests this loan to buy car parts.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make all her payments.

loans.use: to buy car parts.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 42 years old and is married with five children, four of whom are in school. Rosario works very hard to provide for her family. For the past six years, she has run a sari-sari (retail) store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soft-drinks, and other grocery products. 

Rosario is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 60 years old and lives in Ciriaco Pastrano, Oroquieta City. She is married and has six children.
 
To earn a living, Norma has a business selling items such as rice, cigarettes, milk, sugar, soft drinks and canned goods. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Norma has a requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase stocks for her general store. Norma has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Norma would like to have more capital and own a general store.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her general store.

loans.name: José Gregorio Hernandez (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Gregorio Hernández se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín (Portoviejo), este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y  del Ecuador.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos mejoran sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Aquí conocimos a la Gissela tiene  20 años  de edad, es madre soltera un hijo de un año de edad. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Estudia Idiomas y lingüística en la Universidad Técnica De  Manabí.

Es una joven madre muy responsable y trabajadora que quiere lo mejor para el futuro de su pequeño hijo, ella para ganarse su propio sustento se dedica a la venta de bisutería y ropa por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque la mayoría de sus ventas  las realiza en la universidad donde estudia ya que allá tiene la mayoría de sus clientes. Lleva 5 meses en este negocio y le va muy bien ya que le da lo suficiente para sus gastos y los de su pequeño hijo.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y bisutería. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños es terminar sus estudios y darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The José Gregorio Hernández communal bank meets every two weeks in the Junín canton (Portoviejo). This place is known for its friendly, hardworking people and because the best cane liquor in Ecuador is distilled here.  

This is a group of people who decided to start this communal bank. It has helped them a lot since with the loans they improve their small businesses. They work in different activities such as being a merchant, service providers, selling food and more.  

Here we met Gissela. She is 20 years old, and a single mother of a one year old son. She lives in her parents' house. She studies languages and linguistics at the Universidad Técnica De  Manabí.

She is a young, hardworking and very responsible mother who wants the best future for her young son. To earn her own living, she sells jewelry and clothes via catalogue. She sells door to door, although she does most of her sales in the university where she studies, since that's where most of her customers are. She has had this business for 5 months and it is going very well for her, as it brings in enough to pay for her expenses and her son's. 

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as: pants, blouses, shirts and jewelry. This is her first cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because she can get the loans quickly. 
 
Her dream is to finish her studies and give her son the best.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and jewelry.

loans.name: Yamh

texts.en:
Yamh is 37 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She is married to a social worker.  Yamh and her husband have three children ages 4 to 13, who attend school and live at home. 

For the past five years she has been selling charcoal in her community. The profit helps her pay her children's school fees and buy school supplies. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business.  In the future, she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child, and the child doesn’t go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last three years. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, rice, maize flour and beef. Her aspirations and goals are to own a fully stocked restaurant. Her major business challenges are defaulters and transportation. She lives in a rented house, and the  family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, rice, maize flour and beef.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
A business oriented person named Glenda lives in Bagumbayan, Tuguegarao City. She lives with her husband and four lovely children. 

Glenda established a food selling business a year ago. She cooks and sells daily meals and snacks such as pansit (a term for noodles in Filipino cuisine), pork and chicken viands. Her daily schedule runs from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m.. She usually earns about PHP 5,000 each month. The income serves as revolving capital and part of it pays for stall rentals and the allowances of her children.

Glenda now asks for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy pork and chicken meat, eggs, onions, vegetables and rice to use in her food selling business. She needs to improve her sales to attract more customers and boost her profits. 

In the future, Glenda would like to make her business more profitable and own a stall.

loans.use: to buy pork and chicken meat, eggs, onions, vegetables and rice to use in her food selling business.

loans.name: Sussy

texts.es:
La Sra. Sussy pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Inmaculada” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 02 hijos de 16 y 6 años en edad escolar.
Siempre le gustó la costura, desde 1992 empezó a tomarlo como una alternativa de negocio para generar ingresos y poder ayudar con los gastos de su casa, su esposo la ayudó con la compra de una máquina de coser que poco a poco fue renovando con la ayuda del banquito y ahora cuenta con dos remalladoras, que le dan el buen acabado a las prendas que confecciona, por la calidad de su trabajo tiene clientes leales que recomiendan a otros, así también cuenta con clientes fijos como empresas que requieren de sus servicios para la confección de uniformes, es así como viene trabajando día a día para lograr sus sueños.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00,  comprará  telas, hilos para la remalladora, elásticos, blondas etc. Y además se proveerá de mercadería (ropa y zapatos) para la campaña navideña ya que tiene varios pedidos.
Sussy es una mujer muy empeñosa y trabajadora,  su sueño es contar con una empresa de confecciones formalizada, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a progresar.
texts.en:
Sussy belongs to the communal bank “Virgen de la Inmaculada” in the Tarapoto district, in the province and department of San Martín. She is 37, lives with a partner, and has 2 children aged 16 and 6 who are in school.

She has always enjoyed sewing, and ever since 1992 she has had a dressmaking business in order to generate income and help out with the household expenses.  Her husband helped her to buy a sewing machine that she eventually updated with the help of her communal bank, and now she has two commercial (overlock) sewing machines.  These machines give her garments a finished look.  Because of the quality of her work, she has loyal customers who recommend her to others.  She also has regular customers such as companies who need her services to make uniforms.  In this way, she has been working each day to achieve her dreams.

With this new loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy fabric, thread for the overlock machines, elastic, lace, etc.  In addition, she will stock up on merchandise (clothing and shoes) for the Christmas season, since she already has a number of orders.

Sussy is a very enterprising and hardworking woman.  Her dream is to have her own clothing company. She is very grateful for the Movimento Manuela Ramos organization for helping her to make progress.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread for the overlock machines, elastic, lace, etc.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is a 42-year-old married woman with five sons and one daughter. Her husband is a worker with a decent salary, and one of her sons is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary, too. 
Ilham is a professional tailor. She wants to expand her business and buy another sewing machine as demand has increased for her services. However, the amount of money she has isn't sufficient to buy a new machine, so she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner FATEN. When Ilham receives the loan, she will purchase another sewing machine to help her finish her tailoring work faster. She has loyal customers and keeping her word to finish the tailoring on time is very important to her in building a good reputation. This loan will allow her to maximize her tailoring work and increase her income, which will provide her family with better living conditions. 
Ilham is shown in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 25 years old and is married to Eunice, who is a businesswoman. They are blessed with one two-year-old child. For the past three years, Robert has been working as a mason in the construction industry. He earns a monthly income of 10,500 KES which he uses to support his family. Robert was introduced to KADET by an organization staff member.

Robert is applying for his first loan with KADET to buy bags of cement and construction bricks. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. In the future, he hopes to buy a piece of land and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 36 years old and married, with four children.

Cheryl works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice grains retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Cheryl has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her rice selling business for five years and also earns additional income from a sari sari (variety) store and from farming rice.

Cheryl aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to resell.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is 40 years old, married and a mother of three children. She has been running a motorcycle transport business for the last six years, earning a monthly income of Kes 25,000. 

The client was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of Kes 30,000 which she intends to use to service her motorcycle. The client will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for her children. 

In future she hopes to grow her business and diversify to include goat farming and be financially stable.

loans.use: To service her motorcycle.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes has five children between the ages of 6 and 21 years, and all of them attend school. Agnes sells foodstuffs such as beans, sorghum, and maize. She has requested a loan to purchase more beans and sorghum to sell. She wants to save the profits she will make from the business. She would like to own a big stock in the future.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de salón de belleza,el socio realiza corte de cabellos, tintes y ondulaciones, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de salón de belleza. El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This borrower continues to make a living at his beauty salon where he does hair cuts, dyes and other work. The borrower works from 8am until 5pm. He has had the business for eight years and it is going very well. Francisco's dream is to expand his beauty salon. He is happy with this loan and promises to make his repayments.

loans.use: The borrower is happy with this loan and promises to make his repayments.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en: Saira  is 37 years old, hardworking woman who has 4 children. She has been providing the service of stitching napkins in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Saira ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. Saira  has requested for a loan amount 40000 PKR. She intends to use this loan  to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and cloth for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and cloth for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Macario

texts.en:
Macario is in the business of selling clothes. He travels around the community showing locals his merchandise, specifically targeting friends, family and acquaintances. Macario has been selling clothes for about 6 years. Although his business is somewhat profitable, it does not always provide enough for him and his family. Therefore, Macario also buys and sells rice. He uses his truck in the picture to travel to rural Ecuador where he buys directly from the rice farmers. He returns to Guayaquil and sells the rice to many of the small stores around the area.

Macario is 53 years old and has 2 kids, only one of which is still living at home. His wife works as a housecleaner and sometimes gets jobs taking care of the elderly.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services

loans.use: Invest in rice and also clothing at large quantities

loans.name: Marta Josefina

texts.en: My name is Marta, and my primary activity is the grocery store I operate in my house in the center of my community. I have been working at this type of job for several years, and it allows me to take care of my family and business. My children work with me during their free time. Thanks to this business I can help cover my family’s expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of chicken, rice, sugar, butter, dairy products, meats, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and selling clothing

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
Business Description

Mrs. Gutierrez and her husband own and run a hardware store and a bazaar that have been open for business for four years. Lately, both businesses have seen a rise in sales due to the construction of residencies around the sector where they are located.

Loan Investment

She wishes to expand her businesses and purchase additional merchandise to cover the many orders her customers have placed. Her goal has always been to take good care of her customers so that they will keep coming back and help her grow financially.

Personal Information

She is 24 years old and her family is united and stable. Her goal is to improve and expand her businesses locations

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

La Señora tiene una ferretería y bazar que empezó hace cuatro años , en el negocio le ayuda su esposo y últimamente su negocio esta creciendo ya que en el sector donde esta ubicada se esta realizando el plan de construcción de viviendas.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella quiere ampliar su local y comprar mas mercadería ya que sus clientes han realizado varios pedidos, siempre su meta es brindar una buena atención para de esta manera crecer junto con ellos.

Información Personal

Tiene 24 años y dos hijos su vivienda es mixta y su estabilidad familiar es buena, su meta es tener su local amplio y crecido.

loans.use: Ampliar su local y compar mas mercaderia

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Mr. Porfirio S. is 47 years old and has been married to Mrs. Maria Davalos, 41 years old, for 23 years. The couple has two children, an 18 year old daughter and a 14 year old son. Their daughter is finishing high school and plans to begin college studies next year, while their younger son is just finishing 8th grade.

Don Porfirio was working at his city's Coca Cola factory, until it closed in 1997. With the severance package he received, he started to sell wood (raw material for making furniture) as a travelling salesman, and he used a truck to do so. At the same time, his wife began buying and selling chickens.

He is asking for a loan to buy wood in the largest possible quantity, so that he can get the best price.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Porfirio S. de 47 años de edad, está casado hace 23 años con la Sra. María Dávalos de 41 años de edad. La pareja tiene dos hijos, una mujer de 18 y un varón de 14 años de edad respectivamente; la mayor se encuentra terminando la secundaria y tiene planeado estudiar una carrera universitaria el próximo año, mientras que el menor se encuentra cursando el 8º grado. Don Porfirio fue empleado de la fábrica de Coca Cola de esta ciudad, hasta que se cerró la fabrica en el año de 1997; y con la liquidación salarial que le dieron fue que él se inicio en la venta de maderas terciadas (materia prima utilizada para la fabricación de muebles) en forma ambulante y para esto cuenta con una camioneta en el cual se moviliza. Mientras que su señora se dedica a la compra y venta de gallinas. El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de maderas terciadas debido a la gran demanda que tiene, además comprando en cantidad se consigue a mejor precio.

loans.use: To buy higher quality wood

loans.name: Crecencia Beltran

texts.en: Crecencia sells new women’s clothing and beauty products from her home in the Nigua community of San Cristobal.  Her son and daughter are twins, now fully grown in their forties.  Crecencia has become increasingly aware of the number of entrepreneurs in her area who specialize in women’s beauty items.  As a result, Crecencia will use her loan to purchase clothing, makeup, and personal care merchandise that she believes her competitors do not offer.  She hopes the new products will ensure her business’s continued growth.

loans.use: The purchase of new clothing, makeup, and women's beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase on her stock.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata B. is married with a child. She runs a cosmetics business in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  With one child, 27 year old Fatmata would like to build a good family life for her child in future.  She would like to expand her business to earn sufficient income for the child's future education and to build a house for her family.  She is therefore requesting a $350 loan.

loans.use: Fatmata would like to expand her selection of cosmetics to sell in order to increase her profits

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: S. Loaveth is 40 years old, married with 3 children, and comes from Ilaje Area of Lagos State, Nigeria.  She has been in business since 1999, using a manual ceiling machine for the production of  pure water (sachet water).  She needs the loan amount of $775 to increase her production of sachet water for sale

loans.use: To buy a ceiling machine and other material needed for the production of pure water

loans.name: Hortence

texts.fr:
Hortence S., 44 years old and married, requests a loan to buy supplies and strengthen her business. She sells palm oil, oysters, and dried fish. Hortence has been a good customer of the Grand Yoff Diabir village bank in Ziguinchor for the last six and a half years and has always honored her commitments. The income drawn from her business allows her to support her household. She is seeking a 14th loan which she plans to reimburse at the end of six months with a single repayment.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Hortence S. ,44 ans, mariée demande un prêt pour acheter des produits et renforcer son activité , Elle vend de l'huile de palm, des huitres et du poisson sec.Hortence est une bonne cliente du BV de Grand Yoff Diabir à Ziguinchor depuis six ans et demie et a toujours respecté ses engagements. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d' entretenir son ménage. Elle sollicite ce 14ème prêt qu'elle compte rembourser au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery products

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Ms Julia is a mother of 5 children. She is a very honorable and resolute woman. Despite her advanced age, she continues to give her best in order to help her family. Ever since she was a young girl she learned the honest work of stock farming and agriculture, a knowledge she has passed downed to her own children who have also managed to improve their quality of life. Ms Julia and her husband started their livestock business with only one cow. After a number of sacrifices they were able to increase little by little the quantity of calves. At the moment, with the support of their children, they have started to produce delicious cheeses. They sell these on the weekends in the city of Ayaviri. As a result of the inclement weather, they have decided to purchase and store fodder for the nourishment of their animals. It is with this end that they ask for your generous help.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Julia, es madre de 5 hijos, muy empeñosa y dedicada, pese a su avanzada edad sigue dando lo mejor de sí, para sacar adelante a su familia, desde muy niña aprendió la noble labor ganadera y agrícola, conocimientos que también transmitió a sus queridos hijos y con los que ahora se ha trazado la meta de mejorar su calidad de vida y la situación económica de su familia.Ella y su esposo iniciaron su negocio de compra y venta de ganado sólo contando con una vaquita, luego de innumerables esfuerzos pudieron poco a poco aumentar la cantidad de becerritas, actualmente con el apoyo de sus hijos ya adolescentes viene dedicándose a la producción y elaboración de deliciosos quesos que cada fin de semana comercializan al por mayor en la ciudad de Ayaviri, ahora viendo las inclemencias del tiempo decidieron comprar forraje para preveer y reservar la alimentación de sus generosos animalitos.Es con ese fin recurre a tu generosa ayuda para solicitarte gentilmente un préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase fodder to feed livestock

loans.name: Judith's Jega Group

texts.en:
Judith K., age 38, is married and has 3 children (ages 18, 15 and 11). She owns two businesses: selling stationary and is a decorator of halls for functions. She started her business 10 years ago and is able to make a monthly profit of about $162.

Judith has taken out three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase both businesses. She hopes for a new loan to buy better quality materials for decorations. Judith will share this loan with her loan group, which totals 15 members.

In the picture, Judith is the 1st on the right standing, with a black scarf

loans.use: to buy good materials for better hall decoration

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en: Ilgar K. is a 41-year-old man who has been breeding calves for meat production and selling milk to the local people and milk factory since 1999. He lives with his family in the Internally Displaced People Settlement of the Bilasuvar region. As an Internally Displaced Person, Ilgar receives financial monthly support of $70 US from the government. But it does not cover the family's main needs. To improve his main source of income, Ilgar is applying for $1200 US to purchase two calves for $300 US each and one milk cow for $600 US.

loans.use: To purchase two calves and one milk cow

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey K. and her husband are both farmers who live in Prasat Village in Kampong Thom Province. She has two children: one of whom is married, while another is as a garment worker in Phnom Penh City. Mrs. K. wants to reduce transportation costs and she is asking for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for household and business use. The loan will allow her family to reduce expenses and increase business opportunities. The picture is of Mrs. K. and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida baji is the wife of G. A.. She lives in Multan, Pakistan. Rashida baji is a housewife and takes care of her children. She also makes clothing sheets and sells them in the market to earn good profit. She is the mother of one daughter and one son. Her husband makes cloth and sells cloth in a big market to earn a good profit. Their monthly earning is $131.22. Rashida baji is applying for a loan to buy material (cloth) to make clothing sheets.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shabnam baji wants a loan to buy more scrap for her scrap business. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy material (thread and needles) for her decorative embroidery business. Habibia baji wants a loan to buy new bicycles to resell. Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell in her neighboring area for burning in stoves, since gas is not available.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Ms. Norn S., 27, single and living with her parents in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, has four brothers and sisters. One of her sisters is married and lives outside the family home while another is a garment factory worker. Her youngest brother studies at the local school.

Norn has been a silk weaver for 18 years, a skill she learned from a nearby villager. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village who resells them in Phnom Penh. Now Norn is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Merima

texts.en: Merima H. was born in 1988 and comes from the village Jaruke near Lukavac. She is employed and lives with her parents. She earns not so much but she has extra income from her little business at home. She has chickens and other poultry. Merima wants to expand her business, so she is taking her first loan from WWI. She will buy poultry and food for it. Merima hopes to develop her business really well.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Qantuwayta Group

texts.en:
Gardenia C., Aydee P. and Valeriana S. are members of the community bank, Qantuwayta, which is located in a small community, Vischongo, about 3500 meters above sea level in the Andes. Adjacent to the Pampas River, the area is known as an archaeological zone wich much potential in the agriculture and commercial markets.

Gardenia lives in the area with her 7-year-old son and has run a store from her house for the past 2 years. Unfortunately, about 2 years ago, she also experienced a small robbery in her store, which she has since been able to overcome with the help of loans and her savings from FINCA Perú. Her biggest dream is to have her son attend the University and become a professional; she is currently saving to be able to fulfill her dream.

For the past six months, Aydee has been working at her snack bar which continues to grow. She dreams of finishing her studies and being a professional.

Valeriana is married with three children, aged 25, 22 and 19. She came to the area from Lima five years ago to help her mom, and has not yet returned. She is currently saving for her mother’s health and has a dream of having her own small business to run with her family.

Their loan of 1,700 soles will be invested by the women into their businesses. Gardenia will invest into the purchase of more groceries including fruits and vegetables. Valeriana will purchase drinks and cakes for the restaurant. Aydee will purchase more items for her store including candies, ice cream, ice cream cones and cakes.

The community bank, Qantuwayta, needs a loan of 5,100 nuevos soles in order for 11 of its members to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To improve their businesses.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Mrs. Vorn S. lives in Prey Chuor village in Takeo Province, where she makes a living as a chicken seller. Because she is not earning enough money to support her family well, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more chickens to re-sell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Sok Phorn, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. The couple has four children, three of whom are employed in garment factories, while one works in construction.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to re-sell.

loans.name: Souzan

texts.en:
Souzan is a 19-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their child. She owns a beauty salon and she has been a hairdresser for two years. Souzan has requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her salon. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan.

She expects that the loan will help her improve her business. Souzan is special in her work because of her dedication to her business. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she faced some difficulties like lack of cash, merchandise, and tools. In the future, she plans to expand her business by opening another shop.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her salon

loans.name: Yoeum

texts.en:
Yoeum S. is 30 years old and works as a professional tailor from her home. She has been running that business for about 10 years, and she can make around US$ 2.50 a day, while her husband is a construction worker, making US$ 3 a day. This couple has five children, three of whom are students while two are too young to attend school.

Yoeum S. would like to use this loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. The bike will allow her husband to stop paying for public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Annety

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 58-year-old Annety K. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with six children between the ages of 22 and 39. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Annety has been running a grocery business since 2007. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Annety currently earns about US$500 from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional stock of grocery items. In the future, she plans to open another business. Annety thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To stock additional grocery items.

loans.name: Saidniso

texts.ru:
Саиднисо Раджабова  1970 года рождения, замужем имеет одного сына. Муж уехал на заработки в Россию, живет с сыном. Для улучшения своей жизни и оплаты обучения сына, она  вынуждена выходит на рынок торговать. Она как и все осталась без работы в годы гражданской войны.
 Теперь Саиднисо торгует сухими фруктами : кайса(сушеный абрикос), фисташки, миндаль и другими орешками. Товар привозят поставщики( фермеры), она закупает у них оптом и продает по выгодной ей цене. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2008 года.
texts.en:
Saidniso R. was born in 1970. She is married with one son. Her husband is a guest worker in Russia, and Saidniso lives with her son. In order to improve their living conditions and earn money to pay for her son's education, Saidniso sells food at the market. Like others, she lost her job during the civil war. Saidniso sells dried fruit: kaisa (dried apricot), pistachio, mandel and other nuts. She buys the product from farmers and sells it at a profit. She has been a Microinvest client since 2008.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying dried fruits

loans.name: Patricia Esther

texts.es:
La señora Patricia Esther Fernández Sánchez tiene  26 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, tiene 1 hijo el cual los depende económicamente de ella.
Patricia se dedica actualmente a la venta de útiles escolares, anteriormente vendía productos de belleza, y por motivos de campaña escolar invirtió en la venta de útiles, en el cual esta obteniendo buenos resultados, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa. Cabe resaltar que la empresaria solo trabaja en base a pedidos.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invirtió en materiales para iniciar su negocio de manualidades y tejidos.
Con el crédito de 400 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la implementación de su negocio, es decir surtir sus productos para aumentar sus ventas.
Patricia tiene el gran sueño de poner una tienda para la venta de bisutería.
texts.en:
Patricia Esther F. S. is 26 years old, living in the Moche district, province of Trujillo, department of Liberty. She completed high school, and she has one son, who is her economic dependent. Patricia now sells school supplies. Before, she sold beauty products, but because of school campaigns, she switched to selling the supplies, which has had good results. Her business is run out of Patricia's home. It is fitting to note that the businesswoman only works on a by-order basis. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from the Luis Alberto S. II Communal Bank, Patricia invested in materials for starting her handicrafts and fabric business. With this loan of 400 soles, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will set up her business. That is to say, she will stock up on inventory to increase her sales. Patricia's main goal is to set up a store for selling costume jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para implementar su negocio,surtir sus productos para el aumneto de sus ventas.

loans.name: Vilma Lucia

texts.es: La señora Vilma vende ropa y cosméticos desde hace cuatro años, negocio que inicio con dinero que su esposo dio y prestamos que  Afodenic atorgo, este es su octavo crédito. Tiene 49 años de edad, reside en Villa Venezuela, tiene cuatro hijos  los cuales estudian, su esposo es promotor de venta. Con este crédito quiere cambiar el techo de su casa ya que esta en mal estado. Da la gracias a la institución por la oportunidad que ha brindado por que ha podido lograr las metas propuestas. Sus planes es poder invirtiendo en su negocio, seguir haciendo mejoras a su casa y poder ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Vilma has been selling clothing and cosmetics for the past four years, a business she started with money her husband gave her and a loan granted to her by Afodenic. This is her eighth loan. She is 49 years old, lives in Villa Venezuela, has four children who are students, and her husband is in sales. She would like to replace the roof of her house, which is in bad shape, with this loan. She gives thanks to the institution for the opportunities it has provided, because she has been able to meet her goals. Her plans include being able to invest in her business, continuing to make improvements to her house, and helping her children with their educations.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to replace the roof of her house, which is in bad shape.

loans.name: Fadhima

texts.fr: Madame  Fadima T. est une femme mariée qui a l’âge de 36 ans. Elle est enseignante depuis octobre 1995 et habite au quartier Sampathé de Thiès. Elle a commencé l’enseignement dans une autre ville, mais depuis 1998 elle enseigne à l’école Mayoro T. à Thiès. Elle fait le commerce des tissus en provenance du Mali et de la Mauritanie. Elle a décidé d’intégrer l’IMCEC dans cette activité, et avec premier prêt avec laquelle elle envisage d’acheter des tissus pour les revendre. Les bénéfices qu’elle réalise lui permettent de rembourser les intérêts de son prêt et d’investir le reste dans son commerce.
texts.en:
Ms. Fadima T. is a married woman who is 36 years old. She has been a teacher since October 1995 and lives in Sampathé district of Thiès. She started teaching in another city, but since 1998, she has been teaching at the Mayoro T. school in Thiès. She does commerce in fabrics that come from Mali and from Mauritania. She decided to join IMCEC for this business, and with her first loan, she envisions buying fabrics to resell. The profits she earns will enable her to make loan interest payments and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Lun's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan group made up of four people, all residents of the province of Siem Reap. Mrs. Lun N. has been selected to be leader by the other members.

Lun N.'s is age 32 and is married with three children, who are studying in the local school. Her husband is a security guard for a small company in Siem Reap Province. Lum N. currently makes a daily income by driving a motor taxi, and is earning approximately of $2 a day to supply her family's food needs.

Unfortunately, she can't attract as many clients as before because her motorbike has frequently broken down. To solve the matter, she is looking for a loan from Kiva to add with her saving to buy a new motor to replace the old one.

The other three borrowers are:

K. sells fish that she catches from Tunle Sap Lake. She requests a loan to purchase a boat for fishing.

S. is a fisherman who is seeking a loan to buy more nets and traps for fishing.

K. owns a boat to pick up passengers for income and she is looking for a loan to buy a piglet to raise.

loans.use: To buy a new motor

loans.name: Diệp Tố

texts.en:
U. Diệp Tố, age 38, lives in the town of Phúc Yên. She is married and has two school-aged children. U. earns her living by owning and operating a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. U. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 1999, U. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. U. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

U. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND ,which will be used to invest in expanding her business by buying breeding livestock. The loan will be the ninth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. U. plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Tumenjargal

texts.en:
Tumenjargal O. lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His two oldest sons go to the local community colleges and the youngest daughter is a high school student.

Tumenjargal has a small carpentry shop in the town where he mostly makes a variety of home and office furniture. Most notably, he made all the wooden furniture for the local government house. He made all the office furniture with traditional style.

Tumenjargal started his carpentry business in 2005 with capital of 150,000 MNT. With his profits, he was able to expand his business by adding new machineries. Today, his business capital exceeds 500,000 MNT and locals come to him and order home and office furniture.

In the future, Tumenjargal hopes to expand his small shop to a carpentry factory to produce all sorts of furniture for locals. He requests a loan to purchase wood for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To buy wood for his carpentry business

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La joven Lidia Sequeira tiene la edad de 28 años, reside en la comarca los cedros  municipio de Villa del Carmen, soltera, vive con sus padres, trabaja como administradora tributaria en la alcaldía. Sus planes es mejorar su nivel de vida. Para obtener otros ingresos ella vende ropa, inicio con ahorros y vendiendo solo por encargo, con este crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar ropa, zapatos variados para niño y adulto lo cual espera captar nuevos clientes, a si como obtener mejores ganancias. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo de los créditos.
texts.en:
Young Lidia B. is 28 years old and lives in Comarca Los Cedros in the Villa del Carmen municipality. She is single and lives with her parents. She works in administration at the mayor's office. Her plans are to improve her quality of life. To generate other sources of income, Lidia sells clothing. She began with savings and only did commissioned-sales. With this loan, Lidia will buy clothes and shoes for children and adults, which she hopes will bring in more clients and more revenue. She thanks Afodenic for their loan support.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Salceda

texts.en:
Salceda P.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. Salceda is just starting this business. She is 51 years old, married and has 10 adult children. She is from the village of Unidos.

In 2008, Salceda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Salceda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.

Salceda is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a food business

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Karla Patricia M. se dedica hoy en día a la venta de comida la cual es preparada por ella misma ofreciéndola en su establecimiento en la ciudad de Managua donde llegan a comprar los alimentos y sus clientes pueden sentarse en su casa de habitación a disfrutar la comida puesto que tiene un lugar amplio donde ofrecer dichos alimentos.

Es de importancia destacar que ella ha logrado salir adelante gracias a los créditos brindados por Ceprodel. Hoy en día ha solicitado un nuevo crédito con el propósito de invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y así ofertarlos en su localidad en su propio establecimiento.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para elaborar alimentos

loans.name: Remigio Antonio

texts.es: El señor Remigio Antonio P. Sánchez , tiene la edad de 37 años , habita en el barrio San José de los Ríos , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos de hogar , ellos tiene dos hijos a su cargo , los cuales estudian su secundaria y le apoyan con las actividades agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Remigio desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento ya que el cultivo carece de insumos necesarios para tener una buena producción , el inicio esta actividad con el esfuerzo propio , los planes futuros hacia el cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y poder mejorar la producción el cual espera vender a buen precio  para poder cubrir los gastos y necesidades personal.
texts.en:
Mr. Remigio Antonio P. Sánchez is 37 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San José de los Ríos, in the municipality of Ticuantepe. Remigio lives with his wife, who works and helps out with the household costs. They have two children who attend secondary school and also assist with the farm work. Remigio hopes to improve his family's living conditions. For almost 20 years he has worked in the agriculture business, starting the venture independently with his own effort. In the future, Remigio hopes to diversify the crops grown on his property, but now the biggest difficulty he faces is that the farm lacks the tools and supplies necessary to cultivate a good harvest. With the loan, Remigio is going to buy fertilizers and other supplies that will allow him to increase his production, which he hopes to sell at a good price to cover the business costs and his family's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and use them on the farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Liberty Group

texts.en:
Agnes is thirty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one child who is in school. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town.

Agnes is a business woman and the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Liberty’. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or commercial activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. Some of the group members, however, also render services such as sewing/tailoring, hairdressing, etc. They want a loan to buy goods and materials in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy additional stock

loans.name: Hadela Rahoof Group

texts.en:
This is Hadela Rahoof Group and Hadela is the group leader. They each would like to expand their business and buy essential materials.

There are three members in this group:

Hadela wants to take a loan for her poultry business.

Sharifa wants to take a loan for her tailoring business to buy essential materials.

M. Rahoof wants to receive a loan for his metal shop.

They are all happy from this process and they have requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani.

loans.use: To expand her poultry business

loans.name: Mrs. Yoem Bit Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoem B. is group leader for a group of four members who all live in Boeng Satong village in Takeo province.

She and her husband, Mr. Sou Sorn, are farmers who own a four-hectar field of land to cultivate rice to earn their living. This couple has 5 children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

Although this family tries to work hard, they still earn little income to support their living.

Thus, Mrs. Yoem B. has decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and plow more land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her farms

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina E., the one wearing the yellow sleeveless dress, is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old. Gina is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a business selling fish in the market. Gina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide the basic needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ovi

texts.es: Ovi de 29 años vive con su pareja Arcángel de 32, con quien tiene 3 hijos, Yerson de 10, Nicol de 5 y Wedner de 1 año, juntos viven en una casa alquilada.Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la agricultura, con la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo mayor siembra papa (tubérculo peruano)  y algunas verduras pequeñas, paralelamente cría animales como  ovinos, porcinos y cabezas de ganado, que cuida con dedicación, pues le gusta atenderlos como se merecen, ambas actividades le  son rentables porque le generan buenas ganancias económicas, luego de las cosechas lleva sus productos agrícolas al mercado mayorista donde tiene un puesto, ahí vende a buen precio todos sus productos y cuando se encuentra en apuros económicos oferta sus ovinos o porcinos entre sus vecinos; como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro planea sembrar en mayor cantidad.Este es el tercer  préstamo que tiene con MFP y siente que económicamente progresa por lo que desea acceder a más créditos, además paga puntualmente sus cuotas.Con el dinero del préstamo, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizantes para cuidar sus cultivos de papa porque desea tener mas cosechas fructíferas.
texts.en:
Ovi is 29 years old and lives with her partner Arcángel, age 32, with whom she has three children: Yerson, age 10; Nicol, age 5; and Wedner, age 1. They live together in a rented house. For the past five years, Ovi has worked in agriculture. With help from her husband and her oldest child, she plants Peruvian potatoes and a few other vegetables. She also raises animals such as sheep, pigs and cattle, which she tends with dedication, since she likes to give them the treatment they deserve. Both activities are profitable for her because they generate good economic returns. After harvesting her crops, she takes them to the wholesale market where she maintains a stand. She sells all of her products there for a good price, and when she finds herself in economic difficulties, she offers her sheep or pigs for sale to her neighbors. Since she is an enterprising woman, she plans to plant larger quantities of crops in the future. This is her third loan with MFP, and she feels that she is making economic progress, so she would like to continue having access to credit, and she is punctual with her payments. With the funds from this loan, she will purchase several sacks of organic compost and fertilizers for her potato plants, because she would like to have more abundant harvests.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sacks of compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom T. (pictured here), aged 57, lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has nine children: seven sons and two daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home, three have full-time employment in Phnom Penh, two attend school and the other two assist their parents in the business.  

Sokhom and her husband have been selling fruit for 20 years.  Because the house where they live is damaged in some parts, Sokhom is asking for a first loan of $1,000 to repair her house. She also plans to use a part of her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.es:
Gertrudes es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Gertrudes es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Gertrudes vive en el Distrito de Pampa Cangallo en donde tiene una tienda de abarrotes, además compra quesos que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Gertrudes necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Gertrudes son construir su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Gertrudes is part of the Tarpuy communal bank. (Tarpuy means "To Seed" in Quechua.) Gertrudes is 40 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in the Pampa Cangalla district, where she has her grocery store, and where she buys cheeses to sell in Ayacucho. Gertrudes needs a 1,500 PEN ($525) loan to invest in rice and sugar. She hopes to one day be able to build a home in Ayacucho and buy a car to transport her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram M. is 32 years old. Together with his wife, he has 4 children. Akram is an experienced bread baker. He has been baking for more than eleven years and his wife helps him with his business. Having many customers, Akram is selling the majority of his products just from his place. However, he is also running a trading place in the central local market where he sells lepeshka (the national bread). Now Akram is requesting $1375 to purchase flour wholesale for his business. Akram is grateful for all supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase flour wholesale to bake lepeshka (the national bread).

loans.name: Turi Centro (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
La señora  Elisabeth G. vive en el centro de la parroquia Turi, este lugar es bendecido ya que llegan muchos turistas nacionales y extranjero a visitarla por el balcón de Cuenca ya que desde el se puede admirar en su mayor parte la ciudad, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, mientras que los más jóvenes buscan oportunidades en la ciudad o en extranjero.

Elisabeth es una socia alegre,  es oriunda del cantón el Sigsig tiene 40 años y se encuentra separada hace 7 años por falta de comprensión en su hogar,  de esa relación procreó  4 hijos que se encuentran de 17, 14, 8 y 6 años  todos son estudiantes de primaria y secundaria respectivamente, no tiene casa propia y viven arrendando.

Se  encuentra en su segundo ciclo y los créditos le han beneficiado para gastos de su hogar, ella se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y también a la cría de vacas, pollos, borregos los que vende en su casa o en la feria de ganado. Con el crédito que reciba va a comprar  pollos, vitamina  y  su alimento para incrementar su criadero.

Su meta es dar a sus hijos una buena educación  que es la única herencia que les servirá para que sean unos buenos profesionales 

María Lastenia vive en la parroquia Turi a unos 5 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca,  tiene 49 años es casada y como fruto de su amor concibió  6 hijos que se encuentran de 31, 29, 26, 24, 21, 18 años, los 4 primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, solo vive con sus dos últimos hijos, su esposo trabaja como pintor de casas,  su  casa es propia en  recompensa al esfuerzo de varios años de trabajo.

María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y también cría de  cuyes y pollos que luego los vende en su casa o en la feria libre de Cuenca y  a  veces los utiliza para su consumo. Este es su octavo ciclo dentro de  este grupo de mujeres luchadoras, los créditos le han beneficiado para sacar adelante a su familia,  y ahora con el nuevo crédito comprará pollos y vitaminas para seguir con este negocio que le ayudado a superarse económicamente.

Su sueño es ver que todos sus hijos tengan una buena estabilidad económica en su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Elisabeth G. lives in the center of Turi Parish. This place is blessed with the arrival of many domestic and foreign tourists who come to see the views of Cuenca that can be admired from most parts of the city. The residents engage in agriculture, while the young people look for opportunities in the city or abroad.

Elisabeth is a cheerful member and a native of Sigsig Canton. She is 40 years old and separated from her spouse seven years ago due to a lack of understanding in their home. This relationship resulted in four children (ages 17, 14, 8, and 6). They are all students attending primary and secondary school respectively. She does not have her own home and lives in a rental property.

This is her second loan cycle and her previous loan helped with the household expenses. She dedicates herself to her household chores and also raises cows, chickens, and sheep to sell from home or at the livestock fair. With the loan she will receive, Elisabeth will purchase chickens, vitamins, and feed to increase her poultry farm. Her goal is to provide her children with a good education since this is the only asset that will help them become successful professionals.

María Lastenia lives in Turi Parish, approximately five minutes outside of the city of Cuenca. She is 49 years old, married, and gave birth to six children who are now ages 31, 29, 26, 24, 21, and 18. The four oldest children are married and live independently. María lives with her two youngest children. Her husband works as a housepainter. Their own house serves as a reward for their years of hard work.

María is dedicated to her household chores and also to raising guinea pigs and chickens that she later sells from home or at the open fair in Cueca. Sometimes they are reserved for personal consumption. This is her eighth loan cycle with this group of determined women. These loans have helped her move her family forward. With this new loan, she will buy chickens and vitamins so that she can continue in this business to help her excel financially. Her dream is to see her children have financially stable households.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, vitamins, and feed

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam N., age 48, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has four children. She is engaged in a business selling of various kinds of soft drinks in her village, earning a gross income of USD 11 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a mechanic, earning a gross income of USD 13 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since N. and her husband have had these businesses. N. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase more mechanic supplies for her husband. (N.'s husband is pictured with his son.)

loans.use: To buy more mechanic supplies for her husband's business

loans.name: Julia Ester

texts.es:
La Sra. R. Gaitán vive en el municipio del Viejo, departamento de Chinandega.  
Ella va utilizar el crédito  para la construcción de una cocina que necesita hacer en su casa de habitación.

Este es el crédito no. 9 que tiene en la Institución  los cuales ha cancelado sin ningún problema.
Ella dice estar muy agradecida con la Institución por atenderla durante tantos años y comprenderla cuando ha tenido problemas, ella vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos el cual es taxista y le ayuda en todos los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. R. Gaitán lives in the town of Viejo, in the department of Chinandega. She will use the loan to build a kitchen that she needs in the house where she lives. This is her 9th loan with the Kiva field partner, and she has repaid all the previous loans with no problems. She is thankful to the field partner for having worked with her for so many years and for understanding her when she has needed help. She lives with her husband, who is a taxi driver. and her three children. Her husband helps with all the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction (addition of a kitchen)

loans.name: Activo De Vitarte Group

texts.es:
ACTIVO D. VITARTE

La alcancía comunal “Activos D. Vitarte”, está conformada por 8 socias quienes se desempeñan en labores D. comercio minorista e informal, trabajan con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 12 años y 6 meses, sin duda es el grupo más antiguo D. la institución.
Constanza, mujer emprendedora y entusiasta, actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta, tiene 60 años,  es viuda y tiene 4 hijos.
DesD. hace 6 años se dedica a la conversión D. gas llamado “BUBACAR SERVICE”, negocio que ha logrado poner con sus hijos. Con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria ha logrado aumentar más locales para su negocio, su gran sueño es seguir creciendo como empresaria.
El reciente préstamo, Constanza lo destinará en la compra D. mercadería (tanques, repuestos para carros) y así diversificar sus productos para cubrir la demanda D. sus clientes. Agradecen el financiamiento para sus actividades comerciales y seguirán cumpliendo con sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
The "Activo D. Vitarte" village bank is maD. up of 8 members who work in retail sales and have worked with EDAPROSPO for the past 12 and a half years; it is undoubtedly the oldest group that has worked with our institution. Constanza, the current president, is a very enterprising, enthusiastic woman who is a 60 year old widow with 4 children. For the past 6 years, she has worked in a gas conversion business called Bubacar Service; the business has helped her to support her children. Due to her labors, she has increased the number of storefronts of her business; her dream is to continue to grow her business. This loan will be used to buy inventory (tanks, replacement parts, etc.) and to diversify her products to meet her customers' demand. The group members are grateful for the loans to finance their businesses and they commit to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory (tanks, car replacement parts)

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 41 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rochelle owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Her 1.75 hectares of rice field produce almost 200 sacks of rice. Rochelle has been engaged in her business for over six years now.
In 2008, Rochelle joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rochelle is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About CEVI
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa B. is from the village of Parabba, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is 56 years old, married, and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Josefa owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2005, Josefa joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her extended family.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Chimgee

texts.en: Chimgee B. is a single mother who lives with her two daughters in the Arhangai province, western Mongolia. She and her daughters live together in a house they own. Chimgee operates a used clothing retail business in the local market. She began her business in 2005 by importing clothing garments from China. Chimgee began her business with a working capital 500,000 MNT, and it has now reached 1,700,000 MNT. Chimgee lost her husband in a car accident in 2004. She is an open-minded and hard-working woman who wishes her daughters get good education in the future. Chimgee is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing as well as diary products in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and diary products

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita L. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old, is married, and has four adult children.

Anecita owns and operates a business buying and selling of fish  in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anecita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: La Alternativa 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Luz is the coordinator of her group, La Alternativa 5 & 6 (The Alternative). She makes her home in a simple structure with her longterm partner and four children. She says that her most difficult challenge was to start her business. She spent so many years asking HOW she could do it. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying cooking and working (by working she want to see her dreams come true).

Luz is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business, which she started it with less than $100 US, for nine years. By selling little by little and reinvesting in her business, after two years of Esperanza loans she is earning a better income.

Luz plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing, shoes and underwear. She will use the profits to to buy a television and invest in more products. She want to improve her business and her plans are to buy a pick-up truck and use it to carry her sales to other communities to sell more. She wants to build her business locally and have a big store to sell both wholesale and retail.

This associate began with Esperanza because she liked the way it pays and provides more than just a loan. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes and underwear to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita C. is from Barangay 5, Tangub City. She is 48 years old and is married with four adult children. Angelita owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Angelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Angelita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
To earn a living, 45-year-old Mrs. Oun S. owns a location outside of her home where she distills white wine to sell. Oun S. also uses any leftovers from distilling to raise a few pigs to generate additional income. Besides this, she and her husband always take time to plant a rice crop during the rainy season.

Their pigpen frequently breaks down, so Oun S. proposes to repair it but she lacks money. Therefore, she has decided to seek a loan in order to mend her old stall. If there is enough money from the loan, Oun S. will build a bigger stall for her pigs.

loans.use: To mend her old pigpen

loans.name: Donatilda

texts.es:
Donatilda es casada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo uno estudia, Donatilda tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado ubicado cerca del cementerio, actividad que realiza todos los días desde la mañana hasta la noche, además en el mismo local tiene su polleria, cuenta con el apoyo de 3 personas, también tiene otro pequeño restaurante en otro lugar que es administrado por su hija.
Dontilda es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella y solicita un crédito de 2000 soles para la compra de cerveza y gaseosa.
Donatilda vive en casa alquilada y su mayor sueño es comprar su casa y que el ultimo de sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Donatilda is married and has four children only one of whom is still in school. She has a restaurant in a rented locale near the cemetery. She is open daily from morning till night. She also has a poultry shop in the same locale. She has three staff persons that help her. She also has another small restaurant that her daughter runs. Donatilda is member of the Anabella communal bank and is asking for a 2000 sol loan to buy beer and soft drinks. Donatilda lives in a rented house and her greatest wish is to buy a house and that the youngest of her children becomes a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
