Teresita S. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 58 years old. Teresita has seven adult-aged children and is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a specialized retail store buying and selling of sand and gravel for construction purposes in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M., age 18, lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children.  Esther has a business in tailoring, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials like cloth and thread. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Esther hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Esther hopes to expand more on her business. 

Esther is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her meet new friends and learn important life skills.

loans.use: to buy more materials like clothes

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Isatu.  She is married, and has five children who are 10, 12, 14, 16, and 18 years old.  

In 1995, Isatu established her food items business in order to generate income, educate her children and support her family overall.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to add stock to her business from the neighboring country, Guinea.  Isatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan. 

In the future, Isatu plans to buy land, educate her children and establish a savings account.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more containers of palm oil

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Milagro, se dedica  a la venta de tostadas de plátano, enchiladas y refrescos, vive con su familia, tiene 44 años es madre soltera tiene un hijo, en su familia todos trabajan, residen en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, para iniciar con este negocio contaba con el apoyo de su madre y una amiga le enseño a preparar esta venta, no tiene horario de trabajo y desea adquirir mercadería para realizar la venta.
Para realizar esta inversión ella solicita un préstamo que le ayude para poder preparar mejor su trabajo y obtener mayores ganancias, ella comprara plátano verde, preparativos para los refrescos  entre otros que le son necesarios.  
Su fin es aportar al negocio el dinero para crecer y ofrecer más a los clientes, estar pendiente de las necesidades de su hijo y velar por que no le falte la alimentación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Milagro sells fried plantains, enchiladas, and sodas. She lives with her family, is 44 years old, and is a single mother with one child. Everyone in her family works. They live in the Transito department of San Miguel. To begin her business she counted on her mother’s help as well as a friend who helped her prepare it. As of now she does not have a work schedule and wishes to obtain merchandise to be able to sell. To be able to invest she needs a loan that will help her better prepare her work and make the highest possible profit. She will buy green bananas, things to serve sodas with, as well as other necessary things.
Her goal is to obtain the money for her business so it can grow and she can offer more to her clients, be more available for her son and make sure he always has something to eat.

loans.use: Green plantains and things to serve sodas with.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence M.  is a  farmer residing in Nkubu town in Eastern Kenya. She produces bananas, macadamia, and milk which she sells locally.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years.  She depends fully on farming as she has no other source of income. She has one employee.
 
She has requested this loan of KES 30,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to  buy dairy goats. She plans to upgrade her banana farm and start selling in a better market in the future.  Her two  main challenges are diseases in animals and lack of proper veterinary services.

loans.use: Buy dairy goats

loans.name: Tumurbagana

texts.en:
Tumurbagana L. lives with his wife and five children in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family have lived in their house for past 10 years. His oldest son is a police officer in the local police department and his two middle daughters, Myagmartogtoh and Tserennadmis work as a teller in the bank and manager in the Ulaanbaatar cashmare company respectively. His younger daughter attends university and his youngest son is in kindergarten. 

Tumurbagana used to work as a driver in the transportation section between 1986 and 1993. He started his car repair center business in 2002 in his home after operating a taxi service using his own car based on his many years of experience as a driver. He provides all kind of car repair services to his customers and has established a good business in his local community. Because of his many years of experience, he is known in his town for quality repairs. For the future, he plans to continue grow his business in order to provide his family and buy fuel efficient car for himself. 

He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more car repair supplies and tools from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongoia.

loans.use: To purchase more car repair supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchasing goats for resale

loans.name: Maria Ayde

texts.es:
La joven Maria Ayde de 32 años de edad vive con sus padres en el Municipio de Nueva Guinea.  ella aún no ha formado su propio hogar,  trabaja para el ministerio de Educaciòn desde hace 4 años, de donde recibe sus ingresos mensuales el cual le ayuda a su familia con los gastos del hogar ya que son una familia bien unida y humilde de escasos recursos econòmicos pero muy responsable en sus compromisos, ya que gozan de excelentes recomedaciones.  

Solicita su primer crèdito a la instituciòn con el apoyo de Kiva para construir una habitaciòn y asi tener mayor privacidad en su hogar, pues necesita su propio espacio. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es ir poco a poco mejorando su vivienda y tener establidad laboral para seguir ayudando a su linda familia.
texts.en:
Maria Ayde is 32 years old and lives with her parents in the municipality of Nueva Guinea.  She has still not formed her own home.  She has worked for the Ministry of Education for four years.  This is where she makes her monthly earnings which help her family with the household expenses, as they are a close-knit and humble family with limited financial resources.  However, they are very responsible with their commitments, as they have excellent recommendations.

She is requesting her first loan from the lending institution with Kiva’s support in order to build a room and thus, have more privacy in their home as she needs her own space.

Her biggest dream in life is to improve their house, little by little, and to have work stability to continue helping her wonderful family.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Samuel Muumbiati

texts.en:
Samuel Muumbiati M. is thirty-three years old. He is married to Josephine Andeso and together they are blessed with two children. They live in Langas in Eldoret Town. His wife, Josephine, works as a green grocer in the same area. 

Samuel is a fruit vendor in the Eldoret Town Centre. He has been in this business for three years and he earns a monthly income of eight thousand shillings.

This will be Samuel's first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the entire loan to buy fruit, like pawpaw and avocado. With the income that he will earn, he plans to expand his business further.

In the future, he hopes to raise his standard of living and buy his own land.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe V. is a widow who lives in Brgy. San Sebastian, Samboan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a food production/sales business and an e-load retailing business.
Fe joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Fe has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, raising the family's standard of living.
This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital for her business (purchasing fresh fish, meat and other ingredients) so that she could continue to save up for its future expansion. Fe V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish, meat and other ingredients

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua is a married woman with three children, all of whom are adults. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for the past nine years, selling at the market to her neighbours and town dwellers. Mwanamvua faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season the demand for fish is low hence leading to poor returns. She hopes to sell fish wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu because it has not many legal requirements.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es: La Sra. Ludith S. D.
texts.en: Ludith S. D.

loans.use: to buy fabric of different sizes and colors, different colored thread, and parts for her sewing machine

loans.name: Sonata En Invierno Group

texts.es: Carla es una nueva integrante D. la Alcancía Comunal “Sonata en invierno” es conviviente y tiene 03 niños en casa por quien velar y educar. Las 07 integrantes D. su Alcancía Comunal la conocen desD. hace mucho tiempo, Carla  se dedica  a la venta D. Helados en forma ambulante en diversos clubes D. Chosica y también en forma D. pasajera en los ómnibus interprovinciales que atraviesan su comunidad. Carla junto con su esposo han logrado enfrentar la vida yendo D. un lado a otro incluso migraron a otro país vecino pero regresaron con ganas D. echar andar un propio negocio, pues con su esfuerzo han logrado comprar un auto para que su esposo labore como chofer. El sueño D. Carla es comprar un puesto D. venta para ofrecer prendas D. vestir y calzado y establecerse, el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra D. Helados para sus ventas en su mochila D. viaje. En la foto posan nuestras socias D. la alcancía comunal  Sonata en Invierno, luego D. su reunión D. desembolso en nuestras instalaciones, las menores son sus hijas.
texts.en: Carla is a new member of the communal bank "Sonata en Invierno."  She lives with a partner, and they have 3 children in the home to look after and educate.  The 7 members of her communal bank have known each other for a long time.  Carla travels from place to place selling ice cream.  She sells in some clubs in Chosica, and also on the interprovincial buses that pass through her community.  Carla and her husband have managed to cope with life going from one place to another, even migrating to a neighboring country.  But they came back wanting to start their own business, and through their efforts they managed to buy a car so that her husband could work as a driver.  Carla's dream is to buy a sales stand where she could sell clothing and shoes and establish herself.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of ice cream to sell from her travel bag.  In the photo, you see the members of the communal bank "Sonata en Invierno" after the meeting in our institution where they received their loan.  The little ones are their daughters.

loans.use: to buy ice cream

loans.name: Venaline

texts.en:
Venaline J. is a young woman of twenty-five years, married and a mother of two children. The family lives in Waunifor in the outskirts of Eldoret town. Venaline has been a maize farmer for the past four years. She makes a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

This will be Venaline's second loan from KADET LTD. She successfully repaid her first loan, and with this loan she plans to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the income that she hopes to get, she plans to buy a dairy cow.

In the future Venaline wants to buy another piece of land, educate her children and invest more in dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy maize seedings and fertilizer

loans.name: Kyakuwa Development Group

texts.en: 34 year old John M.  has been a food sales businessman for the past 2 years in Kazinga food market, Mukono. The happily married father of 2 says he began by selling tomatoes and later diversified to bananas, eggplant, fruits, vegetables, cassava, beans, and rice.  In spite of his short experience in this business, friends say that John's ambition, diligence, and determination are stocks in trade and will help give his business longevity.  John started this business with savings from his earlier job at a maize flour-making factory in Mukono Town.  He dreams of owning a retail shop in the near future. From John's own account, this business generates him 100,000 shillingas weekly profit. He says with this loan he is going to purchase more foods such as rice, cabbage, yams and millet to resell

loans.use: to purchase rice, cabbage, yams and millet to resell

loans.name: Paul Kiarii

texts.en: Paul has been farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past 11 years.  He is 35 years old, married, and has three children.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be his fifth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans in a timely manner.  He plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Paul hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jehová Es Mi Rey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jehová es mi Rey lo conforman José Manuel, Oscar, Kenia del Socorro y Carmen cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. El coordinador del grupo es el señor José Manuel de 33 años quien tiene una pulpería desde hace un año la cual con el préstamo piensa surtir en granos básicos, carne, chivería…etc. Él es casado tiene tres niños de 2, 9 y 13 años respectivamente.
Los otros integrantes son Oscar de 25 años tiene una pulpería, Kenia del Socorro vende calculadoras desde hace un años y Carmen vende cosméticos.
texts.en:
The “Jehová es mi Rey” (Jehovah is my King) group’s members are: José Manuel, Oscar, Kenia del Socorro and Carmen, four hard working, enterprising people.  The group Coordinator is José Manuel, 33, who has had a grocery store for the last year.  He plans to use the loan to stock it with basic grains, meat, snacks, etc.  He’s married and has three children who are 2, 9, and 13 years of age respectively.

The other members are Oscar, 25, who has a grocery store, Kenia del Socorro who has sold adding machines for a few years now and Carmen, who sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of buying and selling nipa (palms) in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years. Gleceria earns additional income from fish vending and fishing.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock of nipa to sell for her business. Gleceria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of nipa to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 40 years. He is 62 years old, and married to Eunice. He normally sells his produce in Ndunyu Njeru market, as he only practices small-scale farming.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is married with 4 school-aged children. She has a food stall where she sells rice. Sherlita has had this business for 5 years.

She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more sacks of rice to offer for sale in the community. She usually earns about 2,500 PHP (~$62) each month in this business.

In the future, Sherlita hopes that her business will improve so that she can pay for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Makaba

texts.en: Makaba is 40 years old and lives in Jacob town. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have four children between the ages of 6 and 13 years old. All of them attend school. For the past seven years, she has been selling Lappa (traditional cloth) and drinks in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more Lappa and drinks to expand her business. She plans to build a house and buy land in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more Lappa and drinks to expand her business

loans.name: Guillermina De Lourdes

texts.es:
La Señora. Guillermina es socia del banco comunal Fuerza Trabajadora, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad por su belleza arquitectónica, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, también tienen una gran variedad en su gastronomía.
 
La Señora. Guillermina tiene 45 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 26, 23 y 15 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja y le ayuda  económicamente, su segunda hija ayuda en casa y su tercera hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como latonero (enderezado de latas de vehículos), no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Guillermina es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Avon y Yanbal, esta actividad  la realiza hace 4 años y vende sus productos todos los días y sin un horario fijo.

Doña Guillermina va a invertir su crédito en la compra de cosméticos de las dos marcas.

Su meta es de llegar a ser una estrella en la venta de estos productos.
texts.en:
Guillermina, 45, is a member of the Fuerza Trabajadora community bank.  She lives on the outskirts of Cuenca, a city named a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its beautiful architecture.  The area's people maintain their culture and traditions and its cuisine is known for its great variety.

Guillermina is married and has 3 daughters, 26-, 23-, and 15-years old.  Her oldest daughter has a job and lives independently.  Her second daughter lives at home and helps out around the house.  Her youngest daughter is in high school.  Her husband is a "latonero" (an auto-body-shop worker).  The house where they live is rented.

Guillermina has owned a cosmetics sales business for 4 years.  She sells Avon and Yanbal products.  She works every day, with no fixed hours.  

Guillermina will use the loan to stock her business with Avon and Yanbal products.

Her goal is to be a star saleswoman.

loans.use: to buy Avon and Yanbal products for her cosmetics sales business.

loans.name: Muhorro Tweimukye Group

texts.en: Damyano is a Ugandan male, aged 40 years, who needs a loan to buy maize and groundnuts to sell. He hails from the Kyenjojo district. He is a father of four children and has a wife who is a peasant in the same area. He lives in a semi-permanent house and dreams of educating his children and building a permanent house. He acquired his initial capital from cultivating maize and groundnuts on a small scale and his dream is to have a store of maize and groundnuts for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Lida es una mujer de 25 años de edad, ella pertenece al grupo La nueva esperanza tiene  8 integrantes, este grupo tiene formado 2 años y es caracterizado por ser mujeres empeñosas y responsables con sus familias. Lida a su corta edad es vendedora de productos de belleza y organizadora de eventos (festejos, agasajos) con las ventas de productos de belleza ya tiene 5 años y se está preparándose para ser capacitadora. En la organización de eventos ella y su conviviente comparte el trabajo, gracias a sus ingresos como la de su conviviente, pueden darles educación y alimentos a sus dos hijos, y también pagar la construcción de su vivienda, ella está muy orgullosa de sus logros, con este préstamo piensa comprar material de sonidos y terminar con la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Lida is a 25-year old woman who belongs to the group La Nueva Esperanza. The group was formed 2 years ago and has 8 members who are characterized as persevering women and responsible with their families. 

At her young age Lida sells beauty products and organizes events (parties, celebrations). She has been selling beauty products for 5 years now and she is working to be a trainer. She and her partner share the event planning work. 

Thanks to her income, along with her partner's, they can provide education and food for their two children and pay for the construction of their home. She is very proud of her achievements, and with this loan she plans to purchase a sound system and finish the construction of their house.

loans.use: to purchase a sound system.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 54 years old and married, with 9 children.  Antonia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like softdrinks, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

Antonia has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.  Antonia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items like soft-drinks, groceries etc., to sell in her store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 54 years old. She is engaged in selling vegetables and kakanin (native sweet delicacies). She earns money to cover the every day expenses for the education of her four children. She is thankful that her children can help her in preparing the goods, especially on non-school days. Most of the time she lacks enough funds to provide an allowance for her children. 

For this reason, she is asking for a loan amount of PHP6,000 from Alalay Sa Kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc. to buy beans, eggplants, cabbage, sugar and milk to make kakanin and sell to their village. This will be a big help in expanding and upgrading her income.Through this, she can provide enough allowance to her children. She hopes it will also be a factor in uplifting their poor standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beans, eggplant, cabbage, sugar and milk to make kakanin.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo de 38 años de edad, es soltero, vive en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Segundo  es la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) desde hace unos años, el lugar donde cría  sus animales en la parte posterior de la casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y granos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela en la ciudad de Piura, también cuenta con tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y una vez que cosecha podrá obtener otro ingreso económico para sus gastos personales. 

Ha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar el alimento para sus animales y de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para ofertarlos a un buen precio. Segundo es una persona conocida en el lugar donde vive porque siempre se preocupa por mejorar en la vida, con el finalidad que en un futuro pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Segundo, 38, is single and lives in his own house, which does not have electricity. They live in the district of Tambogrande in the department of Piura, an area where people farm, raise cattle and make artisan crafts.

For some years, Segundo has raised and sold sheep. He raises them in the back of his house, giving them balanced feed and natural grains. Once they've reached the ideal size and weight he sells them in different markets. He has established customers in the city of Piura. He also has land where he plants limes, which at harvest time provide another source of income for his personal costs.

He asked asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy food for his animals and fertilizers to improve his fields, which will allow him to keep the animals well-fed and get a good price for them. Segundo is well-known in the area where he lives because he's always trying to improve his life, with the goal of having a better quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizers to improve his farm land.

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
Feryal, a talented 45-year-old housewife, makes artificial flowers from plastic and other material to sell. (Since Feryal is a conservative person, her son, Mahmoud, has agreed to appear in the photo.) Her business is based at home, and it has been running for a while. Her son, Mahmoud, 24 years old, helps her sell her products mostly to decoration and florist shops.

Feryal now has applied for this loan to buy more materials so she can make a larger quantity of items and spread out to include more point of sale shops.

loans.use: to buy more materials so she can make a larger quantity of artificial flowers and plants

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 58-year-old woman who raised three sons. Two of her sons are married and have started their own families. She is still living with her husband and her unmarried son. Each of them has his own job. To fill her free time, Fatmeh opened, with the help of her husband, a small food store in their neighborhood. She sells kids' snacks, sugar, salt, canned goods, etc.

Now Fatmeh wants to add more items, like chocolate, tofu and other to her store so she can be prepared for the upcoming holiday season.

loans.use: To buy more items like chocolate and tofu to sell

loans.name: Vakkos

texts.ru: Ваккос любящий отец и муж. Его жена работает в колхозе. Он сам 12 лет занимается садоводством и скотоводством. Он воспитывает одного ребенка. Для создания лучших условий для семьи он старается много работать. Он хочет получить займ в размере 5000  сомони для приобретения ГСМ и минеральных удобрений для подготовки земли к новому посеву. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: Vakkos is a loving father and husband.  His wife works at a collective farm.  Vakkos has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for 12 years/  He is raising one child and tries to work a lot to provide the best conditions for his family.  Vakkos wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 3000 somoni to buy fuel and lubricant materials and mineral fertilizers in order to prepare the land for a new sowing.  He hopes to get your help and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel and lubricant materials

loans.name: Rister

texts.es:
La Sra. Rister pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Inmaculada”, del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento D. San Martín. Tiene 63 años, está casada y tiene 03 hijos que ya son independientes.
Se inició elaborando bocaditos para buffet (humitas, empanadas, juanecitos), es así como se hizo socia del banquito comunal porque era lo que le gustaba hacer y le sirvió para ayudar a su esposo con los estudios D. sus hijos que ahora ya son profesionales, pero tuvo que dejar D. trabajar por algunos incovenientes que surgieron en su vida, paralelamente vendía productos D. belleza por catálogo como Esika. Actualmente se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza y ropa para adultos ya que tiene clientes fieles que siempre están requiriendo estos productos y D. esta forma demuestra, con lucha y esmero, que se pueD. generar ingresos a cualquier edad.
Con este nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00,  comprará productos D. belleza, ropa para niños, adultos y zapatos, para incrementar el stock D. su negocio, algunos D. ellos son pedidos.
Rister es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora,  gracias a su esfuerzo ha sabido surgir y mantenerce en el negoio.
texts.en:
Rister belongs to Virgen D. la Inmaculada Communal Bank, in the Tarapoto district, province and department of San Martín.  She is 63 years old and married, and has three children who are already on their own.

She became a member of the communal bank when she began making buffet snacks ("humitas" [corn tamales], meat pies, and "juanecitos" [a type of tamal maD. with rice]), because it was what she liked to do and it helped her to help her husband with the education of their children, who are all professionals now.  She had to stop working because of some problems that came up in her life.  On the siD. she was selling Esika beauty products by catalogue.

Currently she works selling beauty products and clothing for adults, since she has loyal customers who always need these products.  In this way she shows, with struggle and care, that you can generate income at any age.

With this new loan of 1,200 PEN she will buy beauty products, clothing for children and adults, and shoes, to increase the stock in her business.  Some of the products are requests.

Rister is a hard-working and enterprising woman.  Thanks to her effort she has been able to rise up and get by in her business.

loans.use: to buy her products (perfume and clothing).

loans.name: C 8913 Twizamure Group

texts.en:
Laurence is 51 years old and has three children between the ages of 9 and 20. She owns a fruit business, which is open from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day except on Sunday. She is the leader of the group, which is called "C 8913 TWIZAMURE" in the local language. She is the second person from the right side. 

Laurence has 10 years of experience in this work and she has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more fruits such as bananas for resale. With any profit from the loan, she will save money for her future and pay her children's school fees. Laurence hopes to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits such as bananas for resale.

loans.name: July

texts.es: La señora July se dedica a la venta de peluches en la feria principal de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería para poner variedad y ofrecer a su  clientela peluches de varios colores, tamaños y formas en este mes de la navidad. July tiene cuatro hijos que todavía viven con ella .Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona Ballivián  de la Ciudad de El Alto. July es cliente de Impro desde el año 2010 y esta es la primera vez que su solicitud de crédito es enviada a Kiva.
texts.en: July sells stuffed toys at the city of El Alto’s main market.  She needs the loan to buy merchandise to have a variety available to offer her customers stuffed toys in various sizes, shapes and colors for this Christmas month.  July has four children still living with her.  She lives in her own house located in the city of El Alto’s Ballivián zone.  July has been an Impro client since 2010 and this is the first time her loan request is sent to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy assorted stuffed toys.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Iluminada has been in this business for 6 years. She earns more income from variety store.

Iluminada has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne, age 30 and married, owns a beauty salon. She has been in this business for four years and has employed two people. She describes her business environment as competitive due to the existence of many people offering the same kinds of services.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to set aside a portion of her income into savings. She hopes to open another salon in the future.

She has applied for 40,000 to buy cosmetics to use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to use in her salon

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married and has four children. Ekua sells kenkey (a dumpling-like food) and fried fish at Ankako. She has done this for six years. Her husband is a farmer.

Ekua will use the loan to buy more maize for the preparation of her kenkey and more fish for sale. 

With the new profits, Ekua hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more maize for the preparation of her kenkey and to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan (in the photo), age 31, is a house constructor. His wife, Rina, age 27, is a weaver. They have been married since 2005 and just have one young daughter. They live on an island of Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.   

Chan is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy more construction materials for his house construction business. He will also use a part of the loan to repair the house where he lives because his house breaks in some part.

loans.use: To buy more construction materials and repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en:
Bashar is a 24-year-old Syrian citizen who started three years ago working in Lebanon as an employee in a cafe to sup[port his beloved family back in Syria.
His limited monthly income and his family's increasing living needs, made him decide to start his own business, but he needs an external financial support to start his natural beauty cosmetics selling business.
That's why he is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to purchase natural beauty cosmetics and start his own retail selling business as an additional income to support his family back in Syria.
This is Bashar's forth loan cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, through his previous loans he was capable of financially supporting his beloved family back in his hometown Syria, where at the same time he proved to be a good standing borrower.

loans.use: To purchase natural beauty cosmetics and start his own retail selling business as an additional income to support his family back in Syria

loans.name: Vaai

texts.en:
Vaai lives in one of the few inland villages on the island of Upolu in Samoa. The are of Lalomauga is rural with the main activity being taro plantation however cattle farms are also very common there.

Vaai is the secretary of her lending group in the village and is very active in its activities, which includes sometimes chasing late payments.

She runs a small general store in the village which is quite popular and a meeting place. Like many Samoan women she also sews and sells clothes.

She is pictured in this photo by her sewing machine holding up the village lending groups loan repayment book for which she is responsible.

loans.use: Purchase stock for general store and home improvement

loans.name: Fany Guadalupe

texts.en:
My name is Fany Guadalupe. I have run a used clothing business in the center of my community for a number of years, so I am very familiar with this line of work. The most important part is that it allows me to tend to my two children and at the same time generate income to help cover family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Translator

Mi nombre es Fany Guadalupe, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de Ropa Usada, ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que conosco muy bien y lo mas importante es que me permite atender a mis 2 hijos y a la vez me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Buy a load of summery clothes, sheets and undergarments.

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
Joanna M. A. is married to Secundario de Jesús and together they raise their three children, Jose Julian (2), Jose Enaro (5) and Joanni M. (8). She sells women’s clothing, inexpensive jewelry, and beer from her house and along the roads in her town of Sanchez. She has always sold clothing and this loan will help her buy more clothing to add to her inventory. She says her goal is to continue to grow her business for the wellbeing of her family.

NOTE: Joanna is one of five micro-entrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, which have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their shares of this $750 loan together. If a member is unable to pay in full and on time, the group is responsible for making up the deficit before a payment can be made. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Purchase new women's clothing and jewelry

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mrs. Suy P. is a 38-year-old mother of 4 children and lives with her husband in a part of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She sells ducks and chicken eggs on a roadside of her community, where she can moderately make about $5 each day. Her husband, meanwhile, is self- employed as a motor-taxi driver, whose income is a potential help for his household.

Mrs Suy P. is currently requesting for a loan to repair her house, which normally leaks during a rainy season. In the future, she would like to open a shop selling rice, food and some snacks to the people in her community.

loans.use: To repair house which normally leaks during a rainy season.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela lives with her partner and has three children from her ex-partner. It was then, when she separated from her ex that she started her business of selling natural products. This was more than a year and a half ago, when through a friend, Gabriela was recommended with the coordinator of the products and that is how things started. Now she has a good group of clients, since they have verified that the products she sells are good and work to improve people's health. She wants to continue her sales and improve her income.

Gabriela is asking for a loan of US $1200 to buy products and offer them to her clients directly. She is offering to pay the loan in 6 months. She and her family thank you very much for your support to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Gabriela vive en unión libre con su pareja y tiene tres hijos de su ex pareja, y fue en ese momento cuando se separó que inició con su negocio de venta de productos naturales, esto fue hace más de un año y medio, que por medio de una amiga fue recomendada con la jefa de los productos y ahí comenzó, ahora ya tiene una buena cartera de clientes, ya que han probado que los productos que vende son buenos y funcionan para el mejoramiento de la salud de las personas, ella quiere continuar con sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.

Gabriela esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $1200 para surtirse de productos y poder ofrecer directo a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Business Description

Yessica has 3 years of experience running her business. She began with the help of a family member who encouraged her to begin selling these products. She works daily from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. She has earned a loyal clientele in the small amount of time she has been in business which have helped increase her earnings. She offers home delivery of her products as well as selling them from her storefront.

Use of Loan

The loan will be used to invest in additional merchandise for her business. The time of year is fast approaching in which she receives requests for specific products.

Personal Information

Yessica is a single mother. Her son is 3 years old. She lives with her In-Laws who provide her with all the support she needs. The home in which she lives is of mixed construction (cement and wood). Her goal is to grow her business and comfortably provide for her son.

:

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Yessica tiene una experiencia de 3 años con su actividad. Se inicio con la ayuda de un familiar la cual la incentivo para la venta de estos productos. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. Ha logrado en poco tiempo tener buenos clientes que han hecho que su capital crezca. Ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante y en su domicilio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en surtir su negocio con mercadería. Se viene la temporada buena donde tiene pedidos.

Información Personal

Yessica es madre soltera. Tiene un hijo de 3 años. Vive con sus suegros los cuales le dan todo el apoyo que ella necesita. La casa donde vive es de construcción mixta. Su meta es poder llegar a crecer en su negocio y darle todas las comodidades a su hijo.

loans.use:
Purchase additional merchandise

Comprar mas mercaderia

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 39, married with 5 children, and she cares for 4 orphans. Easy to smile, Josephine enjoyed showing me her line of clothes and the material which she uses to make them. She is a tailor and she sews traditional African wear, with a Nigerian accent. She specializes in making the traditional Gomesi dress, worn for special occasions and by elderly women as a sign of respect. She also has a line of jewelry. She has been in business for nine years.

Josephine has a pleasing business nature. She is quite sociable, has a positive outlook and is liked by all. She has a manual sewing machine, which is better than electric in villages where electricity can be out for days. In the town where I stayed, not only was the electricity out, but they had not had water for 10 days. Most rural villages have only central pumps to which people walk for miles with plastic yellow jerry cans to fill with water each day. Even small children 6 and older are seen carrying water.

Josephine would like to eventually own a boda-boda, or motorbike, and to buy an embroidery machine. But that is just a dream; for now she will use her loan to buy more material and embroidery for her business.

loans.use: Josephine plans to use her loan to buy more material and embroidery for her clothing design business.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John K. sells second hand clothes in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  He purchases 3 – 4 bales of clothes every two weeks and has to travel to Freetown twice a month.  John believes if he could have enough capital to purchase the goods in bulk that he would increase his income and reduce time for traveling. At 45 years old, John K. believes a loan of $350 will enable him expand his business. John is married with 4 children.

loans.use: John would like to increase his income by reducing the amount of time and expense of traveling to Freetown to purchase clothing bales

loans.name: Bufanala A Group

texts.en:
Annet K. is a 37-year-old mother of two living in Kamuli, Uganda. She makes a living by running a retail shop. Each week, she makes $20,000 Ugandan shillings a week—or about $12 U.S. dollars. With her share of the loan, she wishes to buy more stock to expand her store. She's taken out loan before to kickstart her business, and paid it back in full and on time.

Annet is investing in a loan of $900 U.S. dollars with three other women. In this type of group loan, the funds are distributed among the members, each of whom invests in her own business. They all guarantee each other's loans, so if one member can't repay, the others are responsible. Margret A. wants to grow her business trading produce, while Monica N. wishes to do the same with her grocery store. Lastly, Annet B. also wants to develop her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to expand a retail shop

loans.name: Onome

texts.en: Onome I. is a farmer. She is married with three children and is from Delta State, Nigeria. She has been a farmer since 2002 and studied her trade for seven years. She needs a loan of $175 to buy pineapple suckers and cassava stems for planting, and cassava to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cassava and other farm products to plant and to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Since she moved into her current home, Julia has been trying her luck with different types of businesses, such as a general store, clothing sales, selling food from her house, etc. When she was dismissed from her job at the end of the 1980's, she has always tried to find a way to generate income to help cover the costs of her home. Despite the fact that her husband works as a driver, they have generally needed extra income for any emergency that always seem to happen.

Currently, Julia works to prepare food according to the orders that people ask her for. This is not daily work and this allows her to work lending her domestic services in a residential area of Lima as well. Her dream is to get capital and invest in a big business. All of this is with the goal of being able to give a good education to her daughters, ages 20 and 14.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Desde que se mudó a su actual vivienda, Julia ha estado probando suerte en distintos tipos de negocio, ya sea en bodega, venta de ropas, vendiendo comida en su casa, etc. Cuando la despidieron de su trabajo a fines de los ochentas, siempre ha visto el modo de cómo generar recursos que ayuden a cubrir los gastos de su casa. A pesar de que su esposo trabaja como chofer, generalmente, siempre se necesita de un ingreso extra para cualquier emergencia que nunca faltan. Actualmente, Julia se ocupa de preparar comida según los pedidos que algunas personas le hacen. Este trabajo no es diario, es por esto que le permite trabajar también prestando sus servicios domésticos en una zona residencial de Lima. Su sueño es obtener un buen capital de trabajo e invertir en un negocio grande, todo esto con el fin de poder darles una buena educación a sus hijas de 20 y 14 años.

loans.use: Investment for a new business

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila a 64-year-old lady, owns with her husband a refrigeration appliances repair shop. They also receive additional income from the rent of 10 rooms. Teofila has a 30-year-old son, who helps out in the repair shop. Teofila and her husband have more than 5 years experience in the refrigeration appliance sector. They do not have much business competition since they fixed client and regarding the renting of the rooms, there is always demand. The present request is to open a small grocery store which they plan to build at their own residence. They will have a good variety of products, with different price offerings and quantities .This it is the sixth loan of Teofila with our institution and she has always showed to be punctual and responsible for the on time payments of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Teofila de 64 años de edad junto a su esposo tiene un negocio de taller de reparaciones de heladeras, refrigeradores, y por otra parte también perciben alquileres por la renta de 10 habitaciones. Teofila tiene un hijo de 30 años de edad, que ayuda en el taller a sus padres. teofiula y su esposo tienen una experiencia de más de 5 años en estos negocios. No tiene competencia ya que cuenta con clientes fijos y en cuestión a las habitaciones siempre existe una demanda por habitaciones. La presente solicitud es para abrir una tienda de abarrotes la cual la montará en su propio domicilio, los productos que entran en una tienda son varios y de diferentes precios estos se diferencian por producto, procedencia, cantidad, etc. Esta es la sexta secuencia de Teofila con nuestra institución y siempre demostró ser una persona puntual y responsable con sus pagos.

loans.use: Open a small grocery store

loans.name: Rabeca

texts.pt:
Rabeca is 28 years old and she is from Matutine, in the province os Maputo. She is married and mother of 3 children with ages ranging from 1 through 10 years old. Rabeca lives with her husband, her children and two stepsons. Rabeca worked as a housekeeper for a while and later she got a position as a janitor with T.D.M (Mozambique Telecommunications), where she was paid a monthly salary of MNt 1,400. Her husband started remodeling their house but he grew wary of it and Rabeca decided to request this loan to keep the construction moving forward using locally produced construction materials. Rabeca requests her first loan in the amonut of MTn 8,000 to purchase material for this construction. She is certain she will be able to pay back the loan since their living expenses are still her husband's sole responsibility. One of Rabeca's greatest dream is to finish remodeling and to buy furniture for her house. Rabeca plans on requesting another loan to open up a basic products retail business in front of the house so that she can make her dream of purchasing furniture to her home come true.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Rabeca tem 28 anos de idade e é natural de Matutuine, na província do Maputo. Casada maritalmente, Rabeca é mãe de 3 filhos, com idades entre 10 anos e 1 ano de idade. Rabeca vive com o seu marido, os 3 filhos e dois enteados. Rabeca trabalhou como empregada domestica durante um tempo, mas depois conseguiu um emprego como faxineira da T.D.M. (Telecomunicações de Moçambique), onde recebe um salário mensal de MTn 1,400. Seu marido começou a construção de sua casa, mas depois se desinteressou, e por isso Rabeca decide pedir este empréstimo para continuar a construção da casa com material local. Rabeca pede o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku de MTn 8,000 para comprar material local de construção. Ela tem certeza que conseguira pagar o empréstimo, dado que as despesas da casa ainda são de responsabilidade do marido. Constitui grande sonho para Rabeca ver a casa concluída e mobiliada. Assim que concluir este empréstimo e ver sua casa pronta, Rabeca pretende pedir outro empréstimo para abrir um pequeno negocio de venda de produtos da primeira necessidade em frente de casa, com vista a realizar mais cedo o sonho de mobiliar a casa.

loans.use: Purchase construction material.

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en: Mr. Chhum B. is a fisherman from Thnort Village in Kampong Thom Province. His wife is a fish-paste seller in the market and they have three children, all of whom are in school. Due to a growing fishing industry, B. is asking for a loan to purchase more fishing equipment. The loan will help him expand his business and hopefully increase his family’s income. B.'s wife and daughters are pictured.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing equipment

loans.name: Fadila

texts.en:
Fadila is a 38-year-old woman from the town of Tesanj in northern Bosnia and Herzegovina. She is married and her husband works full time. Fadila has started a tailoring business, which she reports is going very well. She alters clothes and makes new outfits as well, and has found herself very busy this summer with requests for all kinds of services.

Fadila is asking for her first loan from ZŽene za ZŽene in the amount of 650KM (US$500) to buy more materials for sewing, including different kinds of cloth she can use for making new clothing. She wants to make more dresses and suits to sell and believes that this will be the best way to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring supplies

loans.name: Ching

texts.en:
Mr. Ching H., 36 years old, is farmer and fisherman. He has been fishing since 1993, earning around 11800 Riel (US$2.9) per day. His business depends on Tunle Sab Lake. His wife, Mrs. H. Phos, 35 years old, raises pigs and earns 8300 Riel (US$2) per day. Ching and his wife live with their four children in Anlong Somnor Commune, Siem Reap Province.

To expand his farming, and also help to increase the family's income, he seeks a loan of 700,000 Riel (US$175) to purchase a plot of farmland for growing rice. He hopes that the loan will help to increase the family's income enough to cover their living expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
El señor Teodoro C. vive en su vivienda propia en la zona de Llojeta, área suburbana de esta ciudad con su esposa y sus dos hijas.
El señor Teodoro trabaja como empleado en la empresa de agua de la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa vende pescado en los mercados.
El crédito solicitado será destinado a la conclusión en obra fina de dos habitaciones que mejoraran las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. 
Esta es la sexta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Teodoro C. lives in his own house in the neighborhood of Llojeta, a suburban area of this city, with his wife and two daughters. Teodoro works as s an employee at the water company in the city of La Paz and his wife sells fish in the markets. The loan requested will be used to finish up two new bedrooms that will improve living conditions for his children. This is the sixth time he has requested a loan. He qualifies favorably according to the socioeconomic analysis that has been done and he can obtain a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish up work on two new rooms in his house so can give his family a more comfortable place to live.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha Y. M. is a member of community bank, Renacer, which in Spanish means, “rebirth.” Bertha is married with two children who are studying. With the help of her daughter, she sells firewood and propane.

Every week she orders firewood and it is delivered to her in a truck. With her loan of 2500 soles she will invest in her business by purchasing more firewood and propane. She is currently saving so she can invest more into her business and continuing growing her business.

loans.use: With her loan of 2500 soles she will invest in her business by purchasing more firewood and propane.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.ru: Джалматова Майрам проживает в городе Вахдат. Является знаменитой портнихой в своем кишлаке. Занимается данными услугами уже 35 лет. Возраст 58 лет имеет двоих детей. Кредит планирует использовать для покупки швейной машинки. Она хочет нанять помошницу  и поэтому ей необходима дополнительная машинка. Таким образом она увеличит объем готовой продукции , да еще и создаст новое рабочее место. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mairam J. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is one of the well known seamstresses of her village. She has been providing these services for the past 35 years. She is 58 years old and has two children. The loan will be used to buy a sewing machine. She wants to hire an assistant, so she needs an extra machine. This way she can increase output, as well as providing employment. The loan will be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing maching

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 41-year-old woman who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with her husband and their five children. Amal is a seamstress and also owns a clothing shop. She has been in this business for fifteen years. Amal is asking for a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase fabric and sewing machines. This is her first loan.
Amal excels in this business  because she has a lot of friends and she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her family, friends, and neighbors. When she first started her business, she couldn’t afford a sewing machine, but with determination she has made her business a success. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and sewing machines.

loans.name: Thoung

texts.en:
S., 35, who lives in Kandal Province, makes a living providing printed invitation letters for wedding parties. She has been running the business since 2003 and is earning around US$ 5 per day. She is married and the mother of three children, who are still living in the family home. Her husband Sok Savy, 36, is a military policeman.

S. presently hopes to have a new investment for her husband, thus she would like to ask for a loan of US$ 1200 for her husband to use as capital to open up a shop for repairing electronics. With any remainder of the loan, she purposes to decorate her house.

loans.use: to open up a shop for repairing electronics

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira A. is 34 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of 4 children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cows and sheep and with the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. 

Shoira is asking for a loan of 800 USD in order to buy more calves to sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal!


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Fifty years old and married with a child, Comfort wholesales and retails medicine to her customers. She is now requesting a loan of N70, 000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Juana Nila

texts.es:
La señora Juana Nila R. García tiene 34 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudio superior incompleto, tiene 4 hijos, los cuales apoyan económicamente a la empresaria.
Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en una tienda comercial ubicada en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió del Banco Comunal  “Santa Lucia II”, lo invirtió en la compra productos para forma sus pequeña tienda, inicio con cosas pequeñas pero con el apoyo del crédito empezó a comprar sus productos al por mayor y así poder vender mas.
Con el crédito de 1000 soles que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor así como andamios, pizarra, balanza en otras cosas que requiere su negocio.
Juana tiene como sueño, incrementar su negocio para que su picantería sea la mas concurrida.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana Nila R. G. is 34 years old. She lives in the Moche district in Trujillo Providence in the state of La Libertad, Peru. This small-business woman has some post-secondary studies. She has four children who help her economically. Juana has a grocery store at her house. She utilized the first loan of 300 Nuevo Soles (PEN) from the Santa Lucia II Communal Bank to buy consumer goods for her small store. She initially sold only a few items but with help from the loan started to buy them wholesale in order to be able to sell more. With the 1000 PEN loan, which Juana will repay in six months, she plans to buy wholesale produce (groceries) as well as scaffolds, slate, a scale and other goods needed for her store. Juana’s dream is to improve her business so that her small store will become the best attended.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries, scaffolds, slate, a scale and other goods for her store

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Mrs. Gorgonia T., 47 years old, is a widow and lives in the town of Aloran. She has 5 children of which 3 are in school and 2 have their own families. She is still mourning from the sudden death of her husband in March 2009. Gorgonia has remained strong for the family now that she has to raise them all by herself.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, Kiva's partner, eased the burial expenses as part of the benefits of being a member. She became a member in December 2007 and has availed loans four times already. She ventured into a “sari-sari” (general) store and successfully manages it. Today she has applied for PHP 12,000 to buy additional goods for sale.

Aside from the pension she will be receiving after her husband's death, she really hopes that someday she will be able to survive and provide a comfortable life to her children.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for sari-sari store

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
La Sra. Ada tiene 36 anos, es  soltera y tiene dos hijos.  Ella posee una despensa y carnicería con mas de 3 años de antigüedad.  Ada es muy responsable y dedicada a la actividad que realiza ya que ella lo administra y organiza todo.  Su negocio esta ubicado en un barrio no muy lejos de la ciudad de Caacupe la cual lo beneficia por la cantidad de clientes con que cuenta.

La inversión del préstamo lo destino para la compra de embutidos, carnes, bebidas, también algunos productos básicos de la canasta familiar para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.  Ella comenta que esta muy conforme con sus ingresos de las ventas porque gracias a ella cada día puede cubrir las necesidades del hogar.

En este emprendimiento que realiza en todo momento le apoya un hermano que constantemente lo visita a pesar de sus estudios y de su trabajo.  Ada agradece por el apoyo constante y dice que espera tener siempre, ya que es una herramienta muy importante para ella poder seguir adelante y con mucho éxito en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Señora Ada is 36, is single, and has 2 children. She has owned a grocery store and butcher shop for more than 3 years. Ada is very responsible and dedicated to her work since she manages and organizes everything. Her business is located in a neighborhood not very far from the city of Caacupe, which benefits her because of the number of customers she has. She will invest this loan in the purchase of sausages, meat, drinks, and other basic goods to satisfy the needs of her customers. She tells us that she is very satisfied with the income from her sales because thanks to it, she can cover her home's needs. In this enterprise, her brother always supports her and visits her even though he works and goes to school. Ada is grateful for his constant support and tells us that she hopes to always have it, since it is a very important tool to get ahead and to be successful with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise, sausage, meat, flour, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Djidja 2 .5 Group

texts.fr:
Djidja 2 .5 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village  Siguémona de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles cultivent  principalement  du riz et  de l’arachide comme activité Secondaire.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Djidja 2 .5 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les trois  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des semences de riz,  d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture,  au marché de Zansoni, M’pessoba et de Fonfona. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au  marché de M’pessoba et  de Koutiala, en détail ou en gros au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Djidja 2. 5 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 60 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement  des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Djidja 2.5 is a group of married women of the village of Siguémona in Koutiala City, Sikasso region (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. They have an average age of 40 and at least 5 children. They grow mainly rice, and they grown peanuts as a secondary business. Concerned about making their farms profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program four years ago. After having correctly repaid the three preceding loans, they are now on their fourth farm loan. The current loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of seeds for planting rice and peanuts, some minor supplies and equipment, and fertilizers and such, for farming. Supplies are gotten at the marketplaces of Zansoni, M’pessoba, and Fonfona. Following the off-season, the crops are stored for a certain time, so that they gain in value. Then the crops are sold retail and wholesale in cash transactions at the M’pessoba and Koutiala markets. Their customers come generally from large cities. After selling their produce, the group members each intend to realize a profit of 65,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to cover common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and minor supplies and equipment

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida M. is from San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Zenaida is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of products in her local community. Zenaida is just starting this business.

In 2009, Zenaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and engage in business activities. Zenaida is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family income. --------------------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “La Esperanza “ están representados por el señor Ricardo y conformado por 12 personas que en su mayoría se dedican a la venta de diferentes productos como comida al paso, cosméticos por catálogos, ropa interior y al servicio de pintura domiciliaria, a la educación y a la confección de prendas de vestir.  . La competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas de trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias y mejoramiento de su calidad de vida. En lo que respecta a experiencia en grupos solidarios la mayoría de los miembros del grupo obtuvieron financiamientos con anterioridad en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen los requisitos principales que son honestidad, responsabilidad y sobre todo ganas de trabajar.
texts.en:
Mr. Ricardo represents the members of the group “The Hope.” The group is made up of 12 people, who mostly sell different products, like street food, cosmetics through catalogues, underwear, household painting services, education, and the production of clothing. The competition in this commercial setting is high, but the members of the group know how to go forward thanks to their experience and their desire to work. The loans will be used to buy materials, supplies, and tools that help to generate a larger income, since the livelihoods of their families and the improvements in their quality of life depend on these activities. With respect to the members’ experiences in solidary groups, they have received loans before from organization similar to Fundación Agrocapital, so they are familiar with the principal requirements, which are honesty, responsibility, and, above all, a desire to work.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for businesses

loans.name: Ludah

texts.en:
Ludah S. is from the village of Binaliwan, Mahinog, Camiguin. Ludah is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ludah operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ludah has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (about $104) a month for these activities.

Ludah just joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ludah is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the first loan taken out by Ludah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
la Sra. Estela S. se dedica a la venta y produccion de tortillas, ella es una persona de la tercedad y su unica fuente de ingresos es la produccion de tortillas.
este negocio le a ayudado mucho a salir adenlante y no depender de las remesas que le mandan sus hijas de españa.
su produccion a aumentado en estos ultimos 6 meses y contrato a una muchacha para ayudarle en su produccion, por tal razon esta solicitando el credito para poder comprar mas materia prima para tener una mayor produccion y cumplir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
Estela tambien vende sopa de mondongo todos los domingos, esta sopa es una comida muy tradicional de nuestro pais y es muy apetecida por los Hondureños, tambien con parte del dinero piensa comprar una olla muy grande para hacer la sopa, porque la que tiene es grande pero siempre se queda sin sopa rapido y pierde de vender.
ella nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo bien y que se entretiene mucho con su negocio, ya que como es una persona de edad no quiere estar sin hacer nada porque dice que se va a enfermar si solo esta descanzando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Estela S. works in the production and sale of tortillas. She is a determined person and her only source of income is the production of tortillas. This business has helped her greatly to get ahead and not depend on the remittances her daughters send from Spain. Her production has increased in the last six months and she hired a young woman to help with the production. This is the reason she is requesting a loan, to be able to buy more supplies to have an increased production and meet the demands of all her clients. Estela also sells mondongo soup on Sundays. This soup is a very traditional food of our country and is very much enjoyed by the Hondureños, Also, with part of the money she plans to buy a very large pot to make the soup since the one she has is big but she always runs out of soup quickly and loses sales. She commented to us that she is very happy now that everything is going well and she enjoys her business a great deal since she is an older person and does not want to be with nothing to do because she says she will become sick if she is just resting.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of corn flour, lime, firewood, and water

loans.name: Eddy Jose

texts.es: El joven  Eddy José de 21 años de edad, es un joven esforzado para apoyar  a sus padres pues vive junto con ellos, reside en Villa el Carmen en la capital de Managua, el trabaja en servicios de seguridad en la alcaldía de Villa el Carmen, tiene 8 meses de estar laborando ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a la construcción pero a veces no había trabajo y necesitaba un salario fijo ya que le tiene una niña. Con este préstamo que esta solicitando es para hacer un cuarto a su hija y que tenga buenas condiciones como un techo propio. Da las gracias a la institución por lograr estas mejoras en su vida personal.
texts.en:
21 year old Eddy José is a young man dedicated to supporting his parents who he lives with in Villa el Carmen in the country's capital, Managua. He has worked in security services in the mayor's office of Villa el Carmen for 8 months. Previously he worked in construction, however at times there was no work and he needed a fixed salary as he has a daughter to support. With this loan he will build a room for his daughter, which he hopes will be in good condition, such as having its own roof. He gives thanks to Kiva for making these improvements possible in his personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Abu

texts.en: Abu J. is currently in the business of selling wines and beers at her bar and she is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a pharmacy. Abu is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman. She has five children and her children go to school. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
