Beatrice is forty-three years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town.

Beatrice is a business woman. She sells corn dough. She buys maize from nearby towns and prepares the dough. She supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Beatrice has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Oroyinyin

texts.en: Oroyinyin is 45 years old and married with four children.  He sells VCDs in retail to his customers. He wants a loan of N170,000 to purchase more VCDs to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more VCDs to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma T. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. She is 43 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Vilma owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Vilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Akbarali

texts.en: Akbarali is one of the most hardworking young men in the area where he lives, which differentiates him from other local residents and makes him stand out as a well-respected and very important member of his community. Farming requires a lot of effort which is why, from a young age, Akbarali has dedicated himself to this business and today is seeking a way to expand his efforts in order to support his family which consists of his wife and a little son. Because his crop provides the main income for the family, Akbarali is seeking a loan of 3,000 Somoni to plow more farmland and purchase seeds and fertilizer. The loan will allow him to expand his farming business. Akbarali hopes the loan will increase his family's income. He hopes you will support him and thanks you for your generosity. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer for sowing potatoes and onions

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
Chhuon C. is a 54 year old woman and she earns a living as a fish seller. She sells fish that she buys in bulk on credit from a wholesale supplier and fishermen. She is married with three children and her husband works in construction.

Chhuon C. needs a loan to enlarge and improve her fish selling business to be efficient.

loans.use: To enlarge and improve her fish selling business to be efficient

loans.name: Roek

texts.en:
Roek R., 49, is a determined and  hardworking woman who resides in the best territory of Banteay Meanchey, a province of Cambodia.

Presently Roek R. owns a small store along the street located near the taxi parking. At her store she sells some snack foods and soft drinks to the taxi drivers and passengers.  She can make an income of about US $5 a day and uses it to meet her family’s needs.

Her husband works with her in her business selling items. Roek R. now has three married and three single children.

Roek R. will be using her loan for different purposes. She will decorate her old house and build a bathroom for her family’s sanitation. With the rest of the loan, she will increase the financial capital of her business.

loans.use: To decorate an old house and build a bathroom.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou E. is from the village of Guinsiliban in Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old and married with 4 school-aged children.  Marilou is just starting a clothing retail store and she has joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help start the business. She is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase clothing to sell.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for her store.

loans.name: Samouen

texts.en:
Mr. Samouen L. is 37 years old and he lives in Check village in Kandal province. His wife, Mrs. Oret Sok, is a pig breeder, and he is a farmer who owns four hectares of land where he cultivates rice to support the family. On the rice field, this family has some problems, because this is crop growing season, but this family doesn't have enough money to support their field. Moreover, this field has infertile soil and is far from irrigation. 

Thus, Mr. Samouen L. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and fuel. He is the father of five children, one of whom is a farmer, while another three are enrolled in the local public school, and the other is too young to study or work. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizers, and fuel.

loans.name: Prim

texts.en:
Mrs. Prim V. is 44 years old and lives in Cheav Bdei Khang Kaeut village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Tam Bun, are farmers who own a 2-hectare (5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

In their farming, they lack financial resource to support their crops. In order to support them, Mrs. Prim V. decided to ask for 500,000 Riel from AMK to buy a water pump for irrigating their crops.

Aside from farming, Mrs. Prim V. raises pigs at home. The couple has four children, one of whom is selling spare parts for cars, two others are attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy a water pump to irrigate her crops

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester was born in 1966 and is a widow with 9 children aged between 6 and 20. Ester lives in the Nyabihu district, in the western province of Rwanda, approximately 3 hours from Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. This place is a tourist region where Lake Kivu is located.

Ester owns a small business selling the soft drinks (SODA); this business is profitable simply because of the number of tourists in this region. Ester works hard in order to get all basic needs for her family.  Ester is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more soft drinks for sale. 

With this loan, Ester will be able to earn more profits which will be used to reinvest in her business as well as for feeding her children. The hours of her shop are from 7 AM to 7 PM every day except on Saturday, since 2007. Ester does not get time to socialize with her family, simply because she is the only breadwinner for her family.

loans.use: Additional soft drinks for sale

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora María Eugenia A.,   se dedica a la venta de  pollo frito empacado vende en el mercado la terminal.
 
 Este crédito lo solicita para  compra de una cocina industrial, y productos por mayor tales como: arroz, aceite, papel fil mito, pollo, plátano así obtener mayor ganancia para tener un mejor nivel de vida.
 
Cabe mencionar que la Señora A.   esta agradecida con ceprodel por que los crédito que le ha brindado le han ayudado a crecer su negocio con nuevos productos como venta de chinela, bolsas plásticas, caramelos y cigarro.
texts.en:
Sra. María Eugenia A. sells packaged fried chicken at the terminal market. This loan she requested will be used to buy an industrial stove and products in bulk such as rice, sugar, cellophane, chicken, and bananas so that she can generate more revenue to have a higher standard of living.

It is worth mentioning that Sra. A. is grateful to CEPRODEL for the loans that have been provided because they have helped her grow her business with new products to sell such as slippers, plastic bags, candy, and cigarettes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial stove and supplies for her food business

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo P., Jr. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 31 years old. Romeo is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Romeo owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing internet services and snack vending in the local community. Romeo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Romeo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romeo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Romeo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the second loan taken out by Romeo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
54-year-old Encarnacion S. wants the remaining three of her seven children to graduate from college and have a better career in the future. Being a mother who works hard in trying to sustain the education of all her children despite her poverty, she feels sad that her four elder children have to quit from schooling because of her incapability to support their financial needs. However, when ASHI came into her life offering her the opportunity to receive a loan for financing a business, she became hopeful again. 

From the time her first loan was received, until the present loan she is requesting, Encarnacion has been trying to grow and finance a seafood buy-and-sell business in partnership with her unemployed husband. With the profit of this business, although savings are yet hard to achieve, she was able to support and sustain the education of her children. She has been also able to support the needs of her four elder children, if they can’t get hired as laborers.

Encarnacion and her husband sell their products in the public market and also to people around their village. With the loans, she can always have an access to these sales. She is determined to reach her ambition of improving the life of her family by growing her business and its profit.

loans.use: To purchase fish and other sea foods for selling.

loans.name: Eidencia

texts.es: Eidencia tiene 40 años, vive con sus hijos Jessica de 22 años, Elsiza de 18 años, Nildo de 13 años, Denilson de 12 y Tatiana de 5 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia. Desde que era muy pequeña aprendió todos los trucos y habilidades para tejer bonitas prendas, actividad que actualmente realiza para mantener a su familia. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo, porque puede disponer del tiempo para realizar esta actividad, ahora contratan su servicio, para que realice la cantidad necesaria de prendas en una fecha determinada, es por ello que veces trabaja de noche, mientras que en las mañanas atiende a sus hijos. Todos los tejidos que elabora son exportados hacia otros países, como China, por tal motivo, su trabajo es muy agotador, ya que debe tejer de 10 a 25 chompas. Es así que lleva 11 años de trabajo, ganando experiencia y perseverancia y espera con el tiempo poner un negocio más estable, como instalar una puesto en un mercado muy concurrido; aunque hace algunos años intento hacerlo, vendiendo productos comestibles en su casa, sin embargo no funcionó, ya que la zona en la que vive no era muy concurrida, pero espera tener suerte esta vez. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar material para sus tejidos y poder ganar más y ahorrar y obtener una maquina que le facilite y ahorre tiempo en el tejido.
texts.en:
Eidencia is 40 years old. She lives in her own home with her children Jessica, age 22, Elsiza, age 18, Nildo, age 13, Denilson, age 12, and Tatiana, age 5. Since the time she was very young, Eidencia has learned the craft of knitting beautiful clothes, including all the tricks of the trade. Now she uses these skills to support her family. Eidencia really likes her work because it allows her to manage her own time; her services are now in demand, and she has contracts that request predetermined quantities of her products by a certain date. To get it done, Eidencia sometimes works nights, and in the morning takes care of her children. All the products she makes are exported to other countries, for example China, and making them is quite tiring since she has to knit 10 to 25 sweaters. Eidencia has been working this way for eleven years, gaining in experience and perseverance and hopes that, with time, she'll be able to develop a more established business - for instance, she would like to have a vending post in a well-attended marketplace. She already tried to do this several years ago, trying to sell groceries from her home, but it wasn't successful since the area where she lives didn't have a lot of customers. However, Eidencia hopes that next time it will work out. This is her first loan with MFP, and Eidencia is committed to be timely with her repayments. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials for her knitting; she hopes to earn more and save more and purchase a weaving machine that would allow her to use time more effectively in her knitting.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for knitting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials for her business

loans.name: Nerguibaatar

texts.en: Nerguibaatar is 31 years old and lives with his mother in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent called a “ger.”  They have lived there for seven years. Nerguibaatar currently operates a clothing business with support from his mother. He started his business in 2004 with capital of 1,200,000 MNT and has built it to a consistent level. He attributes success to his strong selling and communication skills. Today, his working capital exceeds 3,500,000 MNT. He has built a loyal customer base that appreciates his quality products. Nerguibaatar is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more products to sell from Ereen, a popular trading town on the border with Mongolia.

loans.use: to purchase more apparel

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Otgonbaatar C. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in the Arhangai province of western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter attends a local middle school while her husband helps her out with her business.

Otgonbaatar operates a retail dairy products business in her town at the local market. She began this business in 2006 with working capital of 300,000 MNT and now it has reached 1,000,000. In 2008, she also began a clothing business. She purchased a car for her husband with the business revenues. Otgonbaatar attributes her business success to her knowledge of the local market demands. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more dairy products and consumer goods.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Lusviminda

texts.en:
Lusviminda D. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 54 years old. Lusviminda is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Lusviminda owns & operates providing recycling services. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling plastics & other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Lusviminda has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lusviminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lusviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. Lusviminda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lusviminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah M. K. is a 40 years old, married and has five children. She owns and runs a shop where she sells vegetables such as spinach and kale. Before opening this business, she made a living as a seamstress. Since she joined the Biashara Imara group in Faulu, Kenya, her business has really grown, in part because of two loans she has received and repaid. She has been in business for six years and now has two employees. Serah is applying for a loan for 50,000 KES to buy 30 bags of spinach and five bags of kale to sell to her customers. In the future, she hopes to buy a plot of land and build a house for her family to live in.

loans.use: To buy 30 bags of spinach and five bags of kale to sell to her customers

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en:
Vergenia Y. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. and married with one school-aged child. To make a living, Vergenia owns a business planting and harvesting mangoes for sale. Vergenia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 35000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Vergenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50000 PHP from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Vergenia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Digno Franklin

texts.es:
Digno de 40 años, vive en una zona perirubana en el Paraiso de Guayaquil, el tiene una panaderia en la parte delantera de su casa. Por la inseguridad que hay en el sector por donde vive opto por poner rejas en todo el local de la panaderia.

Inicio con la panaderia por la falta de oportunidades, para poder mantener a su esposa y tres hijas, comenzo con una vitrina y un viejo horno, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo readecuar su casa para ubicar una panaderia y vender tambien vivieres, en ocaciones hace carreras como chofer en su carro para tener mas ingresos y asegurar la vida economica de su familia.
 
Para poder continuar con su negocio el quiere comprar harina y huevos ya que el estar mucho tiempo de pie le causa dolor de piernas, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y surtir mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Digno is 40 years old. He lives in a semi-urban zone in Paraiso de Guayaquil. He has a bakery in the back part of his house. Because of the lack of safety in the area where he lives, Digno put bars around his house and bakery. Digno opened his bakery because of the lacking opportunities to support his wife and three daughters. He began with a glass case and an old oven, and little by little and with a lot of effort, he was able to put a bakery into his house. He also has a general store. On occasion, he works as a chauffeur so he can make more money and ensure his family's financial security. To be able to continue his business, Digno wants to buy flour and eggs since spending a lot of time on his feet causes pain in his legs. In the future he wants to be able to construct a house and improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying flour and eggs

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry A. is from the village of Frankfort, in Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur. He is 51 years old, married, and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Henry owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily-use products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Henry joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. He is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This will be Henry’s 5th loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Elena Nelly

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Elena es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y siempre le han gustado las reuniones ya que en ellas se divierte con sus amigas y aprende cosas nuevas. Mantiene una relación de unión libre y tiene 7 hijos todos mayores de edad, tres de ellos viven con ella los mismos que junto a su esposo trabajan en el campo.

Tiene una pequeña granja de pollos en su casa, compra por cajas los pollos cuando están pequeños, los cría por tres meses y luego los vende en pie o por libras a los vecinos o entrega a las tiendas de la localidad, dice que sus pollos se venden mucho ya que los cría con maíz por lo cual su carne es  parecida al pollo criollo. Trabaja todos los días dos a tres horas por día.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más pollos porque la temporada que se avecina es muy buena y quiere tener bastante.

Su sueño es tener una granja grande y con tecnología.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora Communal Bank meets in Sequita parrish, which belongs to Montecristi, a properous canton in the province of Manabí. The area is filled with hardworking people who are proud of their roots. Sequita is a parrish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and take care of their families. Elena is a founding member of the communal bank and has always liked the meetings because they have fun with friends and learn new things there. She is in a common-law marriage and has 7 children, all adults. Three live with her and work with her husband in the fields. She has a small chicken farm at her home. She buys the young chicks by the box, raised them for three months and then sells them individually or by the pound to neighbors or delivers them to local shops. She says she sells a lot of chickens because she raises them on corn and so their meat is similar to pen-raised chickens. She works every day for two to three hours per day. This loan will be used to buy more chickens because the upcoming season is very good and she wants to have enough. Her dream is to have a large farm which uses technology.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn N., 39, is married and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Purok 5 within Barangay 24 of Gingoog City in the province of Misamis Oriental on the Mindanao islands. Jocelyn runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Jocelyn has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Jocelyn is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 45 year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has five children who are 4, 7, 14, 17, 18 years old. 

Ibrahim established his fish vending business many years ago, in order to generate income. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. Ibrahim is very hard working and determined, and would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to buy fish in larger quantities. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 1,200,000.  

In the future, Ibrahim plans to sell fish wholesale to his colleagues. With his increased profit, Ibrahim plans to construct a home for his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of dried fish for resale

loans.name: Cecilia Ama Amoniwah

texts.en: Cecilia Ama Amoniwah A. is married and has a child. She has been through junior high school. She cooks banku (a local dish made from corn dough) in the evenings for sale in Abura. The photograph was taken in the morning and shows a sample of the corn dough she will be using to prepare banku in the evening. Her husband is a farmer. Cecilia assists her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. She is asking for a loan to expand her business. Cecilia plans to save the new profits from her expanded business for her child’s education.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more synthetic hair and other hairdressing materials

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 28-year-old single man from Tayouneh. Hasan has owned a coffee shop since 2009 and has five years of experience. This is his first time requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, and it’s because he wants to buy an espresso coffee maker that's better than the small one he has now, which he thinks is necessary for improving his business. His clients are his friends, relatives, neighbors, and passersby. Hasan seeks a secure living. He hopes one day he can expand his business and make a small happy family.

loans.use: To buy an espresso coffee maker that's better than the small one he has now, which he thinks is necessary for improving his business

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Comandante Ojeda de la cuidad de Atyra que dista a 19 km de la oficina regional Caacupé.

La Presidenta del comité es la Sra. Sara Noelia A. ella se dedica a la cría de pollos, la señora vive con su marido que es empleado y dos hijos estudiantes, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada y humilde dedicada a su familia y a su pequeño negocio para ayudar en el sustento de su hogar.

Hoy en día ella ya tiene una clientela formada y está queriendo optar por otra clase de negocio también para poder seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.

Ella está muy satisfecha con el apoyo que le brinda la Fundación paraguaya y Kiva no solamente en créditos si no también con las capacitaciones y asesoramientos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de alimentos para sus animales y también para lo gastos de sanitación de los mismos.
texts.en:
The women of this committee are from the Comandante Ojeda neighborhood of the city of Atyra which is 19km from our Caacupé regional office.

The committee's president is Mrs Sara Noelia A..  She raises chickens and lives with her husband, who is an employee in a company, and her two children who are students.  She is a very selfless and humble woman who is devoted to her family and to her small business which helps support her household.

Sara has an established customer base and she would like to choose another type of business in addition to her current one so that she can continue to improve her quality of life.  She is very satisfied with the support she is being given by Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, not only through the loans but also through the training sessions and advisory sessions.  She is requesting this loan to buy feed for her animals and to cover the costs of keeping them healthy.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed

loans.name: Solidario Trabajadoras De San Tiago Group

texts.es: SOLIDARIO  trabajadoras D. Santiago está formado por tres señoras, doña Sandra Magali S. D. 31  años, Rosa T. D. 32 años, y doña Hilaria T. D. 38 años , Doña Sandra tiene 2 hijos está casada,  ella  venD. en  su tortillería los tres tiempos D. comida, D. lunes a sábado ya que los domingos asiste a la iglesia, ella también hace delantales típicos que luego venD.. Se levanta muy temprano para poder realizar sus actividades.solicita el credito para la compra D. maiz  Doña Rosa T. también hace delantales típicos y venD. en el mercado todo tipo D. verduras, como zanahorias, güisquil, tomate, güicoy u otros.Solicita el credito para la compra D. verduras,  Doña Hilaria T. venD. almuerzos en una fábrica todos los días D. lunes a viernes.  Ahora ellas desean solicitar este crédito para invertir en productos para la elavoracion D. comida  y realizar sus sueños y propósitos para este nuevo año.
texts.en:
The solidarity group 'Trabajadoras D. Santiago' (Hard-Working Women of Santiago) is maD. up of three ladies: 31 year-old Sandra Magali S., 32 year-old Rosa T. and 38 year-old Hilaria T..

Sandra is married and has 2 children.  She makes sales in her tortilla bakery during the day's three mealtimes, from Monday to Saturday.  She doesn't work Sundays as she goes to church.  She also makes traditional aprons which she sells.  Sandra gets up early every morning to do her work.  She is requesting this loan to buy corn.

Rosa T. also makes traditional aprons and she also sells all kinds of vegetables such as carrots, chayote, tomatoes, squash, etc, in the market.

Hilaria T. sells lunches in a factory every day from Monday to Friday. 

The ladies are requesting this loan to invest in products for making their food and to realize their dreams and goals for this new year.

loans.use: To buy products for making food.  To buy vegetables and corn.

loans.name: Pom

texts.en:
Pom N., 42, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She sells fish, earning an income of $2 per day. Her husband raises pigs, earning an income of $1 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend $66 on food and $43 on other necessary expenses. N. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase pig food. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en: Erdenebat, 34, is married and lives with his wife and a son in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His son attends local primary school. Erdenebat started his business in 1999 making wooden products. He has expanded his business operation and now it is more stable. He makes wooden furniture and ger structure parts. A ger is a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His business is the source of income that supports his family. Erdenebat is a hardworking and motivated person who wants to expand his business and become a popular carpenter in his area. He is requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT to get more wood and increase his production.

loans.use: To purchase more wood

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia L. is a 41-year-old married woman from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Cresencia and her husband have two school-age children. To earn a living, Cresencia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. More specifically, her primary source of income is derived from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Cresencia has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2011, Cresencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. In turn, she hopes to be better able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her family's standard of living. Cresencia is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP ($250), which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan would be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is primarily comprised of farmers, fishermen and women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
ROSALIA P., ES DE MANAGUA, TIENE SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE GOLOSINAS, GASEOSA, GALLETAS, TIENE MAS DE 4 AÑOS ADE TENER EL NEGOCIO.
ES MADRE DE TRES HIJOS, PERO SOLO UNA DEPENDE DE ELLA Y ESTA SE ENCUENTRA EN EL COLEGIO.
DOÑA ROSALIA ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA  INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PARA SU NEGOCIO.
ROSALIA DICE QUE GRACIAS A LOS FINANCIAMIENTOS OTORGADOS POR CEPRODEL SU NEGOCIO HA CRECIDO Y AHOR APUEDE HACERLE FRENTE A LA COMPETENCIA.
texts.en:
Rosalia P. is from Managua.  She has a business selling candy, soft drinks and cookies.  She has had this business for more than 4 years.

Rosalia is the mother of 3 children, but only one of them is still in school and dependent upon her.  

Rosalia came to the offices of CEPRODEL to request a new loan to invest in merchandise for her business.  

Rosalia says that thanks to the financings granted by CEPRODEL, her business has grown and now she can keep up with the competition.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, candy and cookies.

loans.name: David Alfonso

texts.es:
David C. es un hombre de negocios que con su venta de bananos maduros al por mayor  desde hace 13 años,  ha logrado el sostenimiento de su hogar conformado por su esposa y sus dos hijos.  Aunque su primera experiencia fue el montaje de una tienda, decidió cambiarse a esta actividad para lograr mayores utilidades en menos tiempo de trabajo,  por eso se siente satisfecho desde que el mismo momento en que arrendó su local en el mercado de frutas y se dio a la tarea de conseguir la clientela, la que gradualmente ha aumentado agregándole nuevas  frutas. En la actualidad solicita su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual adicionará un nuevo capital que le sirve para aumentar el volumen de compras de contado en bananos y ganarse un adicional por aplicar este  sistema, además este capital en préstamo le ayudará a ampliar las posibilidades de nuevos clientes con productos a los cuales puede ofrecer y que son de mucha aceptación. 
Su sueño y máximo desafío es capitalizar el negocio sufrientemente, para que sus utilidades le permitan adecuar en excelentes condiciones la vivienda que recién ha adquirido con esfuerzo propio .
texts.en:
David C. is a businessman who has succeeded, with his 13-year-old business selling ripe bananas wholesale, at supporting his household made up of his wife and their two children. Although his first experience was in setting up a shop, he decided to switch to this business to be able to bring in better earnings with reduced working hours. Thus he has felt contented from the very first moment in which he rented his stand at the fruit market, setting about the task of acquiring customers and growing gradually by adding new fruits. 

Currently he is seeking his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, by which he will add new capital in order to increase the volume of cash purchases of bananas and make additional earnings by applying this system. Furthermore this debt acquisition will help him open up the possibilities for enticing new customers by offering them some highly desirable products. His dream and major challenge is to capitalize his business to a level at which his income will allow him to handsomely adapt the housing that he recently acquired by his own efforts.

loans.use: to make cash purchases of bananas in greater quantity

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SOL Y LUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luisa; la socia tiene 52 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de artesanía especialmente de telares como mantas ella vende en las distintas ferias que se realizan los fines de semana, a la vez la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros más, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para ambos negocios y así tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Luisa, 52, is a member of the “SOL Y LUNA” (Sun & Moon) communal bank which is located in Cusco District that belongs to Cusco Province, Cusco Department.

She is married and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with being a crafts merchant, especially woven textiles like blankets.  She sells in the various markets that take place on weekends.  At the same time, she also sells basic need items like creams, perfumes and colognes, among others.  She is a very cheerful person driven to continue forward for her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise for both businesses to have a wider variety available for her customers.

She is happy about the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for both her businesses.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very helpful by nature and always ready to support her family in their time of need. She has given birth to three children. All of them are very young and have not started getting an education yet. Her husband’s name is M. A. and he sells vegetables in the vegetable market. He is well known for his good customer dealings and the quality of his vegetables.
 
Asia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further improve her husband’s vegetable-selling business. Using the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables to sell to his customers. He has been operating this business for the past five years and Asia is hopeful that through the loan investment, her husband will successfully be able to increase his sales and profits. She is a new loan user and hopes that it will bring good profits to her husband as a result. 

She belongs to a city called Pakpattan which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture. She owns a two-room brick house there and has been living in it with her family for the past 15 years. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Asia.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for vegetable-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three young children who are still attending school. He has owned a pick-up since 2007. His work consists of transporting vegetables from suppliers to multiple local agricultural markets. He moves across different areas and villages in order to deliver his products to targeted markets. He reports that his previous Kiva loan helped him fulfill his business needs. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on his shuttle and repaint it so that he can transfer his products properly. He will also use the loan to register the pick-up and sign the needed legal papers to avoid breaking laws. He is very positive about the future of his business and is willing to hire a part-time employee to help him do the work.

loans.use: to register his van and perform the needed maintenance on it

loans.name: Flor De Luz

texts.es:
La señora Flor de luz Pérez  Pérez, es originaria de Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México ella es casada con el señor Gilberto Zenteno Gutiérrez y con quien procreo dos hijas Adi Dilema  Farelo Gutiérrez veinti un años de edad y María Elide de doce años en primero de secundaria.
 
    Ella se dedica a su pequeña  estética, en donde lleva   veinti dos años practicándola y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello y la ayuda de su esposo a logrado estar trabajando para sacar adelante a sus hijas.

    Comenta que ella desde muy joven le gustaba cortar cabello y su mama la mando cursos en la ciudad de Tuxtla, para que se prepare,  así  con el tiempo tener su estérica y pueda trabajar con eso, y comenta que gracias adiós es como su mama lo deseo hoy trabaja como da mente.
 
   Su más grande deseo es que siga trabajando para que logre tiene ahorros y con ello poder apoyar a sus hijas que están estudiando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flor de luz Pérez Pérez is from Coapilla, Chiapas State, México. She is married to Mr. Gilberto Zenteno Gutiérrez and together they have 2 daughters Adi Dilema Farelo Gutiérrez who is 21 years old, and María Elide who is 12 years old in her first year of junior high school.

She has been working in a small hair salon for 22 years and comments that she is doing very well since with this business and he husband's help she has been able to help her daughters succeed in life.

She tells us that she liked cutting hair from a very young age and her mother sent her to the city of Tuxtla to better prepare herself so that in the future she would have her hair salon to work in. She says that thanks to God she works comfortably as her mother wanted.

Her biggest wish is to continue working to save up and support her daughters' education.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, hair treatments, bleach, and other hair salon products.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz Elena  de 21 años se dedica a la confección de ropa en todas las líneas, ella vive en el popular barrio “Simón Bolívar”, lugar muy conocido en Barranquilla, pues fue el escenario del primer aeropuerto y allí confluye toda la cultura carnavalera de la ciudad y se conserva firmemente esta tradición. Beatriz Elena en compañía de su madre inició su negocio de confecciones hace un año, una vez su mamá dejó de trabajar como empleada  en talleres satélites de confecciones y decidió darle curso libre a su espíritu emprendedor a través del montaje de un negocio, donde aprovechara toda su experiencia para genera ingresos familiares e independientes; así  fue como invirtió los ahorros de su liquidación en la adecuación de este punto de producción en su propia casa con su hija; así que mientras Beatriz se dedica a conseguir contratos, su madre trabaja en el diseño,  la preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas que convierte en vestidos para damas, caballeros e infantil. Sus principales clientes se encuentras ubicados en el centro de Barranquilla en puntos comerciales y también en los colegios que Beatriz ha logrado contactar para ofrecerles sus servicios. 
Beatriz y su madre están interesadas en hacer crecer su negocio por eso acuden a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para lograr su primer  credikiva, con el cual comprarán materias primas e insumos, como telas, botones correderas e hilos, pues necesitan responde a pedidos de sus clientes y comprar en volumen les resulta más beneficioso,  porque ahorran en las compras, con los descuentos que sus proveedores les ofrecen. Su meta es lograr estructurar bien su negocio y sobre todo tener una casa propia adecuada, donde pueda adicionarle un local especial para su microempresa y este es justamente su gran desafío.
texts.en:
Beatriz Elena, 21, is a dressmaker.  She lives in the popular “Simón Bolívar” neighborhood, a very well known place in Barranquilla because it was the site of the city’s first airport and it’s where all of the city’s carnival culture comes together and is faithfully conserved.

Beatriz Elena and her mother started the dressmaking business a year ago.  Once her mother stopped working as an employee at clothes making satellite firms she decided to give her entrepreneurial spirit free range by setting up her own business taking advantage of all her experience to generate family and independent income.  This was how she invested all her savings from her severance pay to set up this production spot in her own home with her daughter.

So, while Beatriz undertakes securing contracts, her mother works designing, preparing, assembling and finishing pieces that become outfits for women, men and children.  Her main customers are located in downtown Barranquilla at commercial spots and also in schools that Beatriz has managed to contact to offer them their services.

Beatriz and her mother are interested in making their business grow so they’ve called on Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to get their first Kiva loan that they’ll use to buy raw materials and supplies like fabric, buttons, zippers and thread, because they need to respond to orders from their customers and buying in bulk is more profitable because they save on the purchases with discounts that their suppliers offer.

Her goal is to structure the business well and, above all, to have a properly structured house of her own where she can add a special space for her micro firm; this is precisely her great challenge.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Melinda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more inventory. Melinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010 and hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, and beverages

loans.name: Marcely

texts.en:
Marcely is 31 years old and married.  She has 2 children ages 8 and 3 years old . She has been into the business of raising hogs for 10 years. She also owns and manages a sari-sari store. She sells items like rice and noodles to the people in her community. 

Marcely has requested a loan to fund her businesses. She plans to use it to purchase pig feeds and more items to sell such as 2 sacks of rice, noodles and canned goods.  She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and more items to sell such as 2 sacks of rice, noodles and canned goods

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 29 years old, married and has two children. 

She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been operating the business for two years with two employees. Apart from owning the salon, she sells second-hand clothes for extra income.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business. As a result, she has become financially stable.
  
Faith aspires to become a great entrepreneur in the future. She needs 70,000 KES to buy chairs and a steaming machine and open a cosmetic counter.

loans.use: To buy chairs and a steaming machine and open a cosmetic counter.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer nació en el distrito de Echarate y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. La ciudad de Echarate es la ciudad capital del distrito de Echarate de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.
Elmer tiene 21 años y es soltero pero es una persona responsable, amable y trabajadora y por esas cualidades le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Nueva Luz de Echarate” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Él se dedica a la venta de helados y sale a vender por las calles de la ciudad de Echarate de forma ambulatoria con su carreta, él elaborara el helado de hielo y de crema y ya son 8 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien  gracias al empeño que le pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Elmer requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como leche y frutas. El sueño de Elmer es comprar un maquina industrial para vender helado al por mayor. Elmer está estudiando la carrera técnica de contabilidad en el Instituto Superior Pedagógico Unusaywa.
texts.en:
Elmer was born in the Echarate district and lives in the same city where he was born.  Echarate is the capital of the district of the same name, in the La Convención province.  It’s an important business center in the Lares and La Convención valleys.  Principal activities include coca, coffee, cacao, and fruit production.

Elmer is 21 years old, single, and a very responsible, friendly, and hard working person.  Because of these qualities, he was invited to become part of the “Nueva Luz de Echarate” communal bank, which is part of the Araiwa association.

He has an ice cream cart and sells ice cream on foot on the streets of Echarate.  He makes ice and ice cream frozen treats and has been doing so for eight years.  He has been doing well, thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  Elmer needs this loan in order to buy ingredients, such as milk and fruit.  Elmer’s dream is to buy an industrial sized machine so that he can sell in bulk.  He is studying to be an accountant at the Superior Pedagógico Unusaywa.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Roberto Alfredo

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Roberto Alfredo es una persona trabajadora de bueno valores morales  se dedica arduamente a laborar como asesor legal y se dedica a esta labor desde hace diez meses. Es casado tiene cuatro persona a su cargo.

Actualmente ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como bloque, cemento, hierro y pago de mano de obra para ampliar  porche de su vivienda, así brindarle más seguridad  a su familia, este es el primer crédito que le brinda ceprodel para poder dar un mejor de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Managua, Roberto Alfredo is a hard-working person with good values and morals, who dedicates himself arduously to his work as a legal assessor. He has done this for the last 10 months. Roberto is married and has 4 persons in his charge.

At present, Roberto is approaching Ceprodel to solicit a loan to improve the condition of his house, buying construction materials, including cement blocks, cement, and iron, and hiring laborers to expand the porch of his home, offering more security to his family.  This is his first loan from Ceprodel, and it is aimed at providing an improvement in the life of his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve his house, providing his family greater security.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Nida has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock to sell.
Nida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, canned goods & snacks

loans.name: Francisca Evelia

texts.es: Francisca Evelia tiene 53 años de edad, es amable, honesta y muy conocida en la comunidad, madre soltera de cuatro hijas y de cinco hijos, y reside en el municipio de Manto. Hasta hace 8 años atras Francisca se dedicaba a la cria y destazo de cerdos, horneado de pan y venta de nacatamales, y le iba muy bien con sus ventas pero con el transcurrir del tiempo los años de vida le cayeron encima y se sentia muy cansada para seguir haciendolo ya que son actividades pesadas de realizar, asi que buscó un negocio en el cual no tuviera que esforzarse fisicamente mucho. Actualmente tiene una pequeña venta de abarroteria en general en su casa y con las ganancias que le genera se sostiene economicamente. Su horario de atencion es de lunes a domingo desde temprano por la mañana hasta el anochecer. El financiamiento que Francisca solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en su negocio con la compra de productos de la canasta basica, asi como refrescos, dulces, churros, galletas, entre otros. Con el apoyo de este prestamo espera obtener mejores ingresos para mantener su negocio activo y seguirse sosteniendo. Su mayor desafio es diferenciar su pulperia de las demas que hay en la comunidad, porque hay muchas. Su sueño es llegar a tener un mini-mercadito y asi mejor su condicion de vida. Este es su quinto ciclo en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Francisca Evelia is 53 years old.  She is kind, honest and well known in the community.  She is a single mother with four daughters and five sons and she lives in the town of Manto.  

For eight years Francisca worked raising and butchering pigs, baking bread, and selling tamales.  She did very well with sales but as the years passed she felt too tired to continue doing the same difficult activities.  For this reason, she looked for a business that was less demanding physically.

Francisca currently runs a small general grocery store from her home; the profits it generates support her financially. The store is open Monday to Sunday from early morning until dusk.

The financing Francisca is requesting is needed for investing in her business with the purchase of basic foods, such as soft drinks, candy, churros, and cookies, among others.  With this loan she expects to be able to earn more income to keep her business running and to support herself.  Her biggest challenge is to differentiate her shop from the others in the community, because there are many.

Francisca's dream is to own a mini-market and thereby improve her living conditions. This is her fifth loan cycle with Kiva partner FAMA.  She has paid previous loans on time.

loans.use: to purchase grocery staples.

loans.name: Ha's Group

texts.en:
Ha was born in 1978. She lives in Phan Xa village, uy No commune. She is married with two children who go to school. Her husband is a worker. He has an income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND) per month. Mrs Ha has a store. She sells cobbler and breakfast (porridge). She has had this job for 5 years. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. Since 2010, she has participated in SEDA. The last time she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to expand her store by buying more chairs, tables and rice to cook porridge.

 About the other borrowers in her group:
 Lam is 36 years old. She has two children. She would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND for her small business.
 Thuy is 28 years old. She has two children. She would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to repair her store.
 Chin is 42 years old. She has two children. She would like to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to expand her store  by buying more chairs, tables and rice to cook porridge.

loans.name: Gongseng Indah 1 Group

texts.en:
Pertiwi is 34 years old and married with four children. She is wearing a green shirt in the photo. Two of her children are of school age and are currently enrolled. The other two are ages one and four. She has owned a general store for five years. She will use this loan to expand her inventory in her store by purchasing more rice, oil, eggs, etc. She hopes that the expanded inventory will increase the profitability, allowing her to have more income to hopefully pay for all of her children's tuition through college.

Some of the other group members will use their loans to sell snacks and clothing on credit.

loans.use: to pay for rice, oil, eggs, and other daily-use items  to increase shop inventory.

loans.name: Battogtoh

texts.en:
Battogtoh is 33-years-old and lives with her children and a husband in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her children are in school and her husband helps with her business. She operates a grocery trading business. 

She started her business in 2007 by purchasing a counter in a local market. Her current assets are 8,000,000 MNT. She has gained a recognition from her clients and customers. She is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I have a plan to expand my business by increasing my assets." She is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to purchase grocery products from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products.

loans.name: Marrion's Group

texts.en:
Marrion's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Marrion is 16 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Marrion has been working hard to manage her pharmacy, which provides medicine and basic treatments to local patients. 

To help expand her business, Marrion has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more medicines to sell in her shop, and will help Marrion to generate greater profits and pay her brother's school fees. Marrion hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Marrion is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Marrion's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money and manage her finances.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines to offer through her pharmacy business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Uganda. She is married and has 4 children. All her children are in school. Florence lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and electricity bills.
Florence has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for 5 years. She works 7 days a week. Florence sells her products at a market, by means of wholesale and retail. She also generates additional income by selling second hand clothes. The main business challenges for Florence include transportation and seasonality. Her business goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to own a delivery van in order to minimize transportation costs. 
Florence has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the funds to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Sarepta Plus Group

texts.en:
Sarepta Plus is a Community Bank made up of 26 micro entrepreneurs. Their chairwoman is Isabelle. These members are united by the same goal- to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC.

Isabelle operates a drugstore in the eastern suburban area of Kinshasa. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of three children who are between the ages of 14 and 18. Two of them attend school. 

Isabelle began her business in 2006. With hard work and good management, and by providing good customer service, Isabelle’s business has prospered and has permanent customers to keep it up. Her business generates about 70 USD of profit per week. Isabelle's strength is purchasing appropriate drugs for her customers. 

Isabelle has already received seven loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and successfully repaid them. With the next loan, she is planning to expand her business by buying more medicine needed by her customers. Her ambition is to open another drugstore.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her drugstore needed by her customers.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es: La señora Mirna tiene 29 años de edad, esta casada y es madre de dos hijos, Mirna se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, sus clientes son sus vecinos y amigos que le visitan a diario, doña Mirna se levanta muy temprano todos los dias para atender a sus clientes, en su pulpería vende desde granos básicos hasta embutidos, el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia para surtir su negocio, desea comprar algunos productos que no tiene en existencia, de esta forma podra vender mas y obtener mas utilidades.
texts.en: Mirna, 29, is married and the mother of two children.  She sells basic daily use staples in a grocery store she has at home.  Her customers are her neighbors and friends who visit her daily.  Mirna rises very early every day to tend to her customers.  In her grocery store she sells everything from basic grains to cured meats.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.  She wants to buy some products that she does not currently have in stock so that she can sell more and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Nandika Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nandika Group in Western Kenya! By the leadership of Emily as their facilitator, this group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Emily takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Emily was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Emily and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from her maize sales, Emily will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Nandika group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents). Magdalena has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 1 year, and she works 7 days out of every week. Magdalena sells her products from home, by means of retail. Magdalena has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.The main business challenge(s) for Magdalena include seasonality, transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow to and become a wholesaler. Magdalena lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Octave

texts.en: Octave is married to a farmer and the couple has 5 children between the ages of 3 and 19. Octave has been selling maize flour, sugar and sodas for 8 years. He has requested this loan to buy more sugar, maize flour and sodas. He plans to use the profits generated from this loan for savings. He dreams of reaching a certain level of achievement.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, maize flour and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a 27-year-old, married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. Amira has had a food stall business in Yei, South Sudan for 2 years.

Amira is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is divorced and has three children. She cooks banku, cooked fermented corn dough and cassava dough, for sale. She serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomatoes sauce at Ankako.  Ama has been doing this  for three months now. She is responsible for taking care of the family. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a structure for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her banku for sale.

loans.name: Sènami's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de quatre personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de  ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sènami  est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sènami est âgée de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Sènami est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Moise. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Sènami vend depuis huit ans de la nourriture. Sènami s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Sènami, ensemble avec les membres de ce groupe, sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de maïs, des pâtes alimentaires et des condiments.

loans.name: Anias

texts.en:
Anias is 26 years old. He is married with 1 child age of 2 years. Not yet go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 3 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Sreynoch

texts.en: A young student from Phnom Penh city, Sreynoch is 19 years old and still study in university. To support on her living and her study, she has working as a teacher in school. For Sreynoch, this is her first micro loan with VisionFund. She will manage her loan to pay on tuition fee on her Marketing skill which she will go to study in abroad. Sreynoch wishes that she can finish her studying successfully and she can get a good job with higher salary for her family.

loans.use: To pay on tuition fee on her Marketing skill.

loans.name: Seyfaddin

texts.en:
Seyfaddin is 50, married, has 4 children, lives in Salyan region Yenikand village.  He has his own grocery store. Having borrowed a loan of $600 from Komak Credit Union  Ramil to buy 30 sack wheat flour. 
He applies for the loan of $900 to expand the area of his grocery store

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Metleb

texts.en:
Metleb is 38 years old, married has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in Fizuli region, Kayidish village.
His business involves supplying milk in the village. He has been in this business for 2 years. He has a dairy cow, which provides his income. 
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy a milk cow. 
Metleb plans to expand the dairy farming because he provides for his family by selling milk.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Aswiyah

texts.en: Aswiyah  is 34 years old, and is married with 6 children. 5 of them are girls while the other is a boy. To supplement her husband's income, Aswiyah sells meatball soup in front of her house.  In a day they can earn $10 with net profit of $3 or $60 in a month. Aswiyah needs a loan of $100 and with this loan, she can buy more materials to make more food and thus more or less double her income. Aswiyah very much wants to earn more money  for her children's education and to give them a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 1 year.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien's family has 4 members; the two children are still very young (4 & 2 years old). One of them suffers from malnutrition. Lien's husband works as a fisherman, and she sells fish. Their average income is $12 per month per person. Last year their house was destroyed by Typhoon Durian. Vietnam Plus and local authorities helped them to rebuild it.

Now Lien wants to borrow $ 50 to increase her available capital for her fish-selling business. She plans to repay it over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: capital for her fish-selling micro-business

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Mrs. Sean C., 36, lives with her 36-year-old husband in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with her three children, all of whom are students. Her husband earns $9.60 a day as a blacksmith. Sean C. herself can be hired by couples getting married to take care of their wedding. She decorates the premises herself, finds clothes for the bride to wear and organizes the food. She has applied for this loan to improve this business; in particular she would like to buy more decorative items. With the remainder of the money she would like to repair her home.

loans.use: to purchase decorating items for her wedding business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase fabric and a machine to add buttons

loans.name: Latafet

texts.en: Latafet is a 32-year-old married woman . She is a farmer and lives with her family in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. She started her business in 1995, when she purchased one cow with money she had saved up. The work is hard but interesting and takes a lot of effort. Her husband helps her to  purchase calves, breed them and cut and sell them to the butcher at the local big market. At the same time, the salary is not enough to cover all family expenses. To increase the profit margin from the selling, Latafet has to invest some money to make her small herd bigger. This summer she applied for $500 to buy four calves.  She hopes eventually to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Anali

texts.es:
Anali is 28 years old and has a fifth-grade education. She has a daughter who is dependent on her. In her convenience store she sells all types of groceries like oil, noodles, sugar, salt, tuna, etc. She also buys and sells grains and curd, which she sells around the region and also in the city of Trujillo. She is a member of a women's communal bank and received her first loan from there. It wasn't much, but with it she purchased 100 kilograms of curd and started earning a profit. With ensuing loans and profits she was able to start up her store little by little.

With the $450 loan, which she will repay in four months, she will purchase in Trujillo five bags of sugar, three sacks of rice, 46 kg of flour, three boxes of oil, five bags of noodles, two packages of salt, one box of tuna, and other items as well.

She started her business 10 years ago out of a country house in Salpo, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She had a tiny store that she started with the help of her parents. She later met her husband and left to live with him, and little by little she made enough money to slowly grow her store.

Anali dreams of selling more than just groceries items, like clothing or household appliances.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Anali Rodríguez F. tiene 28 años de edad, estudió hasta el quinto grado de primaria. Tiene una sola hija que aún depende de ella. En su bodega vende todo tipo de abarrotes como aceite, fideo, azúcar, sal, atún, etc. Además se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales y cuajada, los que vende por la zona y también en la ciudad de Trujillo. Es socia del banco comunal Progresistas, en el cual obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00. Este dinero lo invirtió en compara 100 Kg. de cuajada. Con los siguientes créditos y con sus ganancias fue implementando poco a poco una bodega. Con el préstamo de S/.1,300.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará en la ciudad de Trujillo 5 bolsas de azúcar, 3 sacos de arroz, 1 quintal de harina, 3 cajas de aceite, 5 bolsas de fideos, 2 paquetes de sal, 1 caja de atún y otras cosas. El negocio empezó hace 10 años en el caserío de Sauco distrito de Salpo provincia de Otuzco, departamento La Libertad, ahí tenía una pequeña tienda que había puesto con la ayuda de sus padres, posteriormente conoció a su esposo y se fue a vivir con el al barrio Miramar del distrito de Mache, ahí poco a poco hizo un pequeño capital con lo que sembraba y surtió lentamente la bodega. Su mayor sueño es vender algo más que abarrotes como por ejemplo ropa y utensilios para el hogar.

loans.use: Purchase groceries like sugar, rice, flour, oil, etc.

loans.name: Tojinisso

texts.ru:
