Luz is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites I., 35, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is raising her three children by herself, so she makes sure that her family has a comfortable life.  She has been managing her own "walis tambo" (grass broom) business and slipper business.

Marites has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her walis tambo business and slipper business.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business. She plans to use the loan funds to buy the raw materials and supplies to produce her brooms.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have a good and comfortable life with her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and supplies

loans.name: Arnoldo

texts.es: Arnoldo S. Sauceda, cuenta con 25 años de edad, Soltero vive con su familia materna, lleva 8 años elaborando antojitos, debido a que necesita de más ingreso, se acercó a la asociación ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo y así poder comprar una carreta para la venta de productos alimenticios ya que en el lugar donde vende hay mucha demanda, debido a esa circunstancia el decidió aprovechar ese recurso para poder crear otra fuente de trabajo y continuar generando más ingresos y así también poder cambiar sus condiciones de vida tanto como la de él y como la de su familia.
texts.en:
Arnoldo S. S. is 25 years old, single, and lives with his maternal family. He has been making snacks for the past 8 years. Because he needs more income, he approached Asociación ASDIR to request a loan to be able to purchase a cart to sell his food products, since there is a lot of demand in the area where he sells. As a result of his circumstance, he decided to take advantage of this resource to be able to create another source of work and continue to generate more income so that he can also change the living conditions of both him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cart for fast food

loans.name: Roberto Danilo

texts.es:
Roberto Danilo Solórzano C., es  un joven  quien  Labora como Supervisor en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  y estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado un crédito con CEPRODEL durante un  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento, piedra y hierro para la construcción de un baño en su casa de habitación.Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Roberto Danilo S. Cuadro is 30 years old. He works as a supervisor at a wholesale market in Managua. He is married and has two school-age children. Roberto has been working with CEPRODEL for one year. Thanks to his first CEPRODEL loan, he was able to do some home renovations. Roberto will use his new loan to buy construction materials: sand, cement, stone and iron. He plans to build a new bathroom in his home. He wants to improve living conditions for his children. Roberto has said that this loan will be used only for home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home renovations.

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en:
Kehinde is 53 years old and married with two children. His wife sells soup ingredients to help her husband. He produces and sells cellophane bags to earn a living. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. His greatest challenge is funds and he hopes to overcome the challenge. He hopes to grow his business to become bigger and stronger. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more cellophane bags to sell. 

Kehinde says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to produce more cellophane bags to sell

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng P. is a villager in Chambak Trab village in Kandal province and she was born in 1965. She is a farmer who owns 0.3 hectares of land to cultivate rice on to support her family. She farms and after that she has free time. According to this activity, she wants to start a new business but she does not have enough money. 

Thus, Mrs. Heng P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Vany Thom, is a motorbike taxi driver and she has five children, one of whom is a construction worker, while two others are enrolled in local public school, and the others are too young to go to school or work. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Ruda

texts.en:
Ruda D. is from the village of Boundary, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Ruda owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling aluminum products such as cauldrons, ladles, basins, etc., to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ruda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Ruda is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Nizomadoy

texts.en: Nizomadoy is a hard-working entrepreneur from Pendjikent, Tajikistan. Together with her husband, she has three children. She runs a business where she sells women’s clothing. Nizomadoy started her business 10 years ago and has run it with both extreme care and seriousness. Her daughters help Nizomadoy with her business. She has requested a loan of 6,500 Somoni so that she can purchase more clothing for the upcoming summer season. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to grow her business further and help feed her family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for expanding her business

loans.name: Rosemine

texts.en:
Rosemine P. is from the village of Christine, District 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 34 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child.

Rosemine owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Rosemine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve her business. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI.

Rosemine plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve her business

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama B. est un homme marié de 23 ans et père de 2 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son père dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, pendant des années il accompagnait son père dans les travaux champêtres au village.
Quelques années après il décida de venir à Bougouni pour apprendre la commercialisation des bétails auprès de son oncle.
Avec une expérience de 9 ans, Monsieur Adama B. maîtrise bien son activité et est très sollicité.
Afin de renforcer son capital, il décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à sa première expérience. 
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, des moutons et  des chèvres.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages environnants de Bougouni et effectue sa vente à domicile et dans la foire hebdomadaire  de Bougouni, à une clientèle composée de bouchers et de consommateurs.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Adama B. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice, il envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama B. is a married man, 23 years old, and the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children at his father’s place in the Hérémakono district, in the North of Bogouni. Not having had formal schooling, he has been helping his father with various manual jobs around the village. A few years later he decided to come to Bougoni to learn from his uncle how to raise livestock for sale. With nine years of experience, he is now very good at his trade, and his business is popular. In order to bolster his capital, he has decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, and this would be his first experience with the organization. He plans to use his loan to purchase sheep and goats. He buys his stock in Bougoni and nearby villages and sells out of his home and at the weekly market of Bogouni, to a customer base composed of butchers and consumers. With this loan, Mr. Adama B. plans to achieve a monthly income of 25,000 West African francs. Thanks to this income, he plans to expand his enterprise.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing small livestock

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina has much faith and courage, which have helped her overcome the poverty that afflicts her family. She is 41 years old and married with three children, all of whom look to her for support. She lives in the town of Morong in the province of Rizal, Philippines.

In 2009, Josefina joined ASHI, a Kiva partner in the Philippines, in order to secure access to capital for her business raising hogs. This loan is her second, and she has repaid the previous loan on time and made good use of it to expand her business and her income. She has applied for a new loan of PHP 10,000 to buy sacks of feed and vitamins and to pay for transportation expenses. 

Josefina dreams of expanding her business into a full-fledged pig farm. She also dreams of sending her children to school until they finish college and find good jobs. Until that happens, she is pleased at the way in which ASHI and Kiva have changed her family's life and given them the possibility to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins and to pay for transportation expenses

loans.name: Nezar Kleber

texts.es:
Nezar Kleber B. C. tiene 58 años. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos, de 24, 25, 30 y 36 años.

Nezar es un socio de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Nezar trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz, arroz y cacao. Hace sus ventas en el comercial García de Ventanas cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar agricultura de verano para sembrar: comprar semillas y abonos. Necesita dinero para la agricultura. Esta ahorrando con la Cooperativa, pero no esta suficiente para trabajar. 

Su sueño es dejar algo a sus hijos. Le gusta jugar indoor fútbol, tiene su propio equipo que juega cada domingo.
texts.en:
Nezar Kleber B. C. is 58 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and lives in the Ventanas cantón, in the province of Los Ríos. He has four children, who are 24, 25, 30, and 36 years old. Nezar is a member of the Recinto San Ramón solidarity group, which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. There are 20 members in all, who work in short-cycle agriculture (harvesting every six months). This is the first loan that they are taking out from Cooperativa San Jose. Nezar works in agriculture, growing corn, rice, and cocoa. He makes his sales every six months in the García commercial area of Ventanas. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase summer crops to plant. He will buy seeds and fertilizer. He needs money for farming. He is saving with the Cooperativa, but it is not enough to make ends meet. His dream is to leave something behind for his children. He enjoys playing indoor soccer, and has his own team that plays every Sunday.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to plant summer crops: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gilver Sandalio

texts.es:
El Sr. Gilver J. tiene 32 años, esta casado con la Sra. Paola Villegas hace 3 años, tienen un hijo de 2 años. Viven en la casa de su madre.

El Sr. Gilver es pintor desde hace 12 años, tiene mucha experiencia como pintor por lo que genera ingresos para el cuidado de su hijo y de su esposa.

Requiere del préstamo para poder comprar un vehiculo, debido que para su trabajo necesitara mucho y se convertira en su herramienta de trabajo para poder trasladar a sus ayudantes y sus otras herramientas de trabajo, ayudara mucho para dar un mejor servicio de pintado.
texts.en:
Mr. Gilver Jiménez, 32, has been married to Mrs. Paola Villegas for the last 3 years. They have a two-year-old son. They live in his mother’s house. He has been a painter for the last 12 years and has a lot of experience in this line of work. He earns income sufficient to care for his son and wife. He needs the loan to buy a vehicle because he needs one for his work. It will become a work tool in that he can use it to transport his helpers and other work tools. It will be of great help for him to provide better painting services.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tu purchase a vehicle for work.

loans.name: Mrs. Lina Keut Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan includes 11 people who live in Roleang Kreul village in Takeo province. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their standard of living in this current year. Mrs. Lina K. is the village bank president, selected by the other members. She was born in 1981. She is a fruit and vegetable seller in the local market where she is able to earn a large profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Ravy Vut, is a taxi driver. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Lina K. is requesting a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. Through this activity, they support three children who all attend school and help their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Francis Eric

texts.en:
Francis Eric B. is from the village of D'ban Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 31 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Francis Eric owns & operates an agricultural business, raising pigs for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Francis Eric joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand his business. This will be his first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement his family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment & tools to expand his business

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Khen S. A., 30, is a garment factory worker in Takeo province. She is married with two children, who are still living at home, and her husband is a security guard. She typically makes about US$ 6 each day. 

Since this family spends a lot on transportation, Khen S. A. would like to take out a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a motorbike to reduce transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo B. is dreaming of being successful in his own business. He has been a farmer for more than 15 years. He would like to increase the size of his income to help his family.

He grows rice and earns an average of 15,000 Philippines pesos per harvest. His income from growing rice has truly helped his family with buying food, clothes and other basic necessities. 

Rodolfo applied for a loan from CEVI. He will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. Rodolfo likes CEVI's program. He likes it because it has insurance benefits.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Ruth Belina

texts.es: La señora Ruth Belina, tiene la edad de 47 años, habita en el Barrio de los Laureles Norte, es casado y su esposo labora como transportista, ellos tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 5 de ellos son mayores de edad y trabajan y los demás dependen económicamente de sus padres, la señora L. tiene un pequeño comedor en donde vende comida típica, y alquila un cuarto, antes se dedicaba a vender ropa, pero después observo que la comida se le ganaba más ingresos, ellos habitan en una humilde vivienda, y con el alza de la demanda de sus clientes, desea realizar una inversión que le permita la construcción de un muro perimetral, que le brinde mayor seguridad a su familia, mejores condiciones de atención al cliente, y a futuro la obtención de los recursos económicos para la solvencia  a nuevos mercados o fuentes de ingreso, que garanticen una mejor calidad de vida. Este no es el primer prestamo de la señora con Afodenic, tras el apoyo que se le ha brindado, paulatinamente han mostrado un mejor capitald e trabajo que le permite invertir aun mas en su negocio.
texts.en: Mrs Ruth Belina is 47 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood.  She is married and her husband works as a haulage contractor.  They have 7 children.  5 are grown up and work and the others are financially dependent on their parents.  Mrs L. has a small eatery where she sells traditional food and rents a room.  She used to sell clothes but she realized that food made better profits.  Her family lives in a humble dwelling and, with the increasing demand from her customers, she would like to make an investment which will enable her to construct a perimeter wall that will make her family safer, improve her service to her customers and in the future obtain the necessary financial resources to start new markets or sources of income which would guarantee better living conditions.  This is not the first loan that she has had with Afodenic.  With the support which they have given her, with she has slowly shown better working capital which allows her to invest even more in her business.

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Olga Maria Y. Y. tiene 32 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Olga  pertenece a la Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería como vacas lecheras y chanchos, esta ventanilla tiene 20 miembros.

Olga se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y a la ganadería cría vacas lecheras, las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo fréjol y papa  y animales para engordar y después vender. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es ponerse comprar casa.
Le gustaría que la cooperativa siga apoyando con los créditos.
texts.en:
Olga Maria Y. Y. is 32 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the Guaranda canton in Bolívar province. She has 6 children.
Olga belongs to the Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba located a half hour from Guaranda. This group works in agriculture and raises cattle, like dairy cows and pigs. This group has 20 members.
Olga grows corn, wheat, beans and potatoes. She also raises dairy cows. She makes purchases in Guaranda and makes her sales in the wholesale market there.
She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to grow corn, wheat, beans and potatoes, and to buy animals to fatten up and sell. This loan will help her provide for her family. Her dream is to be able to buy a house.
She would like the Cooperative to continue helping her with the loans.

loans.use: Purchase animals and supplies to grow corn, wheat, beans and potatoes

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa, vende pollos asados y víveres de primera necesidad. Vive en una zona urbana llamada suburbio de Guayaquil y caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes. 

Hace 8 años atrás empezó a vender legumbres para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares a su esposo. Pero como tenía la idea de vender su comida compro una máquina para asar y comenzó a vender pollos asados poco a poco las personas del sector la conocieron hasta que ella también ubico en su negocio la venta de víveres de primera necesidad para que los clientes tengan variedad al comprar. En la actualidad ella trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h30pm vendiendo los pollos asados y víveres con ayuda de su esposo.    

Con el préstamo quiere comprar Bebidas, arroz, pollos para mantener su negocio. En el futuro quiere mejorar su vivienda y agrandar el local de su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa sells roasted chickens and groceries.  She lives in an urban zone in Guayaquil, called Suburbio, notable because most of its residents are merchants.

Eight years ago she started out selling vegetables to help out her husband with family expenses.  But, since she had the notion to sell food she bought a roasting machine and started selling roasted chickens.  Gradually she became known by residents of the area and she then also set up a grocery store so that her customers would have variety available for purchase.  She is currently open for business from 6am until 10:30pm selling roasted chickens and groceries with her husband’s help.

She will use the loan to buy beverages, rice and chickens to supply her business.  In the future she’d like to make some home improvements and enlarge her business.

loans.use: For beverages, chickens and rice.

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr: Il a 27 ans. Il est électronicien et maintenancier de profession mais associe la vente de portables.  Il s’approvisionne  au port autonome  de Lomé  et revend dans son atelier à N’kafu à côté de la pharmacie de peuple. Il exerce cette activité il y a de cela 3 ans. IL sollicite un nouveau crédit pour répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: This young man is 27 years old. He works in electronics and maintenance, but also sells mobile phones. He buys his stocks at the autonomous port of Lomé and sells the merchandise in his shop, in N'kafu, next to the people's pharmacy. He has been engaged in this activity for three years. He is seeking a new loan to meet a steadily growing demand.

loans.use: Purchase of mobile phones

loans.name: Mathien

texts.en:
Mathien sells rice, sugar and many more items in his boutique, which he has been doing for three years.  He is 27 years old and married. His wife works with him in his small shop. 

His loan will be used to add more items in his boutique for sale. He hopes to use the new profits towards the growth of the business. He hopes to supply to outside the country in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items such as sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Gabi

texts.es: Gabi, de 35 años, convive con Andrés, de 34 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Julisa, de 13 y Anderson, de 10 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Desde las primeras horas de la mañana Gaby, comienza la venta de productos de primera necesidad en un pequeño espacio que acondicionó en su casa. Cuando termina su venta, ella, se dirige a sus sembríos de arveja, papa y maíz, donde hace 15 años comenzó a dedicarse a la agricultura, y según menciona la va muy bien; pues ahora la calidad de sus productos son muy cotizados en el mercado central de Tarma. Según afirma el movimiento económico del mercado es muy bueno, por ello está planeando invertir en la venta de verduras al por mayor. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y como presidenta de su banco comunal, se siente dichosa de ayudar a las personas a salir adelante. De obtener el crédito está pensando completar la compra de 5 sacos de semilla de arveja, que oscila entre 600 soles cada uno.
texts.en: Gabi, age 25, lives with Andres, age 34. They have 2 children together: Julisa, age 13, and Anderson, age 10. They live in their own home in the Cumutay hamlet. In the first hours of the morning Gaby starts to sell basic needs products in a small area she set up in her home. When she finishes her sales, she sows peas, potatoes and corn. She started working in agriculture 15 years ago, and she says that it is going very well. Her quality products are very sought-after in the central market of Tarma. She says that the economic market movement is very good, and so she plans to invest in the wholesale sale of vegetables. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and as the  president of her community bank she is happy to help people get ahead. When she obtains this loan she plans to purchase five bags of pea seeds, which are approximately 600 soles each.

loans.use: to purchase 5 bags of pea seeds.

loans.name: Thamer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old and a married man.

Thamer has a long experience in baking; in 2006 he decided to open his own bakery. The business is located in a populated area. He is becoming well know and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to renovate the bakery, installing an external ceiling and shutters. He is planning to expand his business and increase his revenue.

loans.use: Renovate the bakery, install an external ceiling and shutters

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a twenty-six year old hardworking man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He is a motorcycle rider and has been in business for the last two years. With the income he has earned he has been able to provide his family with the basics. His greatest obstacle is that he works for a boss who takes the biggest percentage of his earnings. His dream is to have his own motorcycle. Patrick needs this loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Koemsok

texts.en:
Mrs. Koemsok H. and her husband, Mr. Phann Phuong, have been married since 1985. They have three sons and three daughters; two are married and live on their own and others have full-time employment. The family lives in a village off of National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Mrs. Koemsok H. stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s business as a construction worker. Koemsok is asking for a loan of $800 to build a bathroom for family use and to purchase a sewing machine for her daughter-in-law.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and to purchase a sewing machine for her daughter-in-law

loans.name: Estrellas Brillantes 1 Group

texts.en:
Alicia is part of the group named "Estrellas Brillante" 1 (Brilliant Stars), she is the representative of this group and has proven to be a very hard-working woman. She said she has to work hard because she has four young children that she needs to take care of and feed.

She has a small business selling food in her area and also she breed pigs, to be sold after 3-5 months. She said it's her goal to put all her kids through high school, and hopefully they will be able to go to college someday. After she has run her small restaurant and invested in it over almost four years, she decided to start selling pigs, so this loan will be used to buy pigs. 

This is a group of five people trying to receive loans to increase their businesses.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Cynder

texts.es: Cynder, de 34 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cesar de 41 años, quien trabaja como chofer de auto recorriendo la ruta Yurinaki – La Merced y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En la comunidad de Yurinaki (Comunidad del distrito de Pichanaki), Cynder tiene su tienda de abarrotes, ella se siente muy feliz con su negocio, ya que le es muy rentable y está muy bien ubicado, justo en la plaza de la comunidad. Desde las 5 y 30 de la mañana abre su tienda y se dispone a vender los productos que tiene en stock, esta actividad lo realiza hasta las 10 de la noche que es la hora cuando cierra su tienda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y es muy buena haciéndolo, ya que siempre sus clientes salen muy contentos de su tienda, lleva 4 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su bodega, sin poder salir a la calle a realizar sus actividades. En adelante, espera mejorar su tienda y hacerla crecer, para así poder atender mejor a sus clientes. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Cynder, who is 34 years old, is a very loving and hard working mother. She lives in her own house with her husband Cesar, 41 years old, who works as a chauffeur on the Yurinaki to La Merced route, and their four children who they love and want to provide with a better quality of life. 

In their community of Yurinaki, in the district of Pichanaki, Cynder has her grocery store. She is very happy with her business since it is profitable and very well located next to the community plaza. At 5:30 in the morning she opens the store and starts selling the products she has in stock. She continues this work until 10:00 in the evening which is the time she closes the store. What she likes best about her work is selling and she is very good at it, since her clients always leave the store very content. She has been running this business for four years and thinks the most difficult thing is to have to remain inside her store all day without being able to go out to the street to do her errands. 

Going forward, she hopes to improve her store and make it grow in order to be able to serve her clients better. This is her tenth loan with MFP. She plans to be punctual with her payments since she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her community bank where she is very loved and respected. With the 1500 new soles requested she will buy more products to improve her store.

loans.use: Buy more products to improve her store.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna S. lives in Akhali Sopeli (“New Village”) in Imereti Region. She is 31 years old and married. Khatuna and her husband, Vaja, have two children: a 13-year-old daughter and a 12-year-old son, who go to the local secondary school. The income of the family comes from their small agricultural farm, where Khatuna and Vaja work hard during the whole day. In particular, the family has three milk cows. The milk is used to make cheese – 60 kg per month is sold in a nearby town. They have two pigs, whose piglets are sold locally. In their 500 sq. meter greenhouse, Khatuna and Vaja grow cucumbers – approximately 3 tones of cucumbers are sold annually. Also, the family uses their plot of land to grow maize. Most of the harvested corn is used for the farm, to feed the pigs and piglets. The total average monthly profit from all the above mentioned activities amounts to 800 laris per month.

The requested funding will be used to replace the old damaged cellophane in the greenhouse with a new one, as well as for fertilizing the ground there. After fertilizing and installing new cellophane, the harvest of cucumbers and the income from their sales will increase by 25%. Another part of the loan will be used for cultivation of the land, where maize will be sown. It will increase the harvest and sale of corn by 50%. 

The increase in their income will be used for renovations to their house, in order to improve the living conditions for the family members.

loans.use: to purchase cellophane, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor.

loans.name: Wesseh

texts.en: Wesseh is 36 years old and lives in West Point. He stopped his education at the junior high level and has two children ages 7 and 10. Wesseh is engaged in selling men's shoes and suit coats in the local market, but he doesn't sell many in the rainy season when there are fewer customers. He is requesting a loan to purchase more suit coats and shoes for his business. He plans to build a house for his children and marry a decent woman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more suit coats and shoes to grow his business

loans.name: Felipe Santiago

texts.es: Felipe Santiago tiene su negocio que es brindar el servicio de taxi. Tiene más de 37 años, que se dedica a este negocio pues siempre ha buscado la forma de brindarles el mejor servicio a sus clientes. Las ganas de salir adelante con su negocio han hecho que Felipe dedique una buena parte de su tiempo pues trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, todos los días.  El motivo del crédito es para la compra de llantas, brindarle mantenimiento a su automóvil, focos y otros arreglos que necesita. Felipe es una persona muy responsable y disfruta mucho de su actividad.
texts.en:
Felipe Santiago owns a business that provides taxi services. he has worked in the business for over 37 years and he always looks at ways of providing the best customer service. His eagerness to make the business successful means that Felipe devotes much of his time to it. He works from 8 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day. 

The loan is to pay for tires, vehicle maintenance, lights and other repairs needed. Felipe is a very responsible person and really enjoys what he does for a living.

loans.use: to pay for tires, vehicle maintenance, lights and other repairs needed.

loans.name: Joao Adriano Da Costa

texts.pt:
João Adriano da costa nasceu na cidade Tete, Provincia do mesmo nome, Norte de Moçambique, casado naõ tem filhos. Fez o curso de professorado e não continuou porque teve começar a trabalhar para o sustento da familia. Vive na casa propria e naõ sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Tete para Maputo ha 10 anos quando vinha visistar seu irmaõ e acabou ficando nesta provincia. Fez a formaçaõ de professores e iniciou o seu trabalho onde tem um salario de 10.842.42mts por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Ja teve emprestimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atraves de colegas que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, areia, e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 8.000.00mt,12.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt e foi para habitação.  

O sonho de João é de concluir a sua residencia para tal compromete se a pagar devidamente para aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos  empréstimos.
texts.en:
João Adriano da Costa was born in the city of Tete, Tete Province in northern Mozambique. He is married and does not have children. He finished teacher training and did not continue studying because he had to start working and support his family. He lives in his own house and does not support anyone else.

João left Tete to move to Maputo 10 years ago, when he came to visit his brother and ended up staying in this province. He finished teacher training and began his job, where he has a salary of 10,842.42 meticais per month. He uses this money for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account.

He has had loans from other banks. João learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are customers of this institution. This is João's fourth loan with Hluvuku. He is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy construction materials (iron, cement, sand and other items) to continue work on his house. The earlier loans for 8,000.00 meticais,12,000.00 meticais and 15,000.00 meticais were for housing.  

João's dream is to finish his house. In order to do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can take out more loans in the future. He does intend to ask for more loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (iron, cement, sand, etc.).

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with 2 children, all of whom graduated from school.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the past 10 years, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition, she also sells vegetables, tomatoes and onions which contribute to her other source of income.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Rose dreams of expanding her business to improve her living standards.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of dried fish for sale.  She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of dried fish for sale.
